TEXT.English: [TAB]Officially known as the "Templo Expiatorio a Cristo Rey," the first structure of the old basilica was begun in 1695 and it was not finished until 1709. The major architect was Pedro de Arrieta. It is characterized by its doric interior and marble statues of Fray Juan de Zumárraga, archbishop at the time it was started, and Juan Diego, the peasant who saw the vision of the Virgin Mary. These are featured in the altarpiece that originally held the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. (That altarpiece matches a similar one in the older chapel higher on the hill, which features the archangels Gabriel and Michael). The church was granted basilica status by Pope Pius X in 1904.[PARAGRAPH:2]The icon of Juan Diego's cloak was housed in this church from 1709 to 1974. In 1921 a bomb planted in a flower vase near the altar by an anticlerical terrorist exploded, causing great damage to the interior of the building. (In memory of this incident, the New Basilica displays an iron crucifix called "the attempt on Christ".) The cloak survived undamaged.[PARAGRAPH:2]As much of Mexico City was built on a former lake, the land was unstable and the old basilica was sinking. A new, more spacious basilica was built. The old one was closed for many years and repairs have recently finished. It is open to the public and perpetual adoration is held there. It is a very important place for Mexico City.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]这座古老的大教堂的第一座建筑始建于1695年，直到1709年才完工，正式命名为“基督教堂圣殿”。主要建筑师是佩德罗·德·阿里埃塔。它的特点是其多立克风格的内部和大理石雕像的弗雷胡安德祖玛拉加，大主教在它开始时，和胡安迭戈，农民谁看到了圣母玛利亚的愿景。这些特点是在祭坛画，最初举行的形象，我们的瓜达卢佩夫人。（这幅祭坛画与山上更高的老教堂中的一幅相似，其特点是大天使加布里埃尔和迈克尔）。公元1904年，庇护一世被授予了教堂的地位。[段：2 ]朱安迭戈的斗篷的图标在1709到1974年间被安置在这个教堂里。1921年，一名反洗礼恐怖分子在祭坛附近的花瓶里安放的炸弹爆炸，对建筑物内部造成巨大破坏。为了纪念这一事件，新的圣殿展示了一个被称为“对基督的尝试”的铁十字架。斗篷幸存下来。[段落：2 ]墨西哥城的大部分建筑都建在前一个湖上，土地不稳定，老教堂正在下沉。新建了一座更宽敞的大教堂。旧的那家关闭了许多年，最近修好了。它对公众开放，并在那里举行永久崇拜。对墨西哥城来说是一个非常重要的地方。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Refrigeration is the technology of cooling objects to temperatures below the current ambient temperature. In addition to its most obvious function of chilling or freezing foods to delay spoilage, refrigeration plays a vital part in modern human civilization. Air conditioners allow people to live and function in environments that would otherwise be too hot. And many mechanical and electronic devices require cooling to function properly.[PARAGRAPH:2]A number of advanced technologies are heavily dependent upon refrigeration. Superconductors, for instance, function best at extremely low temperatures. Space ships and suits must be refrigerated if their inhabitants are to survive in direct sunlight. And the interruption of a nuclear reactor's cooling system is likely to have extremely unfortunate consequences for those nearby.[PARAGRAPH:2]The invention of the first modern refrigeration system is in dispute, with scientists from England, Australia, Germany and the United States laying claim to the honor. The earliest refrigeration machines were built to make ice; they were constructed in the 1850s. The first home refrigeration systems were constructed around 1900, and the first air conditioning systems were implemented several years later. Residential air conditioners began to gain widespread use in the United States in the 1950s.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]制冷技术是一项将物体冷却至低于环境温度的科技。除了能够采用低温储藏，使食物的保质期更长之外，制冷技术更是现代人类文明的重要组成部分之一。空调让人们可以在过热的环境中生存和工作，其他众多的机械及电子设备也依赖制冷技术来运作。[PARAGRAPH:2]大量的现代科技依赖制冷技术。例如超导材料，只有在极低的温度环境下才能够运作良好。太空船和航天服在阳光直射下，必须通过制冷科技才能够让其乘员生存。而一个核反应堆的制冷系统对于其周围的居民来说，更是生死攸关的大事。[PARAGRAPH:2]对于到底是谁发明了第一个制冷系统的问题仍充满争议，英国、澳大利亚、德国以及美国的科学家都认为他们应当得到这个荣誉。最早的制冷机器是用于制冰，建成于19世纪50年代。第一个家庭制冷系统制成于1900年，第一个空调系统则于数年后制成。家用空调系统在20世纪50年代开始在美国普及。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is the world's largest and most powerful particle collider and the largest machine in the world. It was built by the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) between 1998 and 2008 in collaboration with over 10,000 scientists and hundreds of universities and laboratories, as well as more than 100 countries. It lies in a tunnel 27 kilometres (17 mi) in circumference and as deep as 175 metres (574 ft) beneath the France-Switzerland border near Geneva.[PARAGRAPH:2]First collisions were achieved in 2010 at an energy of 3.5 teraelectronvolts (TeV) per beam, about four times the previous world record. After upgrades it reached 6.5 TeV per beam (13 TeV total collision energy, the present world record). At the end of 2018, it entered a two-year shutdown period for further upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:2]The collider has four crossing points, around which are positioned seven detectors, each designed for certain kinds of research. The LHC primarily collides proton beams, but it can also use beams of heavy ions: Lead-lead collisions and proton-lead collisions are typically done for one month per year. The aim of the LHC's detectors is to allow physicists to test the predictions of different theories of particle physics, including measuring the properties of the Higgs boson and searching for the large family of new particles predicted by supersymmetric theories, as well as other unsolved questions of physics.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]大型强子对撞机（LHC）是世界上最大、最强大的粒子对撞机，也是世界上最大的机器。它是由欧洲核研究组织（CERN）在1998年至2008年间与10000多名科学家、数百所大学和实验室以及100多个国家合作建造的。它位于一个27公里（17英里）的隧道中，深约175米（574英尺），位于日内瓦附近的法国-瑞士边境。[段落：2 ]在2010处以每千电子束3.5个电子伏特（TEV）的能量实现了第一次碰撞，约为以前世界记录的四倍。升级后达到每束6.5tev（总碰撞能量13tev，目前的世界纪录）。在2018年底，它进入了一个两年的停机期，用于进一步升级。[段落：2 ]对撞机有四个交叉点，周围有七个探测器，每个探测器都是针对某些类型的研究而设计的。大型强子对撞机主要是碰撞质子束，但也可以使用重离子束：铅铅碰撞和质子铅碰撞通常每年进行一个月。大型强子对撞机探测器的目的是让物理学家能够测试不同粒子物理理论的预测，包括测量希格斯玻色子的性质，寻找由超对称理论预测的新粒子大家族，以及其他尚未解决的物理问题。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The origin of the Aztec people is uncertain, but elements of their own tradition suggest that they were a tribe of hunter-gatherers on the northern Mexican plateau before their appearance in Meso-America in the 12th century. The Aztec were so called for Aztlan ("White Land"), an allusion to their origins in northern Mexico. It is possible that their migration southward was part of a general movement of peoples that followed, or perhaps helped trigger, the collapse of the Toltec civilization. The Aztecs settled on islands in Lake Texcoco and in 1325 founded Tenochtitlan, which remained their chief city. The basis of the Aztecs' success in creating a great state and ultimately an empire was their remarkable system of agriculture, which featured intensive cultivation of all available land, as well as elaborate systems of irrigation and reclamation of swampland. The high productivity gained by these methods made for a rich and populous state. The empire the Aztecs established was equaled in the New World only by that of the Incas of Peru, and the brilliance of their civilization is comparable to that of other great ancient cultures of the New and the Old World.[PARAGRAPH:2]Under a succession of ambitious kings they established a dominion that eventually stretched over most of present-day Mexico. By commerce and conquest, Tenochtitlan came to rule an empire of 400 to 500 small states, comprising by 1519 some five to six million people spread over 80,000 square miles. Valor in war, notably in the feared Jaguar Warrior formations, was the surest path to advancement in Aztec society, which was caste- and class-divided but nonetheless vertically fluid. The priestly and bureaucratic classes were involved in the administration of the empire, while at the bottom of society were classes of serfs, indentured servants, and outright slaves. The incredible story of a wandering tribe that was able to build an empire in one century (from the beginning of the 14th century to the beginning of the 15th) can be largely explained by three main factors: the Aztec religion, the thriving trade routes centered on Tenochtilan, and Aztec military organization. In 1502 the ninth emperor Montezuma II (1502-1520) succeeded his uncle Ahuitzotl as the leader of an empire that had reached its greatest extent, stretching from what is now northern Mexico to Honduras and Nicaragua. The Aztec empire was still expanding, and its society still evolving, when its progress was halted in 1519 by the appearance of Spanish adventurers.[PARAGRAPH:2]For all its apparent strength, the Aztec Empire had vulnerabilities that the Spanish were able to exploit. Aztec rule was based upon a system of tribute and fear over the surrounding peoples; every year, they were forced to pay the Aztecs money, goods, and a supply of captives to be sacrificed on the altar. Taking advantage of this resentment of their Aztec overlords, the tiny Spanish force was able to attract a massive army of some 30,000 Mesoamericans of many different tribes. After mistaking the Spanish for gods and inviting them into Tenochtitlan, Montezuma was taken prisoner by Hernando Cortes and died in custody. Montezuma's successors, Cuitlahuac and Cuauhtemoc, were unable to stave off the force raised by the conquistadors and, with the Spanish sack of Tenochtitlan in 1521, the Aztec empire came to an end.
TEXT.Chinese: 阿兹特克人的具体起源尚无法确定，不过根据其本身的传说所透露的信息，可以推测他们在公元12世纪到达中美洲之前，是一个在墨西哥高原上以捕猎和采集为生的部族。“阿兹特克人”得名于“阿兹特兰”，意为“白色的土地”，似乎暗示着他们是来自于北墨西哥。他们的南迁可能与托尔特克文明的衰亡及其后大规模的民族迁徙有关，甚至可能是该古文明衰亡的直接原因。南迁后的阿兹特克人定居于特斯科科湖中的群岛，并于1325年在此建立了特诺奇蒂特兰城，此后该城的重要地位一直得以保持。阿兹特克得以成功建立强大的国家甚至后来的大帝国，一个重要的基础就是他们优良的农业技术，几乎每寸可用土地都获得精耕细作，通过建立复杂的灌溉系统，排干沼泽。这一切都提供了极高的农业生产力，足以支持富庶的城市和众多的人口。阿兹特克人所建立的帝国在新大陆上只有秘鲁的印加帝国能够匹敌，其文明的辉煌程度完全不逊色于新旧大陆上其他任何伟大的古文明。[PARAGRAPH:2]连续数代野心勃勃的国王使得帝国的疆界覆盖了现今的墨西哥的绝大部分地区。通过由商业扩张和武力征服，特诺奇蒂特兰统治着由四五百个小邦组成的巨大帝国。在1519年其人口达五百至六百万，面积超过八万平方英里。通过英勇作战，成为令人畏惧的美洲虎战士队伍中的一员，是阿兹特克人提升自己社会地位的最佳途径，他们的社会虽然等级森严，但还是可以上下流动的。祭司与官僚阶级可以参与帝国的管理，而社会的最底层则包括农奴、佣工以及奴隶。一个游牧民族居然仅用一个世纪的时间（约14世纪初至15世纪初）就能够建立这样一个庞大的帝国，是由于三个最重要的因素：阿兹特克人的宗教信仰，以特诺奇蒂特兰为中心的繁荣商路，以及阿兹特克人的军事组织。1502年，蒙特祖玛二世（1502-1520在位）继其叔父阿辉佐特尔之后成为阿兹特克帝国的第九任统治者，此时的帝国已达到了强盛的顶峰，控制范围自今墨西哥北部一直延伸到到洪都拉斯和尼加拉瓜。但是阿兹特克帝国的扩张及其社会的发展随着1519年西班牙的冒险家的到达而突然中断。[PARAGRAPH:2]阿兹特克帝国表面上虽然非常强大，但西班牙人发现其内部存在着许多弱点。阿兹特克依靠武力强迫周围民族向其纳贡。每年这些小民族都要上缴大量财物，以及用于献祭的活人。一小股西班牙武装利用这些民族对阿兹特克统治者的反抗情绪，因而召集到来自中美洲各部族的军队共三万多人。而蒙特祖玛却将西班牙人奉若神明，邀请他们访问特诺奇蒂特兰，结果被赫尔南多·科尔特斯抓获并死于狱中。他的继任者奎特拉华克和库奥提莫克均无法击退西班牙征服者，最终西班牙人于1521年攻占特诺奇蒂特兰，阿兹特克帝国就此灭亡。

TEXT.English: [H1]Unique Powers and Historical Victories[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]There are no leader traits in Rhye's and Fall of Civilization. They were removed and replaced with a system of Unique Powers: each civilization has one unique ability according to its historical role. Given the different start years, each civilization have its own modifiers (which rendered leader traits useless). Their effect are summarized in the civ selection screen, at the beginning of the game, with general parameters rated 1 to 5 stars.[PARAGRAPH:2]Each Civilization can achieve a "Historical Victory" fulfilling 3 goals that differ from civ to civ and match their own historical background or just what they were trying to achieve. This way even a civilization with a weaker starting situation such as Aztecs has a chance of success. When 2 goals out of 3 are achieved, a "Triumphal Arch" is automatically built in player's capital, triggering a Golden Age.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dawn of Civilization adds historical victories for religions, which are called Unique Religious Victories (URVs). Civilizations can complete the URV of their state religion, while civilizations without access to a state religion have the opportunity to win by completing the Polytheism (when running Pantheon) or Secularism URV. The Religious Victory also differs from the Historical Victory that all goal conditions have to be fulfilled at the same time to win, and that no reward for completing two goals is available. Also, many goals are global and take the situation of all civilizations with that state religion into account.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]特色专长与历史胜利条件[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]在“文明的兴衰”中取消了领袖特质概念，代之以“特色专长”系统：每个文明根据其真实历史设置了一种特殊能力。根据诞生年代的不同，每个文明还有一些隐藏属性，因此不再需要领袖特质的作用。隐藏属性的效果可在游戏开始的文明选择界面查看，并以1至5颗星进行评级。[PARAGRAPH:2]每个文明如能完成根据其真实历史背景所设置的3个目标，将可赢得“历史胜利”（这些目标在真实历史中可能并未真正达成）。这样即便是那些初始状态处于劣势的文明（例如阿兹特克）也有机会获胜。在完成3个历史目标中的2个之后，玩家的首都将自动建成一座“凯旋门”，同时文明将会进入黄金时代。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Oghuz, Oguz or Ghuzz Turks were a western Turkic people who spoke the Oghuz languages from the Common branch of Turkic language family. The name Oghuz is a Common Turkic word for "tribe". By the 10th century, Islamic sources were calling Muslim Oghuzes, as opposed to shamanists or Buddhists, of Turkmens. By the 12th century, this term had passed into Byzantine usage and the Oghuz were overwhelmingly Muslim. [PARAGRAPH:2]Oghuz warriors served in almost all Islamic armies of the Middle East from the 1000s onwards, in Byzantium from the 800's, and even in Spain and Morocco. In later centuries, they adapted and applied their own traditions and institutions to the ends of the Islamic world and emerged as empire-builders with a constructive sense of statecraft. The militarism that the Oghuz empires were very well known for was rooted in their centuries-long nomadic lifestyle. [PARAGRAPH:2]In general, they were a herding society that possessed certain military advantages that sedentary societies did not have, particularly mobility. Alliances by marriage and kinship, and systems of "social distance" based on family relationships were the connective tissues of their society. In Oghuz traditions, "society was simply the result of the growth of individual families".
TEXT.Chinese: [表]奥古兹、奥古兹或古兹土耳其人是一个说奥古兹语的西方土库曼人，来自土库曼语系的共同分支。奥古斯这个名字是土耳其语中“部落”的常用词。到了10世纪，伊斯兰消息来源称土耳其的穆斯林奥古斯人，而不是萨满教或佛教徒。到了12世纪，这个词已经成为拜占庭语的用法，奥古斯人绝大多数是穆斯林。[段：2 ]奥古兹战士在中东的几乎所有伊斯兰军队服役，从1000年代起，在Byzantium，从800，甚至在西班牙和摩洛哥。在后来的几个世纪里，他们将自己的传统和制度适应并应用到伊斯兰世界的尽头，并以建设性的治国理念成为帝国的建设者。奥古斯帝国众所周知的军国主义根源于他们长达几个世纪的游牧生活方式。[第2段]一般来说，他们是一个放牧社会，具有一定的军事优势，久坐不动的社会，特别是流动性。以婚姻、亲属关系为纽带的联盟和以家庭关系为基础的“社会距离”体系是他们社会的联结组织。在奥古斯传统中，“社会只是家庭个体成长的结果”。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A trading company is an association formed by investors or shareholders for the purpose of trade, exploration and colonisation. Typically, these companies were formed from the sixteenth century onwards by groups of European investors to underwrite and profit from the exploration of Africa, India, the Caribbean and North America, usually under the patronage of one state, which issued the company's charter. Notable companies include British East India Company and Dutch Verenigde Oostindische Compagnie.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]贸易公司是通过直接投资或发行股票建立，从事贸易、探险和殖民活动的商业机构。欧洲自16世纪起投资建立了多家贸易公司，以资助在非洲、印度、加勒比和北美地区的探险，分享殖民收益。贸易公司往往受到一国政府的保护，拥有政府颁发的特许状。历史上最著名的贸易公司包括英国东印度公司、荷兰东印度公司等。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Ziggurats were religious centers dedicated to the gods of ancient Mesopotamia. Each was comprised of a temple built upon of a series of tiered, earthen platforms, raising the building atop and dwarfing the surrounding structures. Every cities Ziggurat was dedicated to one specific god. These individual dedications sprung from the Sumerian belief that each temple was not a place of worship, but the actual home of the god. Belief held that the gods originated from the distant mountains, and it is thought that the ziggurats were raised in order to make the new dwellings of the gods a little more like home.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]这些自贡是古代美索不达米亚诸神的宗教中心。每一座都是由一系列层叠的土平台组成的寺庙，将建筑抬高，使周围的建筑相形见绌。每一座城市的紫光都献给一位特定的神。这些个人的奉献源于苏美尔人的信仰，即每座寺庙不是一个礼拜的地方，而是上帝的真正家园。人们认为神灵起源于遥远的山脉，人们认为这些自贡是为了使神灵的新住所更像一个家。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Turkic peoples are a collection of ethnic groups that live in central, eastern, northern, and western Asia as well as parts of eastern Europe. They speak languages belonging to the Turkic language family and share, to varying degrees, certain cultural traits and historical backgrounds. Traditional national and cultural symbols of the Turkic peoples include wolves in Turkic mythology and tradition; as well as the color blue, iron, and fire. Turquoise blue (the word turquoise comes from the French word meaning "Turkish") is the color of the stone turquoise still used in jewelry and as a protection against evil eye.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term Turkic represents a broad ethno-linguistic group of peoples including existing societies such as Altai, Azerbaijanis, Balkars, Bashkirs, Chuvashes, Crimean Karaites, Gagauz, Karachays, Karakalpaks, Kazakhs, Khakas, Krymchaks, Kyrgyz people, Nogais, Qashqai, Tatars, Turkmens, Turkish people, Tuvans, Uyghurs, Uzbeks, and Yakuts and as well as ancient and medieval states such as Dingling, Bulgars, Alat, Basmyl, Onogurs, Shatuo, Chuban, Göktürks, Oghuz Turks, Kankalis, Khazars, Khiljis, Kipchaks, Kumans, Karluks, Bahri Mamluks, Ottoman Turks, Seljuk Turks, Tiele, Timurids, Turgeshes, Yenisei Kirghiz, and possibly Huns, Tuoba, Xiongnu. It is generally agreed that the first Turkic people lived in a region extending from Central Asia to Siberia, with the majority of them living in China historically, establishing themselves after the 6th century BC. [PARAGRAPH:2]The earliest separate Turkic peoples appeared on the peripheries of the late Xiongnu Confederation about 200 BC (contemporaneous with the Chinese Han Dynasty) and probably lived as nomads for many years before establishing the Turkic Khaganate or Göktürk Empire in the 6th century. The first mention of Turks was in a Chinese text that mentioned trade between Turk tribes and the Sogdians along the Silk Road. The first recorded use of "Turk" as a political name appears as a 6th-century reference to the word pronounced in Modern Chinese as Tujue. The Ashina clan migrated from Li-jien (modern Zhelai Zhai) to the Rouran seeking inclusion in their confederacy and protection from the prevalent dynasty. The tribe were famed metalsmiths and were granted land near a mountain quarry that looked like a helmet, from which they were said to have gotten their name tujue. A century later, their power had increased such that they conquered the Rouran Khaganate and established the Gök Empire. The Khanate retained elements of its original shamanistic religion, Tengriism, although it received missionaries of Buddhist monks and practiced a syncretic religion. The Göktürks were the first Turkic people to write Old Turkic in a runic script, the Orkhon script. The Khanate was also the first state known as "Turk". It eventually collapsed due to a series of dynastic conflicts, but many states and peoples later used the name "Turk". [PARAGRAPH:2]The main migration of Turkic peoples and related groups occurred in medieval times in many waves, when they spread across most of Asia and into Europe and the Middle East. In the Volga region one group of Bulgars settled and mixed with local Volga Finns to become the Volga Bulgars in what is today Tatarstan. Other Bulgars settled in Southeastern Europe in the 7th and 8th centuries, and mixed with the Slavic population, adopting what eventually became the Slavic Bulgarian language. As these peoples founded states in the area between Mongolia and Transoxiana, they met Muslims, and most of them gradually adopted Islam. Small groups of Turkic people practice other religions, including Christians, Jews, Buddhists, and Zoroastrians. The Khazars, for example, converted to Judaism in the 8th or 9th century. Everywhere, Turkic groups mixed with the local populations to varying degrees.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the Muslim world, Turkic dynasties emerged as rulers of great and powerful empires. In the 11th century, Oghuz and other tribes captured and dominated various countries under the leadership of the Seljuk dynasty and eventually captured the territories of the Abbasid dynasty and the Byzantine Empire, forming the Great Seljuk Empire; The Ottoman Empire (1299鈥?922), that came to dominate not only the Middle East, but also even southeastern Europe, parts of southwestern Russia, and northern Africa; The Timurid Empire were a Turkic Uzbek-based empire founded in the late 14th century by Timurlane, a descendant of Genghis Khan; The Mughal Empire, a Turkic-founded Indian empire that, at its greatest territorial extent, ruled most of the South Asia from the early 16th to the early 18th centuries; And the Iranian Safavid and Afsharid dynasties, who formed what has come to be the modern Iran state.[PARAGRAPH:2]The dominance of the nomads ended in the 16th century, as firearms allowed settled peoples to gain control of the region. Russia, China, and other powers expanded into the region and captured the bulk of Central Asia by the end of the 19th century.[PARAGRAPH:2]vFrom the mid-19th century until almost the end of the 20th century, most of Central Asia was part of the Russian Empire (and later the Soviet Union). After the collapse of the Russian Empire living either in the Soviet Union or (after a short-lived First East Turkestan Republic) in the Chinese Republic.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1991, after the disintegration of the Soviet Union, five Turkic states gained their independence. These were Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Turkmenistan, and Uzbekistan. Other Turkic regions such as Tatarstan, Tuva, and Yakutia remained in the Russian Federation. Chinese Turkestan remained part of the People's Republic of China. [PARAGRAPH:2]Immediately after the independence of the Turkic states, Turkey began seeking diplomatic relations with them. Over time, political meetings between the Turkic countries increased and led to the establishment of TÜRKSOY in 1993 and later the Turkic Council in 2009.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]土库曼人是居住在中亚，东亚，北亚和西亚以及东欧部分地区的种族群体的集合。他们说属于土库曼语族的语言，并在不同程度上共享某些文化特征和历史背景。土库曼民族的传统民族和文化符号包括土库曼神话和传统中的狼；以及蓝色，铁色和火色。绿松石蓝色（绿松石这个词来自法语，意思是“土耳其语”）是绿松石色的颜色，仍用于珠宝中，可以防止邪恶之眼。[PARAGRAPH：2]“土耳其语”一词代表着广泛的民族语言群体包括现有社会的人民，例如阿尔泰，阿塞拜疆人，巴尔卡斯，巴什基尔人，楚瓦什人，克里米亚人Karaites，Gagauz，Karachays，Karakalpaks，哈萨克人，哈卡斯，Krymchaks，吉尔吉斯斯坦人，诺加斯，加沙，塔塔尔人，土库曼斯坦，土耳其人，图万斯，乌兹别克和雅库特，以及古代和中世纪的州，例如丁令，布尔加斯，阿拉特，巴斯米勒，Onogurs，沙托，楚班，Göktürks，Oghuz Turks，Kankalis，Khazars，Khiljis，Kipchaks，Kumans，Karukks，Bahri Mamluks，Otto ，塞尔柱克·特克斯（Seljuk Turks），铁勒（Tiele），帖木儿（Timurids），土库曼斯（Turgeshes），叶尼塞·柯吉兹（Yenisei Kirghiz），以及匈奴人（Tuns），托努（Tuoba），匈奴（Xunnunu）。人们普遍同意，第一批土库曼人居住在从中亚延伸到西伯利亚的地区，他们中的大多数历史上都生活在中国，并在公元前六世纪之后建立了自己的国家。 [PARAGRAPH：2]最早的土库曼人出现在公元前200年左右的匈奴联盟（与中国汉朝同时期）的外围，并在6世纪建立土库曼人卡加纳特或古特库尔克帝国之前曾游牧多年。第一次提到土耳其人是在中文文本中，其中提到了沿着丝绸之路的土耳其人部落与苏格人之间的贸易。最早记录到的“土耳其语”作为政治名称的用法出现在6世纪，指的是现代汉语中称为Tujue的单词。 Ashina氏族从Li-jien（现代哲来斋）迁移到Rouran，寻求纳入他们的同盟关系并保护其免受盛朝王朝的侵害。这个部落是著名的金属匠，被授予靠近一个看起来像头盔的采石场的土地，据说他们从那里得到了名字tujue。一个世纪后，他们的力量增强，以致他们征服了Rouran Khaganate，并建立了Gök帝国。尽管汗国接受了僧侣的传教士并实行合一宗教，但它保留了其原始萨满教的成分-腾格里教。 Göktürks是最早用土库曼文（Orkhon剧本）写古土库曼文的土库曼人。汗国也是第一个被称为“土耳其人”的州。由于一系列王朝冲突，它最终崩溃了，但是后来许多州和人民使用了“土耳其”这个名字。 [PARAGRAPH：2]土库曼人和相关群体的主要移民发生在中世纪，经历了许多波澜，当时它们遍及亚洲大部分地区，并扩散到欧洲和中东。在伏尔加河地区，一群保加利亚人定居并与当地的伏尔加河芬兰人混在一起，成为今天的today斯坦共和国的伏尔加河布尔加斯人。其他的布尔加斯人在7、8世纪定居在东南欧，并与斯拉夫人口混合，最终采用了斯拉夫保加利亚语。当这些民族在蒙古和特罗克萨纳州之间建立国家时，他们遇到了穆斯林，其中大多数人逐渐采用了伊斯兰教。一小群土库曼人从事其他宗教活动，包括基督徒，犹太人，佛教徒和琐罗亚斯德教徒。例如，卡扎尔人在8世纪或9世纪converted依了犹太教。各地，土库曼人团体都不同程度地与当地人口混合。[PARAGRAPH：2]在穆斯林世界中，土库曼王朝成为强大而强大的帝国的统治者。在11世纪，奥古兹（Oghuz）和其他部落在塞尔柱克王朝的领导下占领并统治着各个国家，并最终占领了阿拔斯王朝和拜占庭帝国的领土，形成了伟大的塞尔柱克帝国；奥斯曼帝国（1299–1922年）不仅统治着中东，而且甚至统治了欧洲东南部，俄罗斯西南部的部分地区以及北非。帖木儿帝国（Timurid Empire）是成吉思汗的后裔帖木兰（Timurlane）在14世纪后期建立的基于乌兹别克斯坦的土库曼帝国。莫卧儿帝国（Mughal Empire）是土库曼人建立的印度帝国，在最大的领土范围内，从16世纪初到18世纪初统治着南亚的大部分地区；伊朗的萨法维（Safavid）和阿夫沙里（Afsharid）王朝组成了后来的现代伊朗国。[段]：2]游牧民的统治于16世纪结束，枪支使定居者可以控制该地区。俄罗斯，中国和其他大国向该地区扩张，并在19世纪末占领了中亚的大部分地区。

TEXT.English: [TAB]At the risk of dramatic oversimplification - a stock exchange is an organization which allows "brokers" to buy and sell "stocks" and "bonds." A stock represents part ownership in a company, and a bond is a loan to a company, which the company guarantees to repay with interest. If the company does well, the investors make money; if the company does poorly (or fails entirely) the investors lose money.[PARAGRAPH:1]The primary benefit of a stock exchange to society is that it allows companies to concentrate a large amount of wealth to accomplish something that no individual (or perhaps government) would be able to afford. In the nineteenth century, for example, construction of the United States' railroad network was in large part financed by individuals who purchased shares of railroad companies. Earlier in history, the great British and Dutch trading companies were similarly financed.[PARAGRAPH:1]For a long period of history, the English city of London was the financial center of the world. The London Stock Exchange is one of the largest exchanges in the world, as well as one of the oldest. Though officially founded in 1801, it can trace its origins to the late seventeenth century, when - the brokers having been expelled from the Royal Exchange for rowdiness - buying and selling stocks took place in London coffee houses.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]面临着严重的过分简单化的风险——证券交易所是一个允许“经纪人”买卖“股票”和“债券”的组织。股票代表公司的部分所有权，债券是对公司的贷款，公司保证偿还利息。如果公司做得好，投资者赚钱；如果公司业绩不佳（或完全失败），投资者就会赔钱。[第1段]证券交易所对社会的主要好处是允许公司集中大量财富来完成个人（或政府）所能负担得起的事情。例如，在19世纪，美国铁路网的建设在很大程度上是由购买铁路公司股份的个人出资的。在历史上，英国和荷兰的贸易公司都有类似的资金。[段：1 ]长期以来，英国的伦敦市是世界金融中心。伦敦证券交易所是世界上最大的交易所之一，也是最古老的交易所之一。虽然正式成立于1801年，但它的起源可以追溯到17世纪末，当时——经纪人被驱逐出皇家喧闹交易所——买卖股票发生在伦敦的咖啡馆。

TEXT.English: [H1]Extended worldbuilder[\H1][NEWLINE][H2]Platybuilder[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Dawn of Civilization incorporates the Platybuilder. Platybuilder is extended version of the regular Worldbuilder, created by Platyping. The old worldbuilder has limited opportunity to edit a current game. You could not even edit the amount of gold in your treasury! Platybuilder allows you to change almost every aspect of the game, ranging from detailed player data to the amount of damage an individual units has to extra yield a building provides on top of its regular bonus.[NEWLINE][H2]Extra Dawn of Civilization elements[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The Dawn of Civilization Platybuilder features a couple of new features which are not available in the regular Platybuilder, often because these change elements which are unique to Dawn of Civilization (or Rhye's and Fall mods in general).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Extended map editing[\BOLD][NEWLINE]When you select Map Mode, you can view/edit the flipzones, stability maps and warmaps of each civilization. Additionally, the CNM and settlervalue/warvalue of the tile appears on top of the screen. When selecting one of these modes, an overlay will be placed on the map, indicating the value of a tiles. You can edit the values of each tiles by selecting a value in the menu and clicking on the tile. The multiple tile tool introduced by Platybuilder can be used to edit multiple tiles simultaneously. Note that these changes only apply to the current game. If you want to make permanent changes, you need to export the changes (export button) and copy the changes into Areas.py. The maps can be found the the Export folder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Legend for the maps[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Flipzone:[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone for both human and AI[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Extra flipzone for the AI only[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Stability Maps:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for the AI to settle there[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]War Maps:[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: 2[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE]Orange[COLOR_REVERT]: 4[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: 6[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Light green[COLOR_REVERT]: 8[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: 10[NEWLINE][COLOR_BLUE]Blue[COLOR_REVERT]: 12[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Shortcuts:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Right-clicking on a tile will set the tile to its default value, which is non core in core mode, settlervalue 20 in settlervalue mode or warvalue 0 in warvalue mode.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The export button automatically detects if you made any changes to the maps. It will not bother to export if you did not make any changes. You can force an export by shift-clicking on the export button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2]Civilization specific modifiers[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The player data screen has been modified so you can view and edit several civ specific modifiers. These changes will only apply to the current game. If you want to make permanent changes, you have to edit Modifiers.py.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2]More game options[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Dawn of Civilization introduces a couple of new options. These options can be edited during a game in the GameOption screen in the Extended Worldbuilder. These options include; enabling/disabling secondary civs, enabling/disabling DoC/RFC features and more.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2]StoredData Editor[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]WARNING: Be cautious with this feature. Only edit if you know what your are doing. Changing stuff could break the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The StoredData is a method introduced in RFC mods to save data, which can not be saved in the savegame file itself. Various UHV counters are stored in the StoredData for example. Normal players will probably have no use for this editor, but for modders this tool can be very helpful keeping track of the progress of a certain game or test new features. Do use the editor with care. If you accidentally change something, you can restore everything to the state when you opened the editor with the reset button.[NEWLINE]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]扩展WorkBuffer-[\H1] [NealLe] [H2] PalyBuudid[\H2] [段落：2 ]曙光文明结合了Platybuilder。Platybuilder是常规Worldbuilder的扩展版本，由Platyping创建。旧的worldbuilder编辑当前游戏的机会有限。你甚至不能编辑你的金库里的黄金数量！TopyBu建器允许你改变游戏的几乎每一个方面，从详细的玩家数据到一个单位的额外伤害量，一个建筑物在它的正常奖励之上提供额外的收益。[新行] [H2]文明元素的额外曙光[AH2] [段落：2 ]文明的曙光。它们在常规的Platybuilder中不可用，通常是因为这些元素改变了文明曙光（或者通常是Rhye's和Fall mods）所特有的元素。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]扩展地图编辑[\BOLD][NEWLINE]选择地图模式时，可以查看/编辑每个文明的flipzones、稳定性地图和warmaps。此外，屏幕顶部还会显示磁贴的CNM和setterervalue/warvalue。选择其中一种模式时，将在地图上放置一个覆盖，指示平铺的值。通过在菜单中选择一个值并单击每个平铺，可以编辑每个平铺的值。Platybuilder引入的multiple tile工具可以同时编辑多个tile。请注意，这些更改仅适用于当前游戏。如果要进行永久性更改，则需要导出更改（“导出”按钮）并将更改复制到Areas.py中。地图可以在导出文件夹中找到。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]地图的图例[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Flipzone:[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]浅紫色[COLOR_REVERT]：人和人工智能的Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]红色[COLOR_REVERT]：仅人工智能的额外Flipzone[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]稳定性地图：[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN CYAN CYAN[COLOR_REVERT]：核心[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]绿色[COLOR_REVERT]：历史[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]黄色[COLOR_REVERT]：有争议的[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]红色[COLOR_REVERT]：外国核心[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT紫色]浅紫色[COLOR_REVERT]：禁止人工智能在那里定居[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]战争地图：[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]红色[COLOR_REVERT]：2[换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符]：10[换行符][换行符][换行符][换行符]蓝色[换行符]：12[换行符][换行符][加粗]快捷键：[将磁贴设置为其默认值，即核心模式下的非核心值、结算值模式下的结算值20或warvalue模式下的warvalue 0。[换行][图标项目符号]导出按钮会自动检测是否对映射进行了任何更改。如果您不做任何更改，就不会麻烦导出。你可以通过点击出口按钮来强制导出。[新行] [NealLe] [H2]文明特定修饰符[\H2] [段落：2 ]玩家数据屏幕已经被修改，这样你就可以查看和编辑多个CIV特定修饰符。这些更改仅适用于当前游戏。如果你想进行永久性的修改，你必须编辑修饰符。P.[新行] [NealLe] [H2]更多的游戏选项[AH2] [段落：2 ]文明黎明介绍了一些新的选择。这些选项可以在游戏期间在扩展Worldbuilder的GameOption屏幕中编辑。这些选项包括：启用/禁用辅助CIVS，启用/禁用DOC/RFC功能和更多。[新行] [H2L]存储数据编辑器[\H2] [段落：2 ]警告：请谨慎使用此功能。只有当你知道你在做什么的时候才能编辑。更改内容可能会破坏游戏。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]StoredData是RFC mods中引入的一种保存数据的方法，不能保存在save game文件本身中。例如，各种超高压计数器存储在StoredData中。普通玩家可能不会使用这个编辑器，但对于modders来说，这个工具可以非常有助于跟踪某个游戏的进度或测试新功能。一定要小心使用编辑器。如果您意外更改了某些内容，则可以使用“重置”按钮将所有内容还原到打开编辑器时的状态。[NEWLINE]

TEXT.English: [TAB]Forts in modern usage often refer to space set aside by governments for a permanent military facility; these often do not have any actual fortifications, and can have specializations (military barracks, administration, medical facilities, or intelligence). In the United States usage, forts specifically refer to US Army bases; US Marine Corps bases are referred to as camps.[PARAGRAPH:1]However there are some modern fortifications that are referred to as forts. These are typically small semi permanent fortifications. In urban combat they are built by upgrading existing structures such as houses or public buildings. In field warfare they are often log, sandbag or gabion type construction.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]现代使用的堡垒通常是指政府为永久性军事设施留出的空间；这些堡垒通常没有任何实际的防御工事，并且可以有专门的设施（军营、行政、医疗设施或情报）。在美国的使用中，堡垒特别指美军基地；美国海军陆战队基地被称为营地。[段：1 ]然而，有一些现代防御工事被称为堡垒。这些是典型的小型半永久性防御工事。在城市战斗中，他们是通过升级现有的建筑，如房屋或公共建筑来建造的。在野战中，它们通常是原木、沙袋或石笼式建筑。

TEXT.English: [H1]Reformation[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The Protestant religion is not founded like the other religions. Instead, the discovery of Printing Press by a civilization with Catholic state religion triggers the Reformation. All Catholic civilizations then have to decide if they want to convert to Protestantism and gain additional gold from the dissolution of monasteries, foregoing the benefits of the Apostolic Palace. When a civilization decides to convert, all of its cities immediately change their religion to Protestantism. Large cities also have a chance of keeping Catholicism or gaining Protestantism regardless of your decision.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]改革[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]新教的创立不同于其他宗教，而是由发现印刷机的天主教国家引发的一场改革所创立的。所有的天主教文明都可以选择是否改宗新教并且通过解散修道院来获得一笔额外的资金，并且离开教皇宫的控制。当一个文明决定改革时， 它所有的的城市将会把天主教信仰变为新教。大城市也有可能无视你的决定保持天主教信仰或者引进新教。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A man of war is an armed naval vessel. The term often refers to ship armed with cannon and propelled primarily by sails as opposed to a galley propelled primarily by oars. The man of war was developed in the Mediterranean in the 15th century from earlier roundships with the addition of a second mast to form the carrack. The 16th century saw the carrack evolve into the galleon and then the ship of the line.[PARAGRAPH:1]A first-rate man of war, such as the HMS Victory was armed with 100 or more guns (as many as 120). The 90-gun HMS Coronation was a second-rate man of war. A seventy-four, a common ship carrying 74 guns, was a third-rate man of war. A sixth-rate man of war carried only 20 guns. First and second-rate men of war had three gun decks. It took over 2,000 oak and elm trees to build a second-rate man of war.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]一个军人是一艘武装的海军舰艇。这一术语通常指配备大炮并主要由帆推动的船舶，而不是主要由桨推动的帆船。15世纪，地中海地区从早期的圆船上发展出了战争战士，并增加了第二根桅杆，形成了回廊。十六世纪，战车演变成了帆船，然后演变成了舰船。[段：1 ]一个一流的战争人，如HMS胜利号装备了100支或更多的枪（多达120枚）。90枪的皇家海军加冕典礼是一个二流的人的战争。一艘74门火炮的普通战舰是一个三流的战士。一个六流的战士只带了20支枪。一等兵和二等兵有三个炮台。它用了2000多棵橡树和榆树建成了一个二流的战士。

TEXT.English: [H1]Nyatsimba Mutota[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Mwene Mutapa[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]1420? - 1450 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]The Mutapa empire is thought to have been established by the Rozvi whose descendants include the modern-day Shona people. The founder of the ruling dynasty was Mbire, a semi-mythical potentate active in the 13th century. Mbire's purported great-great-grandson Nyatsimba was the first ruler to assume the title of the "owner of the Conquered Lands and Peoples", which became hereditary among his descendants. Nyatsimba Mutota, Chief of the Karanga Tribe of the Shonas, founded the Kingdom of Monomotapa in present day Zimbabwe and Mozambique circa 1420.[PARAGRAPH:1]After 1400 one clan of the Shona tribe, the Rozwi clan, became dominant over the others. Mutota expanded northward to the Zambezi River. This prompted him to move the Shona capital from Great Zimbabwe to Khami in 1440; Khami was also closer to the gold deposits that were still being worked. Because he was successful in his military endeavors, the Shona began calling him Mwene Mutapa, meaning "Great Plunderer." Ultimately, this became the name of his kingdom, too; the Portuguese spelled it Monomotapa.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Nyatsimba Mutota[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Mwene Mutapa[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]1420? - 1450 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]The Mutapa empire is thought to have been established by the Rozvi whose descendants include the modern-day Shona people. The founder of the ruling dynasty was Mbire, a semi-mythical potentate active in the 13th century. Mbire's purported great-great-grandson Nyatsimba was the first ruler to assume the title of the "owner of the Conquered Lands and Peoples", which became hereditary among his descendants. Nyatsimba Mutota, Chief of the Karanga Tribe of the Shonas, founded the Kingdom of Monomotapa in present day Zimbabwe and Mozambique circa 1420.[PARAGRAPH:1]After 1400 one clan of the Shona tribe, the Rozwi clan, became dominant over the others. Mutota expanded northward to the Zambezi River. This prompted him to move the Shona capital from Great Zimbabwe to Khami in 1440; Khami was also closer to the gold deposits that were still being worked. Because he was successful in his military endeavors, the Shona began calling him Mwene Mutapa, meaning "Great Plunderer." Ultimately, this became the name of his kingdom, too; the Portuguese spelled it Monomotapa.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Benin Empire or Edo Empire was a large pre-colonial African state of modern Nigeria. According to one traditional account, the original people and founders of the Benin Empire, the Bini, were initially ruled by the Ogisos (Kings of the Sky). The city of Ibinu (later called Benin City) was founded in 1180 AD. About 36 known Ogiso are accounted for as rulers of the empire. [PARAGRAPH:2]Oranmiyan, the son of Ekaladerhan aka Oduduwa, agreed to go to Benin. He spent some years in Benin and came back to Ife after his wife gave birth to a son named Eweka. Eweka I became the first Oba of Benin. In 1440, Oba Ewuare (Ewuare the Great) came to power and turned the city-state into an empire. Around 1470, he named the new state Edo. The Oba had become the paramount power within the region. Oba Ewuare, the first Golden Age Oba, is credited with turning Benin City into a military fortress protected by moats and walls. It was from this bastion that he launched his military campaigns and began the expansion of the kingdom from the Edo-speaking heartlands. The lands of Idah, Owo, Akure all came under the central authority of the Edo Empire.[PARAGRAPH:2]At its maximum extent the empire is claimed by the Edos to have extended from Onitsha in the east, through the forested southwestern region of Nigeria and into the present-day nation of Ghana. The Ga peoples of Ghana trace their ancestry to the ancient Kingdom of Benin. The state developed an advanced artistic culture especially in its famous artifacts of bronze, iron and ivory. These include bronze wall plaques and life-sized bronze heads of the Obas of Benin. The most common artifact is based on Queen Idia, porpularly called the FESTAC mask. Benin grew increasingly rich during the 16th and 17th centuries on the slave trade with Europe; slaves from enemy states of the interior were sold, and carried to the Americas in Dutch and Portuguese ships. The Bight of Benin's shore soon came to be known as the "Slave Coast."[PARAGRAPH:2]The city and empire of Benin declined after 1700, but revived in the 19th century with the development of the trade in palm oil, enslaved captives, and textiles. To preserve Benin's independence, bit by bit the Oba banned the export of goods from Benin, until the trade was exclusively in palm oil.[PARAGRAPH:2]Benin resisted signing a protectorate treaty with Great Britain through most of the 1880s and 1890s. However, after the slaying of eight British representatives in Benin territory, a 'Punitive Expedition' was launched in 1897, in which a British force, under the command of Admiral Sir Harry Rawson, conquered and burned the city, destroying much of the country's treasured art and dispersing nearly all that remained. The portrait figures, busts, and groups created in iron, carved ivory, and especially in brass (conventionally called the "Benin Bronzes") made in Benin are now displayed in museums around the world.
TEXT.Chinese: 贝宁帝国或江户帝国是一个前殖民地时期的非洲现代尼日利亚国家。根据一个传统的说法，贝宁帝国的原始人和创始人，比尼人，最初是由天空之王统治的。伊比努城（后称贝宁城）建于公元1180年。已知的约36位奥吉奥人被认为是帝国的统治者。[段落：2]奥兰米扬，埃卡拉德尔汗，也就是奥杜瓦的儿子，同意去贝宁。他在贝宁呆了几年，在妻子生下一个儿子，名叫埃夫卡之后，他回到了伊夫。埃韦卡一世成为贝宁的第一个欧巴人。1440年，奥巴鄂瓦雷（鄂瓦雷大帝）掌权，把这个城邦变成了一个帝国。1470年左右，他将新州命名为江户。奥巴马已经成为该地区的最高权力机构。奥巴鄂瓦雷，第一个黄金时代的Oba，被认为是把贝宁城变成了一个由护城河和城墙保护的军事要塞。正是从这个堡垒，他发动了军事行动，并开始从江户语的中心地带扩张王国。伊达、奥沃、阿库拉的土地都归江户帝国的中央管辖[段落：2]在最大程度上，伊多人声称帝国已经从东部的奥尼沙延伸到尼日利亚西南部的森林地区，直到今天的加纳。加纳的加人将他们的祖先追溯到古老的贝宁王国。这个国家发展了先进的艺术文化，特别是在著名的青铜、铁和象牙制品方面。其中包括铜制壁板和贝宁奥巴斯真人大小的青铜头像。最常见的人工制品是以伊迪亚女王为原型，人们通常称之为费斯塔克面具。在16世纪和17世纪，贝宁通过与欧洲的奴隶贸易日益富裕；来自内陆敌国的奴隶被贩卖，并用荷兰和葡萄牙的船只运到美洲。贝宁海岸的海湾很快就被称为“奴隶海岸”[段落：2]贝宁的城市和帝国在1700年后衰落了，但在19世纪随着棕榈油、奴隶俘虏和纺织品贸易的发展而复兴。为了维护贝宁的独立，奥巴马政府一点一点地禁止从贝宁出口货物，直到贸易完全是棕榈油[段落：2]在19世纪80年代和19世纪90年代的大部分时间里，贝宁一直拒绝与英国签署保护国条约，1897年发起了一场“惩罚性远征”，一支英国军队在海军上将哈里·罗森爵士（Sir Harry Rawson）的指挥下，征服并烧毁了这座城市，摧毁了该国大部分珍贵的艺术品，并驱散了几乎所有剩下的东西。在贝宁制造的肖像、半身像和用铁、象牙雕刻，尤其是黄铜（传统上称为“贝宁青铜器”）制作的雕像、半身像和群像现在在世界各地的博物馆展出。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Regulated Trade describes a government trade policy that seeks to influence foreign trade to the benefit of its national industries. With the Ming dynasty, China started to close off its economy to foreign trade, and likewise Japan forbade interaction with foreign merchants. Besides protecting local craftsmen, this was also meant to keep out dangerous ideas from abroad. In Europe, increasing trade regulation coincided with colonialism. This particular form of regulated trade, Mercantilism, was focused on importing raw goods from the colonies to produce manufactured goods at the exclusion of foreign economies.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]管制贸易是指政府的贸易政策，旨在影响对外贸易，使其有利于本国产业。随着明朝的到来，中国开始关闭对外贸易，日本也禁止与外国商人交往。除了保护当地的工匠，这也意味着不让国外的危险想法。在欧洲，不断增加的贸易管制与殖民主义不谋而合。这种特殊形式的管制贸易，重商主义，侧重于从殖民地进口原材料生产制造品，而不包括外国经济体。

TEXT.English: [H1]Tile Stability Display[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Dawn of Civilization, the stability effect of a specific tile is displayed in the tooltip when you hover over it on the map. The stability categories of tiles are Core (cyan), Historical (light green), Contested (yellow), Foreign (orange) and Foreign Core (red). The colors associated with the categories match those of the stability maps released for RFC.[PARAGRAPH:2]The stability category of a tile influences your expansion stability in multiple ways, depending on the circumstances. [NEWLINE][BOLD]Core Area:[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET]Cities in your core area contribute to your core population score [ICON_BULLET]You can collapse if you're completely pushed out of your core area [ICON_BULLET]You only need 20% culture to maintain control over a tile in your core [NEWLINE][BOLD]Historical Area:[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET]No stability penalties for controlling cities [NEWLINE][BOLD]Contested Area:[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET]No stability penalties for controlling cities [ICON_BULLET]Risk of respawn of another civilization [ICON_BULLET]The civilization native to this area only needs 20% culture to maintain control over this tile [ICON_BULLET]It is harder to build up culture here, which can lead to stability penalties [NEWLINE][BOLD]Foreign Area:[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET]Controlling cities here can hurt your expansion stability [NEWLINE][BOLD]Foreign Core Area:[\BOLD] [ICON_BULLET]Controlling cities here can hurt your expansion stability [ICON_BULLET]Risk of respawn of another civilization [ICON_BULLET]The civilization native to this area only needs 20% culture to maintain control over this tile [ICON_BULLET]It is harder to build up culture here, which can lead to stability penalties
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]地块稳定度显示[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]在“文明的曙光”中，当鼠标停留在地图上时，提示栏中会显示出特殊地块的稳定度影响。稳定度分别为：核心区域（深绿色），历史区域（浅绿色），受争议区域（黄色），外国区域（橙色）以及外国核心区域（红色）。颜色类别与已发布的RFC稳定度地图相匹配。[PARAGRAPH:2]根据不同情况，地块的类别将会影响到扩张时稳定度的多个方面。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]核心区域：[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]文化覆盖不会产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]拥有外国城市会产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]如果你被赶出你的核心区域，你的文明将会崩溃[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]核心区域与你开局出现的地点相匹配[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]历史区域：[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]文化覆盖不会产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]受争议区域[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]文化覆盖不会产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]拥有城市将产生小额稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]具有其他文明重生的威胁[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]外国区域：[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]文化覆盖将产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]外国核心区域[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]文化覆盖将产生稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]拥有城市将产生巨额稳定度惩罚[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]具有其他文明重生的威胁

TEXT.English: [TAB]A traditionalist society is based on oral traditions and long established ways of doing things. Its authority is difficult to question, since no modern figure can easily claim the right to change what was established by the ancestors. This can be a great weakness of the system when times change, but so long as the basic mechanisms of existence remain stable, the tradition-oriented culture gains a strong sense of its own values, and feels powerful ties to the legacy of its own ancestors. As society became more settled, existing customs grew formalized and expanded. Priests and scribes served as guardians of collective social memory by keeping track of longstanding precedents and rituals, often dating back centuries to quasi-legendary founding heroes. Rulers sought to empower themselves by following the rites and policies established by such traditions.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]传统社会是建立在口头传统和长期既定的做事方式基础上的。它的权威是很难质疑的，因为没有一个现代的人物能够轻易地要求改变祖先建立的东西。这可能是时代变迁时制度的一大弱点，但只要生存的基本机制保持稳定，传统文化就获得了强烈的自身价值意识，并感受到与自己祖先遗产的强大联系。随着社会越来越安定，现有的风俗习惯也越来越正规化和扩大化。牧师和抄写员作为集体社会记忆的守护者，通过记录长期的先例和仪式，通常可以追溯到几百年前的准传奇创始英雄。统治者试图通过遵循这些传统所确立的仪式和政策来赋予自己权力。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The use of money as a unit of account predates history. Government control of money is documented in the ancient Egyptian economy (2750鈥?150 BC). The Egyptians measured the value of goods with a central unit called shat. As many other currencies, the shat was linked to gold. The value of a shat in terms of goods was defined by government administrations. Other cultures in Asia Minor later materialised their currencies in the form of gold and silver coins.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the medieval and the early modern period a network of professional banks was established in Southern and Central Europe. The institutes built a new tier in the financial economy. The monetary system was still controlled by government institutions, mainly through the coinage prerogative. Banks, however, could use book money to create deposits for their customers. Thus, they had the possibility to issue, lend and transfer money autonomously without direct governmental control.[PARAGRAPH:2]In order to consolidate the monetary system, a network of public exchange banks was established at the beginning of the 17th century in main European trade centres. The Amsterdam Wisselbank was founded as a first institute in 1609. Further exchange banks were located in Hamburg, Venice and Nuremberg. The institutes offered a public infrastructure for cashless international payments. They aimed to increase the efficiency of international trade and to safeguard monetary stability. The exchange banks thus fulfilled comparable functions to modern central banks. The institutes even issued their own (book) currency, called Mark Banco.
TEXT.Chinese: [选项卡]使用货币作为记账单位的时间早于历史。古埃及经济（公元前2750-2150）中记载了政府对货币的控制。埃及人用一个叫做shat的中心单位来衡量货物的价值。与许多其他货币一样，夏特与黄金挂钩。就货物而言，shat的价值是由政府管理部门定义的。亚洲小国的其他文化后来以金银货币形式实现了货币。〔2〕在中世纪和近代早期，欧洲南部和中欧建立了一个专业银行网络。这些研究所在金融经济中建立了一个新的层次。货币体系仍然由政府机构控制，主要是通过铸币特权。然而，银行可以利用账面资金为客户创造存款。因此，他们有可能在没有直接政府控制的情况下自主地发放、贷款和转移货币。〔2〕为了巩固货币体系，十七世纪初在欧洲主要贸易中心成立了一个公共交换银行网络。阿姆斯特丹威斯尔银行成立于1609年，是第一所学院。在汉堡、威尼斯和纽伦堡还有更多的外汇银行。这些机构为无现金国际支付提供了公共基础设施。它们旨在提高国际贸易的效率，维护货币稳定。因此，外汇银行履行了与现代中央银行相当的职能。这些机构甚至发行了自己的（帐面）货币，称为马克银行。

TEXT.English: [H1]Camillo Paolo Filippo Giulio Benso[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prime Minister of Italy[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1810 - 1861 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Camillo di Cavour was a leading figure in the movement toward Italian unification. He was the founder of the original Italian Liberal Party and Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Piedmont-Sardinia, a position he maintained (except for a six-month resignation) throughout the Second Italian War of Independence and Garibaldi's campaigns to unite Italy. Cavour died only three months after the declaration of a united Kingdom of Italy, and thus did not live to see Venetia or Rome included in the kingdom.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cavour, as he is usually called, put forth several economic reforms in his home province of Piedmont in his earlier years, and founded the political newspaper Il Risorgimento. After being elected to the Chamber of Deputies, he quickly rose in rank through the Piedmontese government, coming to dominate the Chamber of Deputies through a union of left-center and right-center politicians. After a large rail system expansion program, Cavour became prime minister in 1852. As prime minister, Cavour successfully negotiated Piedmont's way through the Crimean War, Second Italian War of Independence, and Garibaldi's expeditions, managing to maneuver Piedmont diplomatically to become a new great power in Europe, controlling a nearly united Italy that was five times as large as Piedmont had been before he came to power.
TEXT.Chinese: 〔H1〕卡米洛Paulo Piulo Gululo BeSo[ [HOLLY] ]意大利总理〔大胆〕[新版]〔大胆〕1810—1861广告[新行] [大胆]背景：〔段落：1〕Camillo di Cavour是意大利统一运动的领军人物。他是原意大利自由党的创始人和撒丁岛皮埃蒙特王国的总理，在第二次意大利独立战争和加里波第统一意大利的运动中，他一直担任这个职位（除了六个月的辞职）。Cavour在意大利联合王国宣布仅三个月后就去世了，因此没有看到威尼斯或罗马被包括在王国中。[段落：2 ] Cavour，正如他通常所说的那样，在他早年的家乡Piedmont进行了几次经济改革，并建立了政治报纸IsRigoGimeto。当选众议院议员后，他很快通过皮埃蒙特政府提升了级别，通过左中右翼政客联盟来统治众议院。在一项大型铁路系统扩建计划之后，卡沃于1852年成为首相。作为总理，卡沃成功地通过克里米亚战争、第二次意大利独立战争和加里波第的远征谈判，成功地在外交上操纵了皮埃蒙特，使其成为欧洲的一个新大国，控制了一个几乎统一的意大利，其面积是他上台前皮埃蒙特的五倍。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A priest is a person authorized to perform the sacred rituals of a religion, especially as a mediatory agent between humans and one or more deities. They also have the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities. Their office or position is the priesthood, a term which also may apply to such persons collectively.[PARAGRAPH:1]Priests have existed since the earliest of times and in the simplest societies, most likely as a result of agricultural surplus and consequent social stratification. The necessity to read sacred texts and keep temple or church records helped foster literacy in many early societies. Priests exist in many religions today, such as all or some branches of Judaism, Christianity, Shintoism, Hinduism. They are generally regarded as having positive contact with the deity or deities of the religion to which they subscribe, often interpreting the meaning of events and performing the rituals of the religion. There is no common definition of the duties of priesthood between faiths; but generally it includes mediating the relationship between one's congregation, worshippers, and other members of the religious body, and its deity or deities, and administering religious rituals and rites. These often include blessing worshipers with prayers of joy at marriages, after a birth, and at consecrations, teaching the wisdom and dogma of the faith at any regular worship service, and mediating and easing the experience of grief and death at funerals - maintaining a spiritual connection to the afterlife in faiths where such a concept exists. Administering religious building grounds and office affairs and papers, including any religious library or collection of sacred texts, is also commonly a responsibility - for example, the modern term for clerical duties in a secular office refers originally to the duties of a cleric. The question of which religions have a "priest" depends on how the titles of leaders are used or translated into English. In some cases, leaders are more like those that other believers will often turn for advice on spiritual matters, and less of a "person authorized to perform the sacred rituals" For example, clergy in Roman Catholicism and Orthodox Christianity are priests, but in Protestant Christianity they are typically minister and pastor. The terms priest and priestess are sufficiently generic that they may be used in an anthropological sense to describe the religious mediators of an unknown or otherwise unspecified religion.[PARAGRAPH:1]In many religions, being a priest or priestess is a full-time position, ruling out any other career. Many Christian priests and pastors choose or are mandated to dedicate themselves to their churches and receive their living directly from their churches. In other cases it is a part-time role. For example in the early history of Iceland the chieftains were titled goði, a word meaning "priest". As seen in the saga of Hrafnkell Freysgoði, however, being a priest consisted merely of offering periodic sacrifices to the Norse gods and goddesses; it was not a full-time role, nor did it involve ordination.[PARAGRAPH:1]In some religions, being a priest or priestess is by human election or human choice. In Judaism the priesthood is inherited in familial lines.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]牧师是被授权执行宗教神圣仪式的人，特别是作为人类和一个或多个神之间的调解人。他们也有管理宗教仪式的权力或权力；特别是祭祀或安抚一个或多个神的仪式。他们的职务或职位是祭司，这一术语也可以集体适用于这些人。[段：1 ]祭司从最早的时代起就存在，在最简单的社会中，最有可能是由于农业剩余和随之而来的社会分层。在许多早期社会，阅读神圣的经文和保存寺庙或教堂记录的必要性有助于培养识字能力。今天，牧师存在于许多宗教中，如犹太教、基督教、神道教、印度教的全部或部分分支。他们通常被视为与他们所信奉的一个或多个宗教的神有着积极的联系，经常解释事件的含义并执行宗教的仪式。对不同信仰之间的祭司职责没有共同的定义；但一般来说，它包括调解会众、礼拜者和宗教团体其他成员与其神明之间的关系，以及管理宗教仪式和仪式。这些通常包括在婚姻、出生后和献祭时带着喜悦祈祷的祝福崇拜者，在任何定期的礼拜仪式上传授信仰的智慧和教条，在葬礼上调解和缓解悲伤和死亡的体验——在存在这种观念的信仰中保持与来世的精神联系。管理宗教建筑场地、办公室事务和文件，包括任何宗教图书馆或神圣文献的收藏，也通常是一项责任——例如，现代术语“世俗办公室的文书职责”最初指的是一名牧师的职责。哪个宗教有“牧师”的问题取决于领导人的头衔是如何使用或翻译成英语的。在某些情况下，领袖更像是那些其他信徒经常会就精神问题寻求建议的人，而不是“被授权执行神圣仪式的人”，例如，罗马天主教和东正教的神职人员是牧师，但在新教基督教中，他们通常是牧师和牧师。牧师和女祭司的术语是足够通用的，它们可以用人类学的意义来描述一个未知的或其他未指定的宗教的宗教调解人。[段落：1 ]在许多宗教中，作为牧师或女祭司是一个全职的职位，排除任何其他职业。许多基督教牧师和牧师选择或受命献身于他们的教会，并直接从他们的教会接受他们的生活。在其他情况下，它是一个兼职角色。例如在冰岛早期的历史上，酋长们被命名为goði，一个意思是“牧师”的词。然而，正如Hrafnkell Freysgo胡胡的传说中所说的，作为一名牧师，只不过是为挪威神和女神提供定期的祭祀；它不是一个全职的角色，也不是涉及到教职的。[段：1 ]在某些宗教中，作为牧师或女祭司是由人类选择或人类选择的。在犹太教中，祭司的身份是家族遗传的。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Among the technically more advanced sedentary civilizations on both edges of the Eurasian landmass, a different kind of cavalry seems to have emerged shortly after 1000 BC. Reliefs from great Assyrian palaces show horsemen, clad in armour and armed with spear or lance or sword, who were used in combination with other troops such as light and heavy infantry. The function of these cataphracts (from the Greek word for 'armour') was not to engage in long-distance combat but to launch massed shock action, first against the enemy cataphracts and then, having gained the field, against the enemy foot. The fact that ancient cavalry apparently did not possess the stirrup has often led modern historians to question the mounted soldier's effectiveness. They argue that, since riders held on only by pressure of their knees, their ability to deliver shock was limited by the fear of falling off their mounts. This argument fails to note that, particularly in Hellenistic times and again in late Roman ones, cavalry forces did indeed play an important, often decisive, part in countless battles. Still, it is true that never during classical antiquity did cavalry succeed in replacing the formations of heavy infantry that remained the backbone of every army.
TEXT.Chinese: 【TAB】在欧亚大陆两侧技术更先进的定居文明中，公元前1000年后不久似乎出现了另一种骑兵。大亚述宫殿的浮雕显示骑兵身穿盔甲，手持长矛或长矛或剑，与轻步兵和重步兵等其他部队结合使用。这些阵亡者（希腊语中“盔甲”的意思）的作用不是进行长距离的战斗，而是发动大规模的突击行动，首先打击敌人的阵亡者，然后在获得战场后打击敌人的脚。古代骑兵显然没有马镫，这一事实常常使现代历史学家质疑骑兵的效力。他们认为，由于骑手只能靠膝盖的压力来支撑，他们传递冲击力的能力因害怕从坐骑上摔下来而受到限制。这个论点没有注意到，特别是在希腊化时期和罗马晚期，骑兵部队确实在无数的战斗中发挥了重要的作用，往往是决定性的作用。尽管如此，在古典时期，骑兵从来没有成功地取代重装步兵的队形，而重装步兵仍然是每一支军队的骨干。

TEXT.English: [H1]Joseph Philippe Pierre Yves Elliott Trudeau[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prime Minister of Canada[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1919 - 2000 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Joseph Philippe Pierre Yves Elliott Trudeau, PC CH CC QC FSRC usually known as Pierre Trudeau or Pierre Elliott Trudeau, was the 15th Prime Minister of Canada from April 20, 1968 to June 4, 1979, and again from March 3, 1980 to June 30, 1984. Trudeau began his political career as a lawyer, intellectual, and activist in Quebec politics. In the 1960s, he entered federal politics by joining the Liberal Party of Canada. He was appointed as Lester Pearson's Parliamentary Secretary, and later became his Minister of Justice. From his base in Montreal, Trudeau took control of the Liberal Party and became a charismatic leader, inspiring "Trudeaumania". From the late 1960s until the mid-1980s, he dominated the Canadian political scene and aroused passionate reactions. "Reason before passion" was his personal motto. He retired from politics in 1984, and John Turner succeeded him as Prime Minister. Admirers praise the force of Trudeau's intellect and salute his political acumen in preserving national unity against the Quebec sovereignty movement, suppressing a violent revolt, and establishing the Charter of Rights and Freedoms within Canada's constitution. Critics accuse him of arrogance, economic mismanagement, and unduly favouring the federal government relative to the provinces, especially in trying to distribute the oil wealth of the Prairies.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]加拿大[Brd] [Brut]总理皮埃尔·艾略特·特鲁多[Brut] [NealLe] [Brd]：[\BOLD ] 1919到2000 AD [NealLe] [NealLe] [Brand ]背景：[\Brut]（段落：1）皮埃尔·艾略特·特鲁多，PCCH CC QC FSRC，通常被称为Pierre Trudeau或Pierre Elliott Trudeau，1968年4月20日至1979年6月4日，1980年3月3日至1984年6月30日，加拿大第15任总理。特鲁多的政治生涯始于律师、知识分子和魁北克政治活动家。上世纪60年代，他加入加拿大自由党，进入联邦政治。他被任命为莱斯特·皮尔森的议会秘书，后来成为他的司法部长。特鲁多在蒙特利尔的基地控制了自由党，成为一位有魅力的领袖，鼓舞了“特鲁多乌曼尼亚”。从20世纪60年代末到80年代中期，他主导了加拿大政坛，引起了热烈的反响。”“理智先于激情”是他的座右铭。他于1984年退出政坛，约翰·特纳接替他担任总理。崇拜者赞扬特鲁多智慧的力量，并赞扬他在维护反对魁北克主权运动的民族团结、镇压暴力叛乱以及在加拿大宪法中确立《权利和自由宪章》方面的政治敏锐性。批评者指责他傲慢自大，经济管理不善，过分偏袒联邦政府相对于各省，特别是在试图分配大草原的石油财富方面。

TEXT.English: [H1]Abd-ar-Rahman III[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caliph of Umayyad Dynasty[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c.891 - 961 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Abd-ar-Rahman III was born at 891, and became Caliph of Cordoba when he was twenty-two. During his reign, he successfully warred both the Fatimid Arabs and the Christian kingdoms at the North, having significant land gains (much of Central Iberia and part of Maghreb). In order to invade to North Africa, he reinforced the Cordoban fleet, turning it into a considerably strong power.[PARAGRAPH:2]Abd-ar-Rahman III was also noted for the tolerance shown to other religion faithfuls (Catholics and Jews). Moreover, he was a patron of science and arts. Specifically, his residence palace, the Medina Azahara, built at his reign, was modelled after the Ummayad Arab palace in Damascus, and he spent money to extend the library of Cordoba, turning the city in an important intellectual center. When, at 961, he died, he left the Caliphate of Cordoba at the colophon of its height.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] UMayyad王朝的[ABLD拉赫曼[\H1] [Brang] Kalph [\Brut] [NurLe] [Brut]：[C.891- 961 Ad[新行] [NealLe] [Brut]背景：[BARD] [段落：1 ] ABD Ar拉赫曼III出生于891，并在他二十二岁时成为科尔多瓦的哈里发。在他的统治期间，他成功地与法蒂玛阿拉伯人和北方的基督教王国进行了战争，取得了巨大的土地收益（伊比利亚中部和马格里布的一部分）。为了入侵北非，他加强了科尔多班舰队，使其成为一个相当强大的力量。[段：2 ] AdD Ar拉赫曼III也因对其他宗教信徒（天主教徒和犹太人）的容忍而著称。此外，他还是科学和艺术的赞助人。具体来说，他在位时建造的宫殿麦地那阿扎哈拉（Medina Azahara）仿照大马士革的乌玛雅德阿拉伯宫殿，他花钱扩建科尔多瓦图书馆，使这座城市成为一个重要的知识中心。当他在961年去世时，他把科尔多瓦的哈里发留在了科尔多瓦最高的地方。

TEXT.English: [H1]Ramesses II the Great[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pharaoh of Egyptian Empire[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1302 - 1213 BC[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Also known as "Ramesses the Great," Ramesses was an Egyptian pharaoh of the Nineteenth Dynasty. He was the third king in his dynasty, the son of King Seti I and Queen Tuya. Ramesses was born around 1302 BC and ruled from approximately 1279 to 1213 BC. Among Ramesses' many wives, the most famous was Nefertari, who was his principal wife for over twenty years and was later deified and worshipped as a goddess. Ramesses seems to have enjoyed all of the benefits of his position as pharaoh, and he fathered about 100 children during his long rule. One of them, the Pharaoh Merneptah, became his successor.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ramesses was most famous for leading several military campaigns along the eastern Mediterranean coast. On one of these expeditions into modern-day Israel and Lebanon, Ramesses ran into the Hittite army of King Muwatallis. At the Battle of Kadesh in 1274, the two sides fought for control of the territory comprising modern Syria. It was probably the largest chariot battle ever fought, with some 5000 chariots engaged on both sides. The battle was largely inconclusive, and both sides claimed victory. However Ramesses lost more men than Muwatallis, so the Hittites probably got the best of the Egyptians. Two sides continued to struggle against one another for decades to come until they signed a peace treaty in 1258 BC - this is the first peace treaty ever recorded in history. At the other end of his domains, Ramesses also campaigned extensively south of the First Cataract of the Nile in Nubia, winning additional land for Egypt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Today Ramesses is one of the best-known Egyptian pharaohs, primarily because he had so many monuments and statues of himself erected. The renowned archaeological complex of Abu Simbel - one of the best-preserved sites from ancient Egypt - was built on his orders. Ramesses' mummy was discovered in 1881; it was moved to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo, where it is still proudly displayed to the public today. (His 3000-year old body is in surprisingly good shape.)[PARAGRAPH:2]Ramesses is often popularly identified as the pharaoh who confronted Moses in the Bible. However, Ramesses lived to the age of 90 after a long reign of 66 years; he did not drown in the Red Sea; and there is no mention in the records of a slave revolt during his reign - so this seems quite unlikely.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]拉美西斯二世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]埃及法老[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生卒年份：[\BOLD]前1302-前1213[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]拉美西斯二世即“拉美西斯大帝”，是古埃及第十九王朝的第三任法老（“拉美西斯”意为“拉的儿子”，即太阳神之子）。拉美西斯二世是法老塞梯一世和王后图雅之子。约生于公元前1302年，约前1279-前1213年在位。拉美西斯曾有多位王后，其中最著名的一位是尼菲塔利，她是拉美西斯的首任妻子，作为王后长达二十余年，后来她还被人们当作女神来崇拜。看起来拉美西斯充分享受着作为法老所拥有的权力和乐趣，在他漫长的统治期间，他生下了上百个孩子。其中一位成为他的继任者梅尼普塔法老。[PARAGRAPH:2]拉美西斯最著名的事迹是对地中海东岸地区的一系列远征。其中一次曾到达今以色列和黎巴嫩，并与穆瓦塔利斯国王率领的赫梯军队遭遇。双方在前1274年为争夺今叙利亚地区而进行的卡迪什战役也许是有史以来最大的一场车战，参加此役的战车约有5000辆之多。这场 战役没有决定性的结果，双方都宣称赢得了胜利。不过拉美西斯的损失比穆瓦塔利斯多，因此也许是赫梯人占据了上风。埃及与赫梯的战争持续了数十年，最终双方于前1258年缔结了和约——这也是有史以来第一份国际条约。（这份和约的埃及文本与赫梯文本均被保存下来，并为近代考古学者所发现。）在其国土的另一端，拉美西斯也越过位于努比亚的尼罗河第一瀑布向南扩张，为埃及赢得大片领土。[PARAGRAPH:2]时至今日，拉美西斯是最著名的埃及法老之一，他为自己建造了无数的纪念碑和雕像。著名的阿布辛贝神庙——这是古埃及遗迹中保存得最好的一处——就是他下令建造的。拉美西斯的木乃伊于1881年被发现，现存开罗埃及博物馆，历经3000年仍然保存完好。[PARAGRAPH:2]人们往往认为圣经旧约出埃及记里摩西见到的那位埃及法老就是拉美西斯。但是，拉美西斯并未在红海里淹死，而是活了90岁，统治埃及长达66年；而且在他统治期间也没有任何奴隶发动起义的记载——所以那不太可能是他。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Edicts of Ashoka are a collection of 33 inscriptions on the Pillars of Ashoka, as well as boulders and cave walls, made by the Emperor Ashoka of the Mauryan dynasty during his reign from 269 BCE to 231 BCE. These inscriptions are dispersed throughout the areas of modern-day Bangladesh, India, Nepal and Pakistan and represent the first tangible evidence of Buddhism. The edicts describe in detail the first wide expansion of Buddhism through the sponsorship of one of the most powerful kings of Indian history. According to the edicts, the extent of Buddhist proselytism during this period reached as far as the Mediterranean, and many Buddhist monuments were created.[PARAGRAPH:1]These inscriptions proclaim Ashoka's beliefs in the Buddhist concept of dharma and his efforts to develop the dharma throughout his kingdom. Although Buddhism and the Buddha are mentioned, the edicts focus on social and moral precepts, rather than specific religious practices or the philosophical dimension of Buddhism.[PARAGRAPH:1]In these inscriptions, Ashoka refers to himself as "Beloved of the Gods" and "King Priya-darshi". The identification of King Priya-darshi with Ashoka was confirmed by an inscription discovered in 1837. The inscriptions found in the eastern part of India were written in the Magadhi language, using the Brahmi script. In the western part of India, the language used is closer to Sanskrit, using the Kharoshthi script, one extract of Edict 13 in the Greek language, and one bilingual edict written in Greek and Aramaic.These edicts were decodified by British archeologist and historian James Prinsep.[PARAGRAPH:1]The inscriptions revolve around a few recurring themes: Ashoka's conversion to Buddhism, the description of his efforts to spread Buddhism, his moral and religious precepts, and his social and animal welfare program.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]阿育王的诏书是由毛瑞安王朝的阿育王在公元前269年至公元前231年在位期间，在阿育王的柱子上，以及巨石和洞穴墙壁上，共有33处铭文的集合。这些碑文遍布现代孟加拉国、印度、尼泊尔和巴基斯坦，是佛教的第一个具体证据。这些法令详细描述了佛教通过赞助印度历史上最强大的国王之一而进行的第一次广泛扩张。根据法令，佛教在这一时期的皈依程度达到了地中海，许多佛教纪念碑被创造出来。[段落：1 ]这些碑文宣告了阿育王对佛法观念的信仰，以及他在整个王国发展佛法的努力。虽然佛教和如来佛祖被提及，但法令的重点是社会和道德戒律，而不是特定的宗教实践或佛教的哲学维度。[段：1 ]在这些铭文中，Ashoka把自己称为“众神的宠儿”和“King Priya darshi”。1837年发现的碑文证实了普里亚达尔希国王与阿育王的身份。在印度东部发现的碑文是用摩羯陀语书写的，使用的是婆罗门文字。在印度西部，使用的语言更接近梵语，使用哈罗舍提语，希腊语中的一个敕令13，Greek和阿拉姆语中的一个双语敕令。这些法令被英国考古学家和历史学家James Prinsep解码。[段落：1 ]铭文围绕着一些重复的主题：阿育王皈依佛教，描述他传播佛教的努力，他的道德和宗教戒律，以及他的社会和动物福利计划。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sveriges Riksbank (Swedish National Bank) is the central bank of Sweden, sometimes called just the Bank of Sweden. It is known to be the world's oldest central bank.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Riksbank began its operations in 1668, its antecedent being Stockholms Banco (also known as the Bank of Palmstruch), which was founded by Johan Palmstruch in 1656. Although the bank was private, it was the King who chose its management, in a letter to Palmstruch he gave permission to its operations according to stated regulations.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, Stockholms Banco, the world's oldest note-issuing bank collapsed as a result of the issuing of too many notes without the necessary collateral. Palmstruch, who was considered responsible for the bank's losses, was condemned to death, but later received clemency. On September 17, 1668, the privilege of Palmstruch to operate a bank, was transferred to the Riksens St盲nders Bank (translation: Bank of the Estates of the Realm) and was run under the auspices of the parliament of the day. Due to the failure of Stockholm Banco the new bank was managed under the direct control of the Riksdag of the Estates to prevent the interference of the King. When new Riksdag was instituted in 1866, the name of the bank was changed to Sveriges Riksbank.[PARAGRAPH:1]Having learnt the lesson of the Stockholms Banco experience, the Riksbank was not permitted to issue bank-notes. Nevertheless, in 1701 permission was granted to issue so called credit-notes. Some time in the middle of the 18th century counterfeit notes began appearing which caused serious problems. To prevent forgeries it was decided that the Riksbank should produce its own paper for bank-notes and a paper-mill, Tumba Bruk, was founded in Tumba, on the outskirts of Stockholm.[PARAGRAPH:1]A few years later, the first commercial banks were founded and these were also allowed to issue bank-notes. The bank-notes represented a claim to the bank without interest paid, and thus became a considerable source of income to the banks. Nonetheless, security in the form of a deposit at the Riksbank was required to cover the value of all notes issued.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the 19th century the Riksbank maintained a dominant position as a credit institution and issuer of bank-notes. The bank also managed national trade transactions as well as continuing to provide credit to the general public. The first branch-office was opened in 1824, later followed with subsidiary branches opening in each county (l盲n). The present operational activities as a central bank differ from those during the 19th century. For example, no interest-rate related activities were conducted.[PARAGRAPH:1]The position of the Riksbank as a central bank dates back to 1897 when the first Riksbank Act was accepted concurrently with a law giving the Riksbank the exclusive right of issuing bank-notes. This copyright concluded its role and importance regarding monetary policy in a modern sense, as the exclusive right to issue notes is a condition when conducting monetary policy and defending the value of a currency. Behind the decision were repeated demands that the private banks should cease to issue notes as it was considered that the ensuing profits should befall the general public.

The bank-notes represented a claim to the bank without interest paid, and thus became a considerable source of income to the banks. Nonetheless, security in the form of a deposit at the Riksbank was required to cover the value of all notes issued.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the 19th century the Riksbank maintained a dominant position as a credit institution and issuer of bank-notes. The bank also managed national trade transactions as well as continuing to provide credit to the general public. The first branch-office was opened in 1824, later followed with subsidiary branches opening in each county (l?n). The present operational activities as a central bank differ from those during the 19th century. For example, no interest-rate related activities were conducted.[PARAGRAPH:1]The position of the Riksbank as a central bank dates back to 1897 when the first Riksbank Act was accepted concurrently with a law giving the Riksbank the exclusive right of issuing bank-notes. This copyright concluded its role and importance regarding monetary policy in a modern sense, as the exclusive right to issue notes is a condition when conducting monetary policy and defending the value of a currency. Behind the decision were repeated demands that the private banks should cease to issue notes as it was considered that the ensuing profits should befall the general public.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The halite mines were exploited already by the pre-Columbian Muisca culture since the 5th century BCE. being one of their most important economic activities. The traditional halite mining was described by Alexander von Humboldt during his visit to Zipaquira in 1801. He depicts this deposit as bigger than the main halite mines of the time, such as those in Spain, Switzerland, Poland and the County of Tyrol with a calculated resource estimation of one million cubic meters. Von Humboldt also criticized the excavation techniques as being unpractical for future exploitation, recommending drift mining instead, since the halite tunnels don't require beams, lowering the costs.[PARAGRAPH:2]Years before the underground church was built (around 1932), the miners had carved a sanctuary, as a place for their daily prayers asking for protection to the saints before starting to work. In 1950, the construction of a bigger project had begun: the Salt Cathedral which was inaugurated on August 15, 1954 and dedicated to Our Lady of Rosary, Patron saint of miners. It was compound of three naves and a monumental cross. Part of the galleries were actually carved by the ancient Muisca. However, as the church was carved inside an active mine, structural problems and safety concerns led the authorities to shut it in September 1992. This construction cost of the original church was over 285 million U.S. dollars. The building had 120 m length, 5.500 m² surface and 22 m height. It had six main columns, and a maximum capacity of 8000 people.[PARAGRAPH:2]The main nave included the monumental cross, which was illuminated from the base up, projecting a large cross-shaped shadow in the ceiling. The right nave included the Stations of the Cross icons and the Rosary chapel, with the Virgin of Rosary Icon (sculpted by Daniel Rodriguez Moreno and later transported to the new cathedral). The left nave included the icons of the birth of Jesus and the baptism of Jesus, with a waterfall symbolising the Jordan River.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]早在公元前5世纪，前哥伦布时期的Muisca文化就已经开始开采石盐矿。是他们最重要的经济活动之一。传统的石盐开采是由亚历山大冯洪堡在1801年访问齐帕奎拉时描述的。他将该矿床描述为比当时主要的石盐矿更大的矿床，如西班牙、瑞士、波兰和蒂罗尔县的石盐矿，计算出的资源量估计为100万立方米。Von Humboldt还批评挖掘技术对于未来的开发是不实用的，而是建议漂流采矿代替，因为卤石岩隧道不需要梁，降低成本。[段：2 ]在地下教堂建造之前（大约1932年），矿工已经雕刻了一个避难所，作为他们每天祈祷的地方，在开始工作前向圣徒寻求保护。1950年，一个更大的工程开始建设：盐大教堂于1954年8月15日落成，献给我们的罗萨里夫人，矿工的守护神。它是由三个中殿和一个纪念十字架组成的。部分画廊实际上是由古老的穆伊斯卡雕刻的。然而，由于教堂被刻在一个活跃的矿井内，结构问题和安全问题导致当局于1992年9月关闭了它。原教堂的建造成本超过2.85亿美元。该建筑长120米，面积5.500平方米，高度22米。它有六个主柱，最大容量为8000人。[段落：2 ]主要的中殿包括一个巨大的十字架，它从底座上照亮，在天花板上投射出一个大的十字形阴影。右中堂包括十字架和念珠礼拜堂，以及念珠圣母像（由丹尼尔·罗德里格斯·莫雷诺雕刻，后来运到新的大教堂）。左中堂包括耶稣诞生和耶稣受洗的图标，瀑布象征约旦河。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A "pavilion" is a covered building without surrounding walls (think of it as a roof supported by columns). This kind of structure has been extremely popular for centuries in China, where they are often found in parks and gardens as well as in temple complexes.[PARAGRAPH:1]The first Chinese pavilions were probably constructed during the "Zhou dynasty," and they became quite numerous during the Warring States Period (approximately 400-200 BC). At first these buildings may have been used as watchtowers, providing soldiers with an uninterrupted 360-degree view along with shelter from rain and snow, but in later periods they were incorporated into Chinese gardens and parks, where they were prized for their elegance and simplicity of design.
TEXT.Chinese: 舞榭是一种采用“中国亭阁”建筑形式的娱乐场所——所谓“亭阁”（pavilion）是一种有顶盖而没有围墙（可以想象为几个石柱支撑的屋顶）的建筑，这种建筑在中国流行了很多个世纪，在各种公共和私人园林及豪华宫殿之中经常会建有“亭阁”。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]建造“亭阁”的历史可以追溯至周代，到战国时期（约公元前400-公元前200年）这类建筑就已经很普遍了。起初，这类建筑的作用是作为能遮挡雨雪而且保持全面视野的瞭望台，但到后来，它优雅而简易的特性使其成为中国园林中最常见的建筑形式之一。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]（塞爱维小提示：该中国特色建筑原文作“亭阁”，但“亭阁”替代“剧场”似乎不太适宜，因此我们改成同为歌舞娱乐设施的“舞榭”——舞者与观者同处亭阁之中，与湖光山色融为一体……）

TEXT.English: [TAB]The gray wolf (Canis lupus), also known as the timber wolf, true wolf or western wolf is a canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of North America, Eurasia, and North Africa. It is the largest extant member of its family, with males averaging 43-45 kg (95-99 lb), and females 36-38.5 kg (79-85 lb). Like the red wolf, it is distinguished from other Canis species by its larger size and less pointed features, particularly on the ears and muzzle. Its winter fur is long and bushy, and predominantly a mottled gray in color, although nearly pure white, red, or brown to black also occur.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is the most specialised member of the genus Canis, as demonstrated by its morphological adaptations to hunting large prey, its more gregarious nature, and its highly advanced expressive behavior. It is nonetheless closely related enough to smaller Canis species, such as the eastern wolf, coyote and golden jackal to produce fertile hybrids. It is the only species of Canis to have a range encompassing both the Old and New Worlds, and originated in Eurasia during the Pleistocene, colonizing North America on at least three separate occasions during the Rancholabrean. It is a social animal, travelling in nuclear families consisting of a mated pair, accompanied by the pair's adult offspring. The gray wolf is typically an apex predator throughout its range, with only humans and tigers posing a serious threat to it. It feeds primarily on large ungulates, though it also eats smaller animals, livestock, carrion, and garbage.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is one of the world's best known and well researched animals, with probably more books written about it than any other wildlife species. It has a long history of association with humans, having been despised and hunted in most pastoral communities due to its attacks on livestock, while conversely being respected in some agrarian and hunter-gatherer societies. It is the sole ancestor of the dog, which genetic and paleontological records indicate was first domesticated in Europe 18,800-32,100 years ago by hunter-gatherers. Although the fear of wolves is pervasive in many human societies, the majority of recorded attacks on people have been attributed to animals suffering from rabies. Non-rabid wolves have attacked and killed people, mainly children, but this is unusual, as wolves are relatively few, live away from people, and have been taught to fear humans by hunters and shepherds.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf was once one of the world's most widely distributed mammals, living throughout the northern hemisphere north of 15°N latitude in North America and 12°N in India. However, deliberate human persecution has reduced the species' range to about one third, due to livestock predation and fear over attacks on humans. The species is now extinct in much of Western Europe, in Mexico and much of the USA. In modern times, the gray wolf occurs mostly in wilderness and remote areas, particularly in Canada, Alaska and northern USA, Europe, and Asia from about 75°N to 12°N. Wolf population declines have been arrested since the 1970s, and have fostered recolonization and reintroduction in parts of its former range, due to legal protection, changes in land-use and rural human population shifts to cities. Competition with humans for livestock and game species, concerns over the danger posed by wolves to people, and habitat fragmentation pose a continued threat to the species. Despite these threats, because of the gray wolf's relatively widespread range and stable population, it is classified as Least Concern by the IUCN.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]灰狼（Canis lupus）又称木狼、真狼或西部狼，是一种原产于北美、欧亚大陆和北非荒野和偏远地区的犬科动物。它是现存最大的家族成员，雄性平均43-45公斤（95-99磅），雌性平均36-38.5公斤（79-85磅）。与红狼一样，它与其他犬科动物不同的是，它的体型更大，特征也不那么突出，尤其是耳朵和口吻。它的冬季皮毛长而浓密，主要是斑驳的灰色，虽然几乎纯白、红色或褐色至黑色也有发生。[段落：1 ]灰狼是犬科动物中最专业的成员，正如它对猎食大型猎物的形态适应所证明的那样，它更具群居性。以及它的高级表达行为。尽管如此，它与较小的犬科动物，如东狼、郊狼和金豺狼，有着足够的亲缘关系，可以培育出可育的杂种。它是唯一一种涵盖新旧世界的犬科动物，起源于更新世时期的欧亚大陆，在兰乔拉布兰河时期至少三次在北美殖民。它是一种群居动物，在由一对配偶组成的核心家庭中旅行，并伴随着这对配偶的成年后代。灰狼通常是整个范围内的顶级捕食者，只有人类和老虎对其构成严重威胁。它主要以大型蹄类动物为食，尽管它也吃较小的动物、家畜、腐肉和垃圾。[段落：1 ]灰狼是世界上最著名和研究得很好的动物之一，可能比其他野生物种更多的书。它与人类有着悠久的交往历史，在大多数牧区由于攻击牲畜而遭到轻视和猎杀，而在一些农业和狩猎采集社会则相反地受到尊重。它是狗的唯一祖先，遗传和古生物学记录表明，18800-32100年前，它首先在欧洲被狩猎采集者驯化。尽管对狼的恐惧在许多人类社会中普遍存在，但记录在案的对人的攻击大多归因于患有狂犬病的动物。非狂犬病的狼袭击和杀害人，主要是儿童，但这是不寻常的，因为狼是相对较少的，远离人们，并且被教导通过猎人和牧羊人来恐吓人类。[段落：1 ]灰狼曾经是世界上分布最广的哺乳动物之一，生活在北半球，北美洲北纬15度，印度北纬12度。然而，由于牲畜的捕食和对攻击人类的恐惧，蓄意的人类迫害已经把这个物种的范围缩小到了三分之一左右。现在，灰狼已经在西欧的大部分地区，墨西哥和美国的大部分地区灭绝了。在现代，灰狼主要出现在荒野和偏远地区，特别是在加拿大，阿拉斯加和美国北部，欧洲和亚洲，从大约75°N到12°N。自1970年代以来，灰狼的数量已经减少，并且已经促进了重新定居由于法律保护，土地利用和农村人口的变化转移到了城市。与人类争夺牲畜和猎物物种，担心狼对人类造成的危险，以及栖息地的分裂对物种构成持续的威胁。尽管存在这些威胁，但由于灰狼的活动范围相对广泛且种群稳定，它被国际自然保护联盟列为最不受关注的物种。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A merchant is a businessperson who trades in commodities produced by others, in order to earn a profit. The status of the merchant has varied during different periods of history and amongst different societies. Merchants have often been the subject of works of art.[PARAGRAPH:1]A merchant class characterizes many pre-modern societies. Its status can range from high (the members even eventually achieving titles such as that of Merchant Prince or Nabob) to low, as in Chinese culture, owing to the presumed distastefulness of profiting from "mere" trade rather than from labor or the labor of others as in agriculture and craftsmanship.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the Greco-Roman world merchants typically did not have high social status, though they may have enjoyed great wealth, and there were exceptions, such as in Syria and Palestine in late antiquity, where merchants did have a high social position.[PARAGRAPH:1]Medieval attitudes toward merchants in the West were strongly influenced by criticism of their activities by the Christian church, which closely associated their activities with the sin of usury.[PARAGRAPH:1]From around 1300 to the 1800s a large number of European Chartered and Merchant Companies were established to utilize international trading opportunities, for instance the Company of Merchant Adventurers of London, Chartered in 1407.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]商人是指为赚取利润而买卖他人生产的商品的商人。商人的地位在不同的历史时期和不同的社会中有所不同。商人常常是艺术作品的主题。[段落：1 ]一个商人阶级代表了许多前现代社会。它的地位可以从高（成员甚至最终实现职称，如商贾王子或纳布）到低，因为在中国文化中，由于假定的厌恶，从“纯粹”贸易，而不是劳动或其他劳动，如农业和工艺。[段：1 ]在Greco Roman世界商人。一般来说，他们没有很高的社会地位，尽管他们可能享有巨大的财富，也有例外，例如在古代晚期的叙利亚和巴勒斯坦，商人在欧美地区有着很高的社会地位。〔1〕中世纪对商人的态度强烈地受到基督教教会对他们活动的批评的影响。基督教教会把他们的活动与高利贷罪紧密联系在一起。[段：1 ]从1300到1800年代，大量的欧洲特许商人。公司的建立是为了利用国际贸易机会，例如1407年特许成立的伦敦商业冒险者公司。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A monastery is a building where monks can retreat from the world and concentrate upon the divine. Usually a monastery will have strict rules of conduct to protect its unworldly members from temptation. In some monasteries, the monks are totally silent; in others no visitors are allowed inside. Monasteries usually have many daily rituals and religious services.[PARAGRAPH:1]Throughout the ages monasteries have often been centers of learning.
