The mathematical basis of control theory was begun in the 18th century and advanced rapidly in the 20th.[PARAGRAPH:2]Automation has been achieved by various means including mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic, electrical, electronic devices and computers, usually in combination. Complicated systems, such as modern factories, airplanes and ships typically use all these combined techniques. The benefit of automation includes labor savings, savings in electricity costs, savings in material costs, and improvements to quality, accuracy, and precision.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term automation, inspired by the earlier word automatic (coming from automaton), was not widely used before 1947, when Ford established an automation department. It was during this time that industry was rapidly adopting feedback controllers, which were introduced in the 1930s.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]自动化是指在最少的人工协助下执行一个过程或过程的技术。自动化或自动控制是使用各种控制系统操作设备，如机器、工厂工艺、锅炉和热处理炉、接通电话网络、船舶操纵和稳定，飞机和其他应用程序和车辆具有最小或减少的人为干预。[段落：2 ]自动化涵盖了从家用恒温器控制锅炉到大型工业控制系统的应用，其中有十个输入测量和输出控制信号。在控制复杂性方面，它可以从简单的开关控制到多变量高级算法。[段落：2 ]在最简单类型的自动控制回路中，控制器将过程的测量值与期望的设定值进行比较，并处理所产生的误差信号，以改变对过程的一些输入，以这样一种方式，即使受到干扰，过程仍保持在其设定点。这种闭环控制是负反馈在系统中的应用。控制理论的数学基础始于十八世纪，在第二十迅速发展。[段落：2 ]自动化已经通过各种手段实现，包括机械、液压、气动、电气、电子设备和计算机，通常是结合在一起的。复杂的系统，如现代工厂、飞机和船舶，通常使用所有这些组合技术。自动化的好处包括节省劳动力、节约电能、节省材料成本、提高质量、准确度和精度。[段落：2 ]术语“自动化”，由早期的字自动（来自自动机）启发，在1947之前没有被广泛使用，当时福特建立了一个自动化部门。正是在这段时间，工业界迅速采用了反馈控制器，这种控制器是在20世纪30年代引入的。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Despite political and social upheavals that frequently ravaged the country, China is unique for its longevity and resilience as a politico-cultural entity. Most of China's cultural progress has been accomplished with relatively little outside influence; even when the country was ruled by such "barbarian" peoples as the Chin or Mongols, these were soon absorbed into the fabric of Chinese culture. The casting of bronze and the development of an alphabet date from the period of the Shang dynasty - China's first, believed to have dominated north China from the mid-16th to mid-11th century BC. The overthrow of the Shang dynasty by the Chou (1111-255 BC) spanned three generations; although the vibrant Chou culture produced some of history's greatest philosophers and artists, among them Confucius and Lao-zi, the final two centuries of the dynasty saw China engulfed by a series of civil wars known as the "Warring States" period (403-221 BC).[PARAGRAPH:2]The fighting came to an end when Qin Shi Huang managed to conquer all of his rivals and establish the Ch'in Dynasty (221-206 BC). He became the first Chinese Emperor, and was the first man to unite all of China under a single ruler, but the Ch'in Dynasty was unable to outlive his death. The subsequent Han dynasty was founded by Liu Pang, who also assumed the title of emperor in 202 BC. The four centuries of the Han were ones of considerable changes in imperial, political, cultural, and social development. The Han undertook massive engineering projects (including the Great Wall), and established a Chinese identity that would survive until the advent of Communism. The Cho-ko-nu, a type of repeating crossbow, was developed during the Han period and remained in use by the Chinese for almost two thousand years.[PARAGRAPH:2]By the end of the 2nd century AD the Han Empire had virtually ceased to exist, and was followed by a lengthy period of rival kingdoms that did not end until 618 AD, when the T'ang dynasty came to power. The T'ang were followed by the Sung Dynasty (960-1279 AD), which collapsed in the face of the Mongol invasions. By securing the allegiance of the Hsi Hsia in Tibet (1209), Genghis Khan disposed of a potential enemy and prepared the ground for an invasion of China. For several years Mongol armies pillaged the country; finally, in 1214 Genghis overwhelmed the capital of the northern Chin (modern Beijing). During the next decades there was an uneasy truce between the Mongols in the north and the Sung state in the south. The Mongols resumed their advance in 1250 under Kublai Khan, grandson of Genghis.[PARAGRAPH:2]From 1267 onward, the Mongols, this time assisted by the armored horsemen and auxiliary troops of north China, attacked on several fronts. When organized resistance ceased soon afterward, foreign invaders controlled the whole of China for the only time in history. The Mongols occupied China for a century, but ineptitude on the throne, factionalism at court, and rivalries among generals weakened their rule. Out of this turmoil emerged a new native dynasty, the Ming (1368-1644), known for patronage of the arts. Before turning inward and reverting to an isolationist policy in 1424, the Ming period saw extensive trade with India and Arabia, and Ming navigators may have reached the Americas before Columbus. The Ming were followed by the Manchus (1644-1911), the last imperial dynasty of China, marked by continuous warfare, Western imperialism, rampant corruption, and bureaucratic ineptitude.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the wake of the disastrous Boxer Rebellion, the imperial court could no longer maintain support among the peasantry and army; revolution (1911-1912) followed. The first half of the 20th century saw the disintegration of the old order in China and the foundations of a new society, begun by the short-lived democratic Republic (1912-1920), which quickly degenerated into the dictatorship of Chiang Kai-shek. A new revolution, led by the Nationalist Party (KMT) and the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), erupted. Although they had been united against the Japanese invasion, by the end of World War II civil war raged in China. Nationalists and Communists raced to take over Japanese-held territories, built up their forces, and fought limited engagements while still conducting negotiations; during 1947-1948, after initial Nationalist victories, the strategic balance shifted in favor of the Communists. Four years after Japan's surrender, a profound and popularly based revolution had swept China, and, in October 1949 Mao Zedong proclaimed the People's Republic of China. In 1966, the Communists at the instigation of Mao launched the disastrous "Cultural Revolution," a ten-year assault on "traditional values" and "bourgeois thinking" which ultimately left the country in disarray. After Mao's death in 1976, his rival Deng Xiaopeng assumed power and began social and economic reforms that would see China return to world prominence. China today is one of the world's rising powers, but exactly what course its leaders will chart next remains uncertain.
TEXT.Chinese: 虽然经常遭受到政治和社会动乱的冲击，但是中国作为一个政治文化实体的延续性和适应力仍是举世独有的。中国的大多数文化成就都是在极少外来影响的情况下独自完成的。即便在这个国家被“蛮族”统治之时（例如满清和蒙元时期），这些异族也很快就被融入中华文化之中。中国的青铜铸造技术和文字的形成开始于商王朝（据信于公元前16世纪中期至前11世纪中期统治中国北部地区，是国际史学界认可的第一个中国王朝）。商朝被周朝（前1111-前255）历经三代统治者的努力而推翻。虽然周王朝创造了辉煌而活跃的文化，出现了许多世界历史上最伟大的哲学家和艺术家，包括孔子和老子，但后期却陷入诸侯割据纷争不断的局面，即“战国时代”（前403-前221）。[PARAGRAPH:2]诸侯争霸的最终结果是秦王嬴政扫平六国，建立了秦朝（前221-前206）。嬴政首创皇帝尊号，自称“始皇帝”，成为第一位中国皇帝。秦始皇完成了中国本部的首次大一统，但秦朝在他死后不久即土崩瓦解。代之而起的是刘邦建立的汉朝，他于前202年登上帝位。在汉朝统治的四百年间，整个帝国在政治，文化和社会发展等各个方面都发生了显著而深刻的变革，并完成了一系列规模巨大的工程（包括长城的扩建），中华文明的主体民族：汉族也就此形成并传承至今。威力强大的的中国弩也在这一时期发展完善，在汉末还出现了一种设计精巧的连发弩——诸葛弩，弩在中国历朝都是普遍使用的武器。[PARAGRAPH:2]汉帝国在公元二世纪末已不复存在，此后是漫长的分裂和战乱时期，直到618年唐朝的建立。宋朝（960-1279）继唐朝之后兴起，却因蒙古人的入侵而灭亡。成吉思汗于1209年征服西夏，并以此为基地开始对中国的入侵，几年之内即横扫整个中国北部，1214年攻占金朝中都燕京（今北京）。此后数十年间蒙古与宋朝保持南北对峙状态，直到1250年成吉思汗之孙忽必烈再次南下。[PARAGRAPH:2]自1267年起，蒙古人纠集原属金朝的铁甲骑兵和工程部队发动了多路协同进攻，至1279年最终结束了宋朝军队有组织的抵抗，这是有史以来外族入侵者第一次得以控制整个中国。蒙古人对中国的占领持续了一个世纪，逐渐因统治者的无能，宫庭内的争斗和地方军政官员的割据而衰落，最终被一个新的汉族王朝：明朝（1368-1644）所推翻，这个朝代因促进艺术的繁荣而闻名于世。而且明朝在1424年放弃积极外向转取因循守旧政策之前，与印度、阿拉伯地区的海上贸易非常兴旺，有历史学家甚至认为：明朝的航海家先于哥伦布数十年即已到达过美洲。取代明朝的是中国的最后一个王朝：满清（1644-1911）。但满清统治时期却充斥着持续不断的内外战事、西方帝国主义的入侵，以及官僚阶层极度的腐败无能。[PARAGRAPH:2]义和团运动导致的大乱局表明满清朝庭已经彻底失去了广大农民和军队的支持，不久即因辛亥革命（1911-1912）的爆发而被推翻。20世纪上半叶的中国见证了旧秩序的崩溃和新社会形态的逐步形成，先是一个短命的民主共和政府（1912-1920），此后蒋介石逐渐建立起自己的独裁统治。中国国民党和中国共产党人曾在20年代携手推进革命事业，也曾在日本入侵期间团结起来一致对外，但第二次世界大战结束后，双方又分别发展自己的力量并不断因此发生小规模的冲突，同时也在谈判桌上唇枪舌剑，最终导致国共内战的爆发。1947-1948年间，尽管国民党取得了最初的胜利，战局却逐渐向有利于共产党的方向转化。在日本投降之后的第四年，一场广受民众支持，影响深刻久远的革命取得了最后的胜利，1949年10月1日，毛泽东宣布成立中华人民共和国。1966年，共产党人又发动了灾难性的“文化大革命”，这是一场对“传统文化价值”和“资产阶级思想”持续十年的打击，结果却使国民经济面临崩溃的边缘。1976年毛泽东去世后，曾受压制的邓小平重新掌权并实施了一系列的社会与经济改革，中国终于重开民族复兴的进程，再次赢得全世界的瞩目。现在中国的实力正在持续不断地增强，虽然她的未来仍然存在着许多不确定的因素。

TEXT.English: [H1]Abu'l-Fath Jalal ud-din Muhammad Akbar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mughal Emperor[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1542 - 1605 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Jalaluddin Muhammad Akbar was of Timurid descent; the son of Humayun, and the grandson of the Zaheeruudin Muhammad Babur, the legendary ruler who founded the Mughal dynasty in India. At the end of his reign in 1605 the Mughal empire covered most of the northern and central India and was one of the most powerful empires of the age.[PARAGRAPH:2]Akbar, widely considered as one of the greatest and the most influential personalities of the world history, was thirteen years old when he ascended the Imperial Mughal throne in Delhi, following the death of his father Naseeruddin Muahmmad Humayun. During his reign, he eliminated military threats from the powerful Pashtun descendants of Sher Shah Suri, and at the Second Battle of Panipat he defeated the newly self-declared Hindu king Hemu. It took him nearly two more decades to consolidate his power and bring parts of northern and central India into his realm. The emperor solidified his rule by pursuing diplomacy with the powerful Rajput caste, and by admitting Rajput princesses in his harem.[PARAGRAPH:2]Akbar's reign significantly influenced art and culture in the region. Akbar took a great interest in painting, and had the walls of his palaces adorned with murals. Besides encouraging the development of the Mughal school, he also patronised the European style of painting. He was fond of literature, and had several Sanskrit works translated into Persian, apart from getting many Persian works illustrated by painters from his court. Akbar began a series of religious debates where Muslim scholars would debate religious matters with Sikhs, Hindus, Carvaka atheists, Jews, and Portuguese Roman Catholic Jesuits. He had an intolerant attitude towards Hindus and the other religions during the early years of his reign, but he exercised great tolerance after he began marriage alliances with Rajput princesses. He founded a religious cult, the Din-i-Ilahi (Divine Faith), but it amounted only to a form of personality cult for Akbar, and quickly dissolved after his death.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] Au''-Falth-Jalal-Ud Din穆罕默德AkBar [Nurn] [Brut] Mugal-Palmi[\Brut] [NurLang] [Brand ]：[\BOLD ] 1542到1605 ad [新行] [BurnLe] [Brut]背景：[段落：1 ] Jalaluddin Muhammad Akbar是TimurID后裔；Humayun的儿子，Zaheeruudin Muhammad Babur的孙子，在印度建立莫卧儿王朝的传奇统治者。在1605统治结束时，莫卧儿帝国覆盖了印度北部和中部的大部分地区，是这个时代最强大的帝国之一。[段：2 ]阿克巴被认为是世界历史上最伟大、最有影响力的人物之一，他在德令哈市登上帝国的莫卧儿王位时，已经十三岁了。在他父亲纳赛鲁丁·穆阿迈德·胡马云死后。在他的统治期间，他消除了来自谢尔·沙赫·苏里（Sher Shah Suri）强大的普什图后裔的军事威胁，并在帕尼帕特（Panipat）的第二次战役中击败了新宣布的印度教国王赫穆（Hemu）。他又花了将近20年的时间来巩固自己的权力，并将印度北部和中部的部分地区带入自己的王国。皇帝通过与强大的拉杰普特种姓进行外交，并承认其后宫里的拉贾普特公主，巩固了他的统治。[段：2 ]阿克巴的统治对该地区的艺术和文化产生了重大影响。阿克巴对绘画非常感兴趣，他的宫殿墙壁上装饰着壁画。除了鼓励莫卧儿学派的发展，他还赞助了欧洲绘画风格。他喜欢文学，除了从宫廷里得到许多画家的波斯画作外，还有几部梵文作品被翻译成波斯语。阿克巴开始了一系列的宗教辩论，穆斯林学者将与锡克教徒、印度教徒、卡瓦卡无神论者、犹太人和葡萄牙罗马天主教耶稣会士讨论宗教问题。在他统治的早期，他对印度教徒和其他宗教有着不宽容的态度，但在他开始与拉吉普特公主结成婚姻联盟后，他表现出了极大的宽容。他建立了一个宗教邪教，Din-i-Ilahi（神圣信仰），但它只相当于阿克巴的一种个人邪教，并在他死后迅速解散。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Nalanda was a Mahavihara, a large and revered Buddhist monastery, in the ancient kingdom of Magadha (modern-day Bihar) in India. The site is located about 95 kilometres (59 mi) southeast of Patna near the city of Bihar Sharif, and was a centre of learning from the fifth century CE to c. 1200 CE. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.[PARAGRAPH:2]The highly formalized methods of Jain and Buddhist learning helped inspire the establishment of large teaching institutions such as Taxila, Nalanda, and Vikramashila which are often characterised as India's early universities. Nalanda flourished under the patronage of the Gupta Empire in the 5th and 6th centuries and later under Harsha, the emperor of Kannauj. The liberal cultural traditions inherited from the Gupta age resulted in a period of growth and prosperity until the ninth century. The subsequent centuries were a time of gradual decline, a period during which the tantric developments of Buddhism became most pronounced in eastern India under the Pala Empire.[PARAGRAPH:2]At its peak, the school attracted scholars and students from near and far with some travelling from Tibet, China, Korea, and Central Asia. Archaeological evidence also notes contact with the Shailendra dynasty of Indonesia, one of whose kings built a monastery in the complex.[PARAGRAPH:2]Much of our knowledge of Nalanda comes from the writings of pilgrim monks from Asia such as Xuanzang and Yijing who travelled to the Mahavihara in the 7th century. Vincent Smith remarked that "a detailed history of Nalanda would be a history of Mahayanist Buddhism". Many of the names listed by Xuanzang in his travelogue as products of Nalanda are the names of those who developed the philosophy of Mahayana. All students at Nalanda studied Mahayana as well as the texts of the eighteen (Hinayana) sects of Buddhism. Their curriculum also included other subjects such as the Vedas, logic, Sanskrit grammar, medicine and Samkhya.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nalanda was very likely ransacked and destroyed by an army of the Mamluk Dynasty of the Delhi Sultanate under Bakhtiyar Khalji in c. 1200 CE. While some sources note that the Mahavihara continued to function in a makeshift fashion for a while longer, it was eventually abandoned and forgotten until the 19th century when the site was surveyed and preliminary excavations were conducted by the Archaeological Survey of India. Systematic excavations commenced in 1915 which unearthed eleven monasteries and six brick temples neatly arranged on grounds 12 hectares (30 acres) in area. A trove of sculptures, coins, seals, and inscriptions have also been discovered in the ruins many of which are on display in the Nalanda Archaeological Museum situated nearby. Nalanda is now a notable tourist destination and a part of the Buddhist tourism circuit.[PARAGRAPH:2]On 25 November 2010, the Indian government, through an Act of Parliament, resurrected the ancient university through the Nalanda University Bill, and subsequently Nalanda University was established. It has been designated as an "international university of national importance."
TEXT.Chinese: 纳兰达是印度古代摩羯陀王国（现代比哈尔邦）的一座大而受人尊敬的佛教寺院。该遗址位于巴特纳东南约95公里（59英里），靠近比哈尔谢里夫市，是从公元前5世纪到公元1200年的学习中心。这是联合国教科文组织的世界遗产地。[段落：2 ]耆那教和佛教学习的高度正规化方法有助于建立大型的教学机构，如塔克西拉、那烂陀和Vikramashila，这些机构通常被称为印度的早期大学。纳兰达在五、六世纪的笈多帝国的庇护下繁荣昌盛，后来又在卡纳吉皇帝哈沙的统治下繁荣昌盛。从笈多时代继承下来的自由文化传统导致了一个直到9世纪的发展和繁荣时期。随后的几个世纪是一个逐渐衰落的时期，在勃拉帝国统治下，佛教在印度东部最为明显的一段时期。[段：2 ]在它的顶峰时期，学校吸引了来自远方和远方的学者和学生，一些来自西藏、中国、韩国和中亚的旅游者。考古学证据还指出，与印度尼西亚的谢兰德拉王朝有联系，其中一位国王在复合体建造了一座修道院。[段落：2 ]我们对那烂陀的大部分知识来自于亚洲的朝圣僧侣们的作品，如七世纪在Mahavihara游历的宣臧和一京。文森特·史密斯说：“纳兰达的详细历史将是一部马哈佛教的历史”。玄奘在《游记》中所列的纳兰达的许多名字，都是大乘哲学发展者的名字。纳兰达的所有学生都学习大乘佛教以及十八大佛教派别的经文。他们的课程还包括其他学科，如吠陀，逻辑学，梵语语法，医学和SAMKHYA。[段落：2 ] Nalanda很可能被一个军队在德令哈市的苏门答腊的马穆鲁克王朝在Bakhtiyar Khalji C. 1200 CE下洗劫和摧毁。虽然一些消息来源指出，马哈维哈拉在一段时间内继续以临时的方式发挥作用，但它最终还是被遗弃和遗忘，直到19世纪，印度考古调查局对该遗址进行了调查并进行了初步挖掘。1915年开始了系统的发掘，发掘出11座寺院和6座砖砌寺院，这些寺院整齐地排列在12公顷（30英亩）的土地上。遗址中还发现了大量的雕塑、硬币、印章和铭文，其中许多在附近的纳兰达考古博物馆展出。那烂陀现在是一个著名的旅游目的地和佛教旅游线路的一部分。[段：2 ] 2010年11月25日，印度政府通过议会法案，通过纳兰达大学法案复兴了古代大学，随后建立了纳兰达大学。它被指定为“具有国家重要性的国际大学”

TEXT.English: [TAB]In geography, an oasis is an isolated area of vegetation in a desert, typically surrounding a spring or similar water source. Oases also provide habitat for animals and even humans if the area is big enough. The location of oases has been of critical importance for trade and transportation routes in desert areas. Caravans must travel via oases so that supplies of water and food can be replenished. Thus, political or military control of an oasis has in many cases meant control of trade on a particular route. For example, the oases of Awjila, Ghadames and Kufra, situated in modern-day Libya, have at various times been vital to both North-South and East-West trade in the Sahara. The word oasis came into English via Greek oasis, borrowed directly from Egyptian or Demotic. It was not borrowed from Coptic, as is sometimes suggested; the Greek word is attested several centuries before Coptic existed as a written language.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]在地理上，绿洲是沙漠中一个孤立的植被区，通常围绕着一个泉水或类似的水源。如果面积足够大，绿洲也为动物甚至人类提供栖息地。绿洲的位置对于沙漠地区的贸易和运输路线至关重要。大篷车必须经过绿洲才能补充水和食物。因此，在许多情况下，对绿洲的政治或军事控制意味着对特定路线上的贸易的控制。例如，位于现代利比亚的奥吉拉、加达梅斯和库夫拉绿洲，在不同时期对撒哈拉的南北和东西贸易都至关重要。单词oasis通过希腊语oasis进入英语，直接从埃及语或通俗语借来。它不是从科普特语借来的，正如有时所说的那样；希腊语在科普特语作为一种书面语言存在之前几个世纪就已经被证实了。

TEXT.English: [H1]Alfred the Great[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Wessex[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 849 - 899 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alfred the Great ("elf counsel"; 849 - 26 October 899) was King of Wessex from 871 to 899.[PARAGRAPH:2]Alfred successfully defended his kingdom against the Viking attempt at conquest, and by his death had become the dominant ruler in England. He is the only English monarch to be accorded the epithet "the Great". Alfred was the first King of the West Saxons to style himself "King of the Anglo-Saxons". Details of his life are described in a work by the 10th century Welsh scholar and bishop Asser. Alfred was a learned and merciful man who encouraged education and improved his kingdom's legal system and military structure.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]阿尔弗雷德大帝[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Wessex[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 849 - October 26, 899 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Alfred the Great ("elf counsel"; 849 - 26 October 899) was King of Wessex from 871 to 899.[PARAGRAPH:2]Alfred successfully defended his kingdom against the Viking attempt at conquest, and by his death had become the dominant ruler in England.[1] He is the only English monarch to be accorded the epithet "the Great". Alfred was the first King of the West Saxons to style himself "King of the Anglo-Saxons". Details of his life are described in a work by the 10th century Welsh scholar and bishop Asser. Alfred was a learned and merciful man who encouraged education and improved his kingdom's legal system and military structure.

TEXT.English: [H1]Congresses[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Congresses in Rhye's and Fall represent the phenomenon of informal institutionalization of international politics that began during the 19th century. This includes the idea of the balance of power which manifested itself in the Congress of Vienna and the Concert of Europe, but also international conferences on territorial claims such as the Berlin Congress. They also represent other diplomatic exchanges of territory like the Louisiana Purchase.[PARAGRAPH:2]Congresses take place as soon as the first civilization discovers Nationalism and regularly occur every 15 turns. The ten most powerful civilizations of the world will be invited, and each of them can either claim a city or request to found a colony on unsettled territory. If the majority of civilizations agrees, the request is granted and the city will change hands or a settler will be created on the demanded empty spot. While the human player can decide on claims by voting YES, NO or ABSTAIN, the AI will make its own decisions based on a variety of factors. These include the legitimacy of the claim (e.g. if the claimed city is historical for the civilization or if it already has culture there), the relationship to the demanding and controlling civilizations, including their own interest in the city.[PARAGRAPH:2]If a player claim was considered legitimate by an AI, but not granted because of insufficient relations, or if a player city has been granted to another civilization by the AI, the player can choose a number of options to influence the vote of AI civilizations in their favor. This can happen either through bribery (offering gold) or manipulation (expending espionage points). The player can spend varying amounts of both resources depending on how much they consider influencing their votes necessary. Another way to influence the AI is by agreeing to their own claims in the same congress - or at least avoiding to vote against them![PARAGRAPH:2]If all attempts fail and the congress still gives away one of your cities, you still have the opportunity to refuse handing it over. But be careful, this may cause some of the civilizations that agreed to the request to go to war over your contempt for their decision! The more votes were in favor of reassigning the city, the likelier an individual civilization is to go to war.[PARAGRAPH:2]Congresses are disrupted by global wars, under which different rules apply. A global war takes place when at least half the military power of the world is at war with each other. During these times, no congresses occur because the world is settling its differences on the battlefield instead of the negotiation table. However, when such a global war ends (by the main belligerents agreeing to peace), peace is enforced on all belligerents and a new congress is called to restore order after the war. Such a congress differs from normal congresses in that only belligerents are invited, that only civilizations on the winning side are allowed to make demands, and that it is impossible to request colonizing free territory. Civilizations that have lost the war still can vote on all claims, however. Congresses completely come to an end when the United Nations are built because their formalized approach to multilateral diplomacy makes congresses obsolete. [NEWLINE]If you are familiar with Congresses from Rhye's and Fall, you will notice multiple significant changes and improvements over the previous system, some of which have already been mentioned: [ICON_BULLET]In addition to periodic congresses, congresses can also occur after global wars [ICON_BULLET]Participants can also request to settle free territory [ICON_BULLET]A streamlined interaction process so that the entire congress can be resolved in one turn [ICON_BULLET]Significant improvements in computation times [ICON_BULLET]When voting on a claim, the camera centers on the plot or city in question [ICON_BULLET]The option to influence a civilization's decision is only offered when there is actually a chance of success [ICON_BULLET]Attempts to influence a decision are now specific to a certain claim and can be used both to achieve agreement to an own claim and disagreement with a claim on your own cities [ICON_BULLET]There is no limit on how many civilizations can be attempted to be influenced during the same Congress [ICON_BULLET]In addition to bribery by offering gold, votes can also be manipulated by expending espionage [ICON_BULLET]More sophisticated AI decisionmaking: it now takes the legitimacy of the claim, its relations to the claimant and owner, and its own interest in the city into account [ICON_BULLET]More global AI decisionmaking: your own voting behavior influences how the AI treats your claims and the claims against you, global opinion influences how likely AIs are to go to war over a refused claim [ICON_BULLET]No more multiple assignments during the same Congress: if more than one civilization have successfully claimed the same city, it goes to the civilization that received the most votes in favor
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]国际会议[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]当已有三个文明发现民族主义时，每隔25回合会在某座城市召开一次国际会议。九个主要文明将受邀与会。每个文明可要求某座城市的主权，其他文明可对此要求投赞成票、反对票或是弃权票。电脑玩家会根据历史上的主权归属或是与本文明的接近程度等因素决定所要求的城市。人类玩家则可在5座预选城市中要求其一。[PARAGRAPH:2]电脑玩家会根据当前的外交态度、过去的战争状况、各国的力量平衡和边界稳定等因素进行投票。你也可以贿赂某个文明为你的利益投票。但对方也有可能将此视作冒犯行为，反而在投票时不利于你！你可以拒绝履行决议，但可能因此与反对你的文明开战。

TEXT.English: [TAB]At the start of the Cold War, bombers were the only means of carrying nuclear weapons to enemy targets, and had the role of deterrence. With the advent of guided air-to-air missiles, bombers needed to avoid interception. High-speed and high-altitude flying became a means of evading detection and attack. Designs such as the English Electric Canberra could fly faster or higher than contemporary fighters. When surface-to-air missiles became capable of hitting high-flying bombers, bombers were flown at low altitudes to evade radar detection and interception.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]冷战初期，轰炸机是向敌方目标运送核武器的唯一手段，具有威慑作用。随着制导空空导弹的出现，轰炸机需要避免拦截。高速高空飞行成为躲避侦查和攻击的手段。像英国电动堪培拉这样的设计可以比当代战斗机飞得更快或更高。当地空导弹能够击中高飞轰炸机时，轰炸机在低空飞行，以躲避雷达探测和拦截。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Prambanan temple is the largest Hindu temple of ancient Java, and the first building was completed in the mid-9th century. It was likely started by Rakai Pikatan as the Hindu Sanjaya Dynasty's answer to the Buddhist Sailendra Dynasty's Borobudur and Sewu temples nearby. Historians suggest that the construction of Prambanan probably was meant to mark the return of the Hindu Sanjaya Dynasty to power in Central Java after almost a century of Buddhist Sailendra Dynasty domination. The construction of this massive Hindu temple signifies that the Medang court had shifted its patronage from Mahayana Buddhism to Shivaite Hinduism.[PARAGRAPH:2]A temple was first built at the site around 850 CE by Rakai Pikatan and expanded extensively by King Lokapala and Balitung Maha Sambu the Sanjaya king of the Mataram Kingdom. According to the Shivagrha inscription of 856 CE, the temple was built to honor Lord Shiva, and its original name was Shiva-grha (the House of Shiva) or Shiva-laya (the Realm of Shiva). According to the Shivagrha inscription, a public water project to change the course of a river near Shivagrha temple was undertaken during the construction of the temple. The river, identified as the Opak River, now runs north to south on the western side of the Prambanan temple compound. Historians suggest that originally the river was curved further to east and was deemed too near to the main temple. The project was done by cutting the river along a north to south axis along the outer wall of the Shivagrha Temple compound. The former river course was filled in and made level to create a wider space for the temple expansion, the space for rows of pervara (complementary) temples.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some archaeologists propose that the statue of Shiva in the garbhagriha (central chamber) of the main temple was modelled after King Balitung, serving as a depiction of his deified self after death.[PARAGRAPH:2]The temple compound was expanded by successive Mataram kings, such as Daksa and Tulodong, with the addition of hundreds of perwara temples around the chief temple. Prambanan served as the royal temple of the Kingdom of Mataram, with most of the state's religious ceremonies and sacrifices being conducted there. At the height of the kingdom, scholars estimate that hundreds of brahmins with their disciples lived within the outer wall of the temple compound. The urban center and the court of Mataram were located nearby, somewhere in the Prambanan Plain.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]普兰巴南神庙是古爪哇最大的印度教寺庙，第一座建筑于9世纪中叶完工。它很可能是由Rakai Pikatan作为印度教三亚王朝对佛教赛伦德拉王朝附近的婆罗浮屠和苏乌寺庙的回应而开始的。历史学家认为，普拉姆巴南的修建可能是为了纪念在佛教赛伦德拉王朝统治了近一个世纪后，印度桑贾亚王朝在爪哇中部重新掌权。这个庞大的印度教庙宇的建造意味着Medang法院已经把它的赞助从大乘佛教转移到什叶派印度教。[段落：2 ]一个寺庙首先是由拉凯皮卡坦在公元前850年的地点建造的，并被King Lokapala和Balitung Maha Sambu在马塔拉姆王国的圣贾亚国王中广泛地扩展。根据公元856年的湿婆教铭文，这座寺庙是为纪念湿婆神而建的，它的原名是湿婆之家（Shiva grha）或湿婆之国（Shiva laya）。根据Shivagraha的铭文，在Shivagraha寺庙的建设过程中，进行了一项公共供水工程，以改变Shivagraha寺庙附近的河道。这条被确认为奥帕克河的河流，现在在普兰巴南寺庙大院的西侧由北向南延伸。历史学家认为，这条河最初是向东弯曲的，被认为离主庙太近。这项工程是通过沿着Shivagraha寺庙建筑群外墙从北向南的轴线切割河流来完成的。以前的河道被填平，为寺庙扩建创造了更广阔的空间，为帕瓦拉（互补）寺庙排成了一片空间。（2）部分考古学家提出，在主庙的加布哈里哈（中央厅）中的湿婆雕像是仿照King Balitung建造的，《死亡神殿》是一部描写他死后神化自我的作品。〔2〕寺庙建筑由历代马达兰国王（如达克萨和Tulodong）扩建，在寺庙周围增加了数百座寺庙。普拉姆巴南曾是马塔兰王国的皇家寺庙，该国的大部分宗教仪式和祭祀都在那里举行。在这个王国的鼎盛时期，学者们估计有数百名婆罗门和他们的门徒居住在寺院的外墙内。城市中心和马塔兰宫就在附近，在普兰巴南平原的某个地方。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Many of the early Confucian religious buildings were destroyed during the Qin Dynasty. When the Emperor Wu (156-87 BC) adopted Confucianism as the state religion of China, he placed many Confucian scholars in positions of power; eventually, knowledge of Confucianism became a prerequisite for anyone hoping to gain employment in the Imperial government. Private and public Confucian Academies sprung up across China, where families sent their sons to study for the civil service examinations.
TEXT.Chinese: 修道院是那些希望远离尘世，追求圣洁生活的宗教僧侣们的静修场所。通常修道院都规定有严格的行为准则，确保修道者免受外来的骚扰和诱惑。有的修道院要求人人保持静默；有的完全禁止访问者入内。僧侣们每日都须在修道院中举行宗教仪式。[PARAGRAPH:1]在古代，修道院往往也成为学术研究的中心。在边远地区，僧侣可能是当地仅有的有文化者。僧侣们经常担任抄写工作，负责传抄本宗教的经书文献。修道院通常会附有图书馆，用于存放神学、科学、医学和哲学书籍。[PARAGRAPH:1]在数千年间，儒学一直是中国的官方信仰，朝庭大量任用儒士担任政府官职。许多儒学书院都获得官方的资助。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A caravanserai was a roadside inn where travelers could rest and recover from the day's journey. Caravanserais supported the flow of commerce, information, and people across the network of trade routes covering Asia, North Africa, and South-Eastern Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]Most typically a caravanserai was a building with a square or rectangular walled exterior, with a single portal wide enough to permit large or heavily laden beasts such as camels to enter. The courtyard was almost always open to the sky, and the inside walls of the enclosure were outfitted with a number of identical stalls, bays, niches, or chambers to accommodate merchants and their servants, animals, and merchandise.[PARAGRAPH:1]Caravanserais provided water for human and animal consumption, washing, and ritual ablutions. Sometimes they even had elaborate baths. They also kept fodder for animals and had shops for travellers where they could acquire new supplies. In addition, there could be shops where merchants could dispose of some of their goods.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]商队是一个路边旅馆，旅客可以在这里休息和恢复一天的旅程。CavaSaSeris支持商业、信息和人们在横跨亚洲、北非和东南欧的贸易线路网络上的流动。[段落：1 ]最典型的是一个有方形或长方形外墙的建筑物。有一个足够宽的门，可以让骆驼等大型或重负载的野兽进入。庭院几乎总是向天空敞开，围墙的内壁配备了许多相同的摊位、海湾、龛或房间，以容纳商人和他们的仆人、动物和商品。[第1段]商队为人类和动物的消费、洗涤和仪式洗礼提供了水。有时他们甚至有精心设计的浴缸。他们还为动物保留饲料，并为旅行者开设商店，在那里他们可以获得新的供应。此外，可能还有一些商店，商人可以在那里处理他们的一些货物。

TEXT.English: [TAB]American pioneers are any of the people in American history who migrated west to join in settling and developing new areas. The term especially refers to those who were going to settle any territory which had previously not been settled or developed by European, African or American society, although the territory was inhabited by or utilized by Native Americans.[PARAGRAPH:2]The pioneer concept and ethos greatly predate the migration to parts of the United States now called Western, as many places now considered as East were also settled by pioneers from the coast. For example, Daniel Boone, a key figure in American history, settled in Kentucky, when that "Dark and Bloody Ground" was still undeveloped.[PARAGRAPH:2]One important development in the Western settlement was the Homestead Act, which provided formal legislation for the settlers which regulated the settlement process.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]美国拓荒者是指美国历史上任何一个移民到西部去定居和开发新地区的人。特别是指将要定居以前没有被欧洲、非洲或美国社会定居或开发的任何领土的人，虽然这片领土是美洲土著人居住或使用的。[段：2 ]先驱概念和民族精神大大早于移民到美国现在被称为西部的部分地区，因为现在被认为是东部的许多地方也由海岸的拓荒者定居下来。例如，美国历史上的一个关键人物丹尼尔·布恩在肯塔基定居，当时“黑暗和血腥的土地”仍然未被开发。[段落：2 ]西方解决方案的一个重要发展是《霍姆斯戴德酒店法》，它为定居者提供了正式的立法，规定了殖民进程。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Rainforests are forests characterized by high rainfall, with annual rainfall between 250 and 450 centimetres (98 and 177 in). There are two types of rainforest: tropical rainforest and temperate rainforest. The monsoon trough, alternatively known as the intertropical convergence zone, plays a significant role in creating the climatic conditions necessary for the Earth's tropical rainforests.[PARAGRAPH:1]Around 40% to 75% of all biotic species are indigenous to the rainforests. It has been estimated that there may be many millions of species of plants, insects and microorganisms still undiscovered in tropical rainforests. Tropical rainforests have been called the "jewels of the Earth" and the "world's largest pharmacy", because over one quarter of natural medicines have been discovered there. Rainforests are also responsible for 28% of the world's oxygen turnover, sometimes misnamed oxygen production, processing it through photosynthesis from carbon dioxide and consuming it through respiration.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]雨林是以高降雨量为特征的森林，年降雨量在250至450厘米（98至177英寸）之间。有两种类型的雨林：热带雨林和温带雨林。季风槽，也称为热带辐合带，在创造地球热带雨林所需的气候条件中起着重要作用。[段落：1 ]约40%至75%的所有生物物种都是热带雨林的原住民。据估计，热带雨林中可能仍有数百万种植物、昆虫和微生物尚未被发现。热带雨林被称为“地球上的宝石”和“世界上最大的药房”，因为那里发现了超过四分之一的天然药物。雨林还负责全球28%的氧气周转，有时被误称为氧气生产，通过二氧化碳的光合作用处理氧气，通过呼吸消耗氧气。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Most Filipinos are a combination of Malay, Chinese, Negrito (native Filipino), and Spanish blood, but may also have a mix of Japanese and American. The racial mix originated from eras of differing foreign rule. The Negritos or Aeta ( the natives of the Philippines) were the original inhabitants of the islands. Following these hunter-gatherers was a breed that included the mix of Malays from deep southeast Asia. The Malays basically crept up starting from Mindanao. The Muslim culture stemming from Mindanao was thus born from the Malay migration. The next to step foot on Philippine soil would be the Chinese, or those originating from east Asia, as they migrated across the sea and intermixed with the natives and Malays of the Philippines.[paragraph:2]Horticulture and agriculture developed. Everything was relatively quiet until the 1500s when the Spaniards came upon the Philippines and desired to colonize it. Unfortunately for Spain, the Filipinos were not in the mood of being conquered. Ferdinand Magellan, a famous Spanish explorer credited for "discovering" the Philippines, was killed by Lapu-lapu, a famous Filipino chief credited for killing Magellan. Despite Filipino resistance, the Spanish eventually took over. Spanish rule over the Philippines would be a long one, from the 1500s to almost 1900. The Philippines' role as a key trade/base point was born. The Filipinos never did take a liking for Spanish rule, so they continued to rebel.[paragraph:2]Jose Rizal, the national hero of the Philippines, is credited for sparking the series of Filipino rebellions during the 1800s. Rizal basically made a habit of writing Philippine nationalist papers, which the Spanish did not like at all. Around the same time, another hero was born in Andres Bonifacio. So Rizal sat back and wrote papers that angered Spaniards, while Bonifacio fought and led Filipino rebellions against the Spanish that also angered the Spaniards. And so Rizal was executed, and not long after, Bonifacio was too.[paragraph:2]Emilio Aguinaldo took over as Filipino leader for a couple of years until the Spanish decided they wanted a ceasefire. Aguinaldo thought it was a good idea, so they organized an agreement that allowed Aguinaldo to go into exile and earn some money in the process. So at this point in time, the Philippines still technically belonged to Spain although Spaniard forces were taken out of the Philippines due to conflict in Cuba and with the US. The rebellions in the Philippines were at a standstill and Aguinaldo was out of the country spending Spanish pesos.[paragraph:2]The US, being at war with Spain during this time, saw this as a great opportunity to snatch the vulnerable Philippines. And so they sought about doing just that by attacking what little of the Spanish navy was left in Manila. This influenced Aguinaldo to go back and declare independence for the Philippines . By now Spain no longer saw any point in wasting any more time with the Philippines so they sold the Philippines to the US for 20 million dollars. The US took over from there and set the Philippines with a puppet government suited to their liking. Rebellions still occurred but were not effective. The outbreak of World War II resulted in the Japanese invasion of the Philippines. After the war, a lease was signed to permit US bases in the Philippines.[paragraph:2]The 1950s were relatively stable with the election of Ramon Magsaysay into power. Magsaysay tried to do good for the people but was lacking in funds. Ferdinand Marcos succeeded the throne during the 1960s and would keep the position until 1986. Macros took a good thing and got carried away with extremes. He proclaimed martial law to maintain his presidential position. Corazon Aquino followed as president at the end of Marcos' dictatorship.[paragraph:2]The Philippines exhibited some growth during the 1990s under the leadership of Fidel Ramos. Declining to run for re-election Fidel Ramos was succeeded by actor Joseph Estrada. Estrada's term unfortunately resulted in rampant political corruption and economic decline, which prompted his impeachment.Gloria Macapagal Arroyo followed as president of the Philippines. She was reelected in 2004.
TEXT.Chinese: 大多数菲律宾人是马来人、中国人、尼格里托人（菲律宾人本土人）和西班牙人血统的混合体，但也可能有日本人和美国人的混血儿。种族混合起源于不同的外国统治时期。尼格里托斯人（菲律宾土著人）是这些岛屿的原始居民。紧随这些狩猎采集者的是一个品种，其中包括来自东南亚深处的马来人。马来人基本上是从棉兰老岛开始的。因此，穆斯林移民起源于马来文化。下一个踏上菲律宾土地的将是中国人，或那些来自东亚的人，因为他们跨越海洋，与菲律宾的土著人和马来人混杂在一起[段落：2]园艺和农业发达。一切都相对平静，直到15世纪，西班牙人来到菲律宾并希望殖民。对西班牙来说，不幸的是，菲律宾人没有被征服的心情。费迪南德·麦哲伦，一位著名的西班牙探险家，因“发现”菲律宾而被著名的菲律宾酋长拉普·拉普杀害。尽管遭到菲律宾人的抵抗，西班牙人最终接管了政权。西班牙对菲律宾的统治将是一个漫长的时期，从15世纪到1900年。菲律宾作为一个关键的贸易/基点的角色诞生了。菲律宾人从不喜欢西班牙的统治，所以他们继续反抗[段落：2]菲律宾的民族英雄何塞·里扎尔（Jose Rizal）在19世纪引发了一系列菲律宾人的叛乱，他基本上养成了写菲律宾民族主义报纸的习惯，而西班牙人对此一点也不喜欢。大约在同一时间，另一个英雄诞生在安德烈斯博尼法西奥。因此，里扎尔坐视不理，写了一些激怒西班牙人的文章，而博尼法西奥则奋战并领导菲律宾人反抗西班牙人的叛乱，这也激怒了西班牙人。于是，里扎尔被处死了，不久，博尼法西奥也被处死了[段落：2]埃米利奥·阿奎纳多接任菲律宾领导人几年，直到西班牙人决定停火。阿奎纳多认为这是个好主意，于是他们组织了一项协议，允许阿奎纳多流亡海外，并在这个过程中挣些钱。因此，在这个时间点上，菲律宾在技术上仍然属于西班牙，尽管由于古巴和美国的冲突，西班牙人的军队已经撤出菲律宾。菲律宾的叛乱陷于停顿，阿奎纳多也在国外花了西班牙比索[段落：2]在这段时间里，美国与西班牙处于战争状态，认为这是一个抓住脆弱的菲律宾的大好机会。所以他们试图通过攻击马尼拉仅存的西班牙海军来达到这个目的。这影响了阿奎纳多回去宣布菲律宾独立。到现在为止，西班牙已经看不到在菲律宾浪费更多时间的必要性，所以他们以2000万美元的价格把菲律宾卖给了美国。美国从那里接管了菲律宾，并为菲律宾建立了一个适合他们的傀儡政府。叛乱仍然发生，但没有效果。第二次世界大战的爆发导致日本入侵菲律宾。战后，签署了一份允许美国在菲律宾设立基地的租约[段落：2]随着拉蒙·马格赛西（Ramon Magsaysay）当选执政，20世纪50年代相对稳定。玛格赛赛试图为人民做好事，但缺乏资金。费迪南德·马科斯在20世纪60年代继承了王位，并将一直保持到1986年。宏拿了一个好东西，却被极端的东西迷住了。他宣布戒严以维持他的总统职位。科拉松·阿基诺在马科斯独裁统治末期接任总统[段落：2]在菲德尔·拉莫斯的领导下，菲律宾在20世纪90年代出现了一些增长。拒绝竞选连任的菲德尔·拉莫斯由演员约瑟夫·埃斯特拉达接替。不幸的是，埃斯特拉达的任期导致了猖獗的政治腐败和经济衰退弹劾。格洛里亚马卡帕加尔·阿罗约随后出任菲律宾总统。她在2004年再次当选。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The site on which the Potala Palace rises is built over a palace erected by Songtsen Gampo on the Red Hill. The Potala contains two chapels on its northwest corner that conserve parts of the original building. One is the Phakpa Lhakhang, the other the Chogyel Drupuk, a recessed cavern identified as Songtsen Gampo's meditation cave. Lozang Gyatso, the Great Fifth Dalai Lama, started the construction of the modern Potala Palace in 1645 after one of his spiritual advisers, Konchog Chophel (died 1646), pointed out that the site was ideal as a seat of government, situated as it is between Drepung and Sera monasteries and the old city of Lhasa. The external structure was built in 3 years, while the interior, together with its furnishings, took 45 years to complete. The Dalai Lama and his government moved into the Potrang Karpo ('White Palace') in 1649. Construction lasted until 1694, some twelve years after his death. The Potala was used as a winter palace by the Dalai Lama from that time. The Potrang Marpo ('Red Palace') was added between 1690 and 1694.[PARAGRAPH:2]The new palace got its name from a hill on Cape Comorin at the southern tip of India-a rocky point sacred to the bodhisattva of compassion, who is known as Avalokitesvara, or Chenrezi. The Tibetans themselves rarely speak of the sacred place as the "Potala", but rather as "Peak Potala" (Tse Potala), or most commonly as "the Peak".[PARAGRAPH:2]The palace was moderately damaged during the Tibetan uprising against the Chinese in 1959, when Chinese shells were launched into the palace's windows. Before Chamdo Jampa Kalden was shot and taken prisoner by soldiers of the People's Liberation Army, he witnessed "Chinese cannon shells began landing on Norbulingka past midnight on March 19th, 1959... The sky lit up as the Chinese shells hit the Chakpori Medical College and the Potala." It also escaped damage during the Cultural Revolution in 1966 through the personal intervention of Zhou Enlai, who was then the Premier of the People's Republic of China. Tibetan activist Tsering Woeser claims that the palace, which harboured "over 100,000 volumes of scriptures and historical documents" and "many store rooms for housing precious objects, handicrafts, paintings, wall hangings, statues, and ancient armour", "was almost robbed empty". On the other hand, tibetologist Amy Heller writes that "the invaluable library and artistic treasures accumulated over the centuries in the Potala have been preserved."[PARAGRAPH:2]The Potala Palace was inscribed to the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1994. In 2000 and 2001, Jokhang Temple and Norbulingka were added to the list as extensions to the sites. Rapid modernisation has been a concern for UNESCO, however, which expressed concern over the building of modern structures immediately around the palace which threaten the palace's unique atmosphere. The Chinese government responded by enacting a rule barring the building of any structure taller than 21 metres in the area. UNESCO was also concerned over the materials used during the restoration of the palace, which commenced in 2002 at a cost of RMB180 million (US$22.5 million), although the palace's director, Qiangba Gesang, has clarified that only traditional materials and craftsmanship were used. The palace has also received restoration works between 1989 and 1994, costing RMB55 million (US$6.875 million).[PARAGRAPH:2]The number of visitors to the palace was restricted to 1,600 a day, with opening hours reduced to six hours daily to avoid over-crowding from 1 May 2003. The palace was receiving an average of 1,500 a day prior to the introduction of the quota, sometimes peaking to over 5,000 in one day. Visits to the structure's roof were banned after restoration efforts were completed in 2006 to avoid further structural damage. Visitorship quotas were raised to 2,300 daily to accommodate a 30% increase in visitorship since the opening of the Qingzang railway into Lhasa on 1 July 2006, but the quota is often reached by mid-morning. Opening hours were extended during the peak period in the months of July to September, where over 6,000 visitors would descend on the site.
TEXT.Chinese: [附]布达拉宫所在地是在松赞干布在红山上修建的宫殿之上。布达拉的西北角有两个小教堂，保留了原有建筑的一部分。一个是法帕拉康，另一个是乔伊尔德鲁普克，一个隐藏的洞穴，被认为是松赞干布的冥想洞穴。伟大的第五代达赖喇嘛洛藏嘉措（Lozang Gyatso）于1645年开始修建现代布达拉宫，他的一位精神顾问Konchog Chophel（死于1646年）指出，该遗址是理想的政府所在地，位于哲蚌寺和色拉寺之间以及拉萨古城之间。外部结构用了3年建成，而内部结构及其家具用了45年才完成。达赖喇嘛和他的政府在1649年搬进了波德朗卡波（白宫）。工程一直持续到1694年，在他死后大约12年。布达拉从那时起就被达赖喇嘛用作冬宫。Potrang Marpo（“红宫”）在1690和1694之间增加。[段：2 ]新宫殿的名字来自于印地安那州南端科摩林的一座山，一座神圣的菩萨圣地，被称为观音菩萨。藏族人自己很少提到“布达拉”这个神圣的地方，而更像是“PaTala峰”（Tse Potala），或者最常见的是“顶峰”。[段：2 ]在1959的西藏起义中，当中国的炮弹被发射到宫殿的窗户中时，宫殿被适度损坏。在查姆多·贾姆帕·卡尔登被中国人民解放军士兵开枪俘虏之前，他亲眼目睹了“1959年3月19日午夜时分，中国炮弹开始降落在诺布林卡。。。当中国炮弹击中查波里医学院和布达拉时，天空亮了起来，“1966年文化大革命期间，它也在当时的中华人民共和国总理周恩来的亲自干预下逃脱了损失。西藏维权人士Tsering Woeser声称，藏有“超过10万卷经文和历史文献”和“许多存放贵重物品、手工艺品、绘画、壁挂、雕像和古代盔甲的储藏室”的宫殿“几乎被抢劫一空”。另一方面，藏族人Amy Heller写道：“Potala在百年来积累的宝贵的图书馆和艺术珍品已被保存下来”（2段）：布达拉宫于1994被列入联合国教科文组织世界遗产名录。2000年和2001年，大昭寺和诺布林加作为遗址的延伸被列入名单。然而，快速现代化一直是联合国教科文组织关注的问题，该组织对紧靠宫殿周围的现代建筑表示关注，这些建筑威胁到宫殿独特的氛围。对此，中国政府颁布了一项规定，禁止在该地区修建任何高度超过21米的建筑物。联合国教科文组织还对修复宫殿期间使用的材料表示关注，修复工作于2002年开始，耗资1.8亿元人民币（2250万美元），尽管宫殿的主管强巴·格桑澄清说，只使用传统材料和工艺。这座宫殿在1989至1994年间也收到了修复工程，耗资五千五百万元人民币（合687万5000美元）。（第2段），每天参观宫殿的人数限制在1600人，每天开放时间减少到六小时，以避免从2003年5月1日开始拥挤。在实行配额制之前，皇宫平均每天收到1500英镑，有时一天内达到5000英镑以上的峰值。2006年修复工作完成后，为了避免进一步的结构损坏，禁止参观建筑物的屋顶。自2006年7月1日青藏铁路通车拉萨以来，为了适应30%的旅客增长，游客配额每天提高到2300人，但通常在上午中旬达到。开放时间在7月至9月的高峰期延长，届时将有超过6000名游客来到现场。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The chariot was the earliest means of transportation in combat other than man's own powers of locomotion. The earliest known chariots, shown in Sumerian depictions from about 2500 BC, were not true chariots but four-wheeled carts with solid wooden wheels, heavy and cumbersome and lacking a pivoting front axle. The Hyksos apparently introduced the Assyrian chariot into Egypt shortly thereafter, where it was perfected for transportation and warfare. Within 500 years, Egyptian, Hittite and Palestinian chariots were extraordinarily light and maneuverable vehicles, the wheels and tires in particular exhibiting great sophistication in design and fabrication. Egyptian war chariots were drawn by either two or three horses, which were harnessed by means of chest girths secured by a pole and a yoke.[PARAGRAPH:1]The decline of the war chariot by the end of the 2nd millennium BC was probably related to the spread of iron weaponry, but it was surely related also to the breeding of horses with sufficient strength and stamina to carry an armed man into battle. Armed horsemen replaced the chariot in most Mediterranean civilizations. The use of chariots in war lingered in areas of slower technological advance, but in classical Egypt they were retained mainly for ceremonial functions.
TEXT.Chinese: 战车是除人类自身的运动能力外，最早的作战交通工具。最早的已知战车，显示在苏美尔人描绘从约公元前2500年，不是真正的战车，而是四轮车与坚实的木制车轮，沉重和笨重，缺乏一个旋转前轴。希克索斯人显然在不久之后把亚述战车引进了埃及，在那里，战车在运输和战争方面都得到了完善。在500年的时间里，埃及、赫梯和巴勒斯坦的战车都是非常轻便和机动的车辆，尤其是车轮和轮胎在设计和制造方面表现出了极大的复杂性。埃及战车是由两匹马或三匹马牵拉而成的，它们是用一根杆子和一根轭固定在胸围上的。（1段）公元前第二世纪末战争战车的衰败可能与铁武器的传播有关，但这肯定也与培育有足够力量和耐力的马，使其能携带一名武装人员参战有关。在大多数地中海文明中，武装骑兵取代了战车。战车在技术进步较慢的地区仍在使用，但在古典埃及，战车主要用于仪式。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Bletchley Park, also known as Station X, is an estate located in the town of Bletchley, now part of Milton Keynes, England. During World War II, Bletchley Park was the location of the United Kingdom's main codebreaking establishment. Codes and ciphers of several Axis countries were deciphered there, most famously the German Enigma. The high-level intelligence produced by Bletchley Park, codenamed Ultra, is frequently credited with aiding the Allied war effort and shortening the war, although Ultra's effect on the actual outcome of WWII is debated.[PARAGRAPH:2]Just before war broke out Biuro Szyfrów revealed Poland's achievements on decrypting German Enigma codes to British intelligence. The British used the information given to them by Poland as a basis for their own attempts to decrypt German Enigma signals. The "first wave" of the Government Code and Cypher School moved to Bletchley Park on 15 August 1939. The main body of GC and CS, including its Naval, Military and Air Sections was on the ground floor of the house, together with a telephone exchange, a teleprinter room, a kitchen and a dining room for all the staff. The top floor was allocated to MI6. The prefabricated wooden huts were still being erected, and initially the entire shooting party was crowded into the existing house, its stables and cottages. These were too small, so Elmers School, a neighbouring boys' boarding school was acquired for the Commercial and Diplomatic Sections (Smith, 1998 page 2-3).[PARAGRAPH:2]A wireless room was set up in the mansion's water tower and given the code name "Station X",a term now sometimes applied to the codebreaking efforts at Bletchley as a whole. Due to the long radio aerials stretching from the wireless room, the radio station was soon moved away from Bletchley Park, in order to not draw attention to the site.[PARAGRAPH:2]Listening stations - the "Y" Stations (such as the ones at Chicksands and Beaumanor Hall, the War Office "Y" Group HQ) - gathered raw signals for processing at Bletchley. Coded messages were taken down by hand and sent to Bletchley on paper by motorcycle couriers or, later, by teleprinter. Bletchley Park is mainly remembered for breaking messages enciphered on the German Enigma cypher machine, but its greatest cryptographic achievement may have been the breaking of the German "Fish" High Command teleprinter cyphers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The intelligence produced from decrypts at Bletchley was code-named "ULTRA". It contributed greatly to the Allied success in defeating the U-boats in the Battle of the Atlantic, and to the British naval victories of Battle of Cape Matapanand the Battle of North Cape.[PARAGRAPH:2]When the United States joined the war Churchill agreed with Roosevelt to pool resources and a number of American cryptographers were posted to Bletchley Park. Whilst the British continued to work on German cyphers, the Americans concentrated on the Japanese ones.[PARAGRAPH:2]The only direct action that the site experienced was when three bombs, thought to have been intended for Bletchley railway station, were dropped on 20-21 Nov 1940. One bomb exploded next to the dispatch riders' entrance, shifting the whole of Hut 4 (the Naval Intelligence hut) two feet on its base. As the huts stood on brick pillars, engineers just winched it back into position whilst work continued inside.[PARAGRAPH:2]An outpost of Bletchley Park was set up at Kilindini, Kenya to break and decipher Japanese codes. With a mixture of skill and good fortune, this was successfully done: the Japanese merchant marine suffered 90 per cent losses by August 1945, a result of decrypts.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]布莱奇利公园，又称X站，是位于布莱奇利镇的一个庄园，现在是英国米尔顿凯恩斯的一部分。在第二次世界大战期间，布莱奇公园是英国主要的破译代码机构所在地。几个轴心国的密码和密码在那里被破译，最著名的是德国之谜。BeltChelPark的代号为ULTP的高级情报经常被认为是帮助盟军作战努力和缩短战争的，尽管胡特对二战的实际结果产生了影响。[第2段]在战争爆发前Biuro SZyff-W揭示了波兰在解密英国谜团代码方面取得的成就。智慧。英国人利用波兰提供给他们的信息作为自己试图解密德国谜团信号的基础。1939年8月15日，政府法典和Cypher学校的“第一波”搬到了布莱奇公园。GC和CS的主体，包括其海军、军事和空军部分，都在这栋房子的底层，还有一个电话交换机、一个电传打字机室、一个厨房和一个供所有工作人员使用的餐厅。顶层被分配给军情六处。预制的木屋还在搭建中，最初整个射击队都挤进了现有的房子、马厩和小屋。这些都太小了，所以埃尔默斯学校，一个邻近的男孩寄宿学校被收购的商业和外交部门（史米斯，1998页2-3）。[段落：2 ]一个无线房间是建立在大厦的水塔，并给出了代号为“站X”，现在一个术语，有时适用于代码分解工作在布列切利作为一个整体。由于从无线房间延伸出的无线电天线很长，广播电台很快就从BeltChelPark搬走了，以便不引起人们对该网站的注意。[第2段]收听站-“Y”站（如在Fiksand and PoMaor Hall厅的）。战争办公室“Y”集团总部——收集原始信号，在布莱奇里进行处理。编码信息被手工记录下来，然后由摩托车快递员或后来的电传打字机在纸上发送给布莱奇利。BeltChelPark主要被记住在德国谜语密码机上加密的破译信息，但它最大的密码成就可能是打破了德国的“鱼”高指令电传器密码。[段落：2 ]从BeltChle解密产生的情报称为“超”。它极大地促进了盟军在大西洋战役中击败潜艇的成功，以及英国海军在马塔潘战役和北角战役中的胜利。[段：2 ]当美国加入战争时，丘吉尔同意与罗斯福合营资源，许多美国密码学者被派往布莱切利公园。当英国人继续研究德国的密码时，美国人把注意力集中在日本人身上。[段落：2 ]该网站所经历的唯一直接行动是，当三枚炸弹被认为是针对布莱切利火车站的时候，他们在20月21日至1940日落空。一枚炸弹在派遣骑兵入口附近爆炸，使整个4号小屋（海军情报小屋）在基地上移动了两英尺。当小屋矗立在砖柱上时，工程师们就把它卷回原位，工作继续进行。[段落：2 ]布雷切利公园的前哨基地设在肯尼亚的基林迪尼，用来破译破译日本的法典。由于技术和好运的混合，这项工作成功地完成了：由于解密，日本商船在1945年8月遭受了90%的损失。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A chiefdom is a form of hierarchical political organization in non-industrial societies usually based on kinship, and in which formal leadership is monopolized by the legitimate senior members of select families or 'houses'. These elites form a political-ideological aristocracy relative to the general group.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]酋长制是非工业社会中一种等级政治组织形式，通常以亲属关系为基础，正式领导权由选定家庭或“家庭”的合法高级成员垄断。这些精英形成了相对于一般群体的政治思想贵族。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Contrary to popular conception, barter (goods and services exchanged directly for other goods and services) was not the primary method of economic transaction in pre-currency societies. Instead, early civilizations generally used a system of reciprocity, sometimes called a gift economy. Goods and services are given without expectation of something explicit in return. By giving generously and diplomatically individuals or states increase their prestige - making them more likely to receive useful and valuable gifts from other aspiring people.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Reciprocity's strength is the strong social ties and obligations it creates but these are hard to maintain in more populous societies and across larger distances. Critically though, gift economies are economies of abundance, not scarcity. Social bonds can quickly break down when basic subsistence is a struggle.
TEXT.Chinese: 与流行的观念相反，易货贸易（直接与其他商品和服务交换的商品和服务）不是前货币社会经济交易的主要方式。相反，早期文明通常使用互惠制度，有时称为礼物经济。提供商品和服务，并不期望得到明确的回报。通过慷慨和外交地给予个人或国家增加他们的威望，使他们更有可能从其他有抱负的人那里得到有用和有价值的礼物。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]互惠的力量是它所创造的强大的社会联系和义务，但在人口更多的社会和国家中，这是很难保持的更远的距离。但至关重要的是，礼物经济是富足经济，而不是稀缺经济。当基本生活是一场斗争时，社会纽带会很快瓦解。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A sophisticated and technologically advanced urban culture is evident in the Indus Valley Civilization making them the first urban centers in the region. The quality of municipal town planning suggests the knowledge of urban planning and efficient municipal governments which placed a high priority on hygiene, or, alternatively, accessibility to the means of religious ritual.[PARAGRAPH:1]As seen in Harappa, Mohenjo-Daro and the recently partially excavated Rakhigarhi, this urban plan included the world's first known urban sanitation systems: see hydraulic engineering of the Indus Valley Civilization. Within the city, individual homes or groups of homes obtained water from wells. From a room that appears to have been set aside for bathing, waste water was directed to covered drains, which lined the major streets. Houses opened only to inner courtyards and smaller lanes. The house-building in some villages in the region still resembles in some respects the house-building of the Harappans.[PARAGRAPH:1]The ancient Indus systems of sewerage and drainage that were developed and used in cities throughout the Indus region were far more advanced than any found in contemporary urban sites in the Middle East and even more efficient than those in many areas of Pakistan and India today. The advanced architecture of the Harappans is shown by their impressive dockyards, granaries, warehouses, brick platforms, and protective walls. The massive walls of Indus cities most likely protected the Harappans from floods and may have dissuaded military conflicts.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]印度河流域文明体现了先进的城市文化，使其成为该地区第一个城市中心。市镇规划的质量表明，城市规划和高效市级政府对卫生的高度重视，或者宗教仪式手段的可及性。（哈拉帕：Mohenjo Daro）和最近部分挖掘的拉希加里（1）。这一城市规划包括世界上第一个已知的城市卫生系统：见印度河流域文明的水利工程。在城市内部，个别家庭或一组家庭从水井中取水。从一个看起来是用来洗澡的房间里，废水被排到主要街道两旁有盖的排水沟里。房子只对内部庭院和小巷开放。该地区一些村庄的房屋建筑在某些方面与哈拉帕斯的房屋建筑相似。[段落：1 ]印度河流域的城市开发和使用的古印度河流域排水系统远比中东当代城市中的任何地方都要先进得多，甚至更多。比今天巴基斯坦和印度许多地区的效率都高。哈拉帕人先进的建筑表现在他们令人印象深刻的船坞、粮仓、仓库、砖平台和防护墙。印度河城市的巨大城墙很可能保护了哈拉帕人免受洪水侵袭，并可能阻止了军事冲突。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Itaipu Dam is a hydroelectric dam on the Paraná River located on the border between Brazil and Paraguay. The construction of the dam was first contested by Argentina, but the negotiations and resolution of the dispute ended up setting the basis for Argentine-Brazilian integration later on.[PARAGRAPH:2]The name "Itaipu" was taken from an isle that existed near the construction site. In the Guarani language, Itaipu means "the sounding stone". The Itaipu Dam's hydroelectric power plant produced the most energy of any in the world as of 2016, setting a new world record of 103,098,366 megawatt hours (MWh), and surpassed the Three Gorges Dam plant in energy production in 2015 and 2016. Completed in 1984, it is a binational undertaking run by Brazil and Paraguay at the border between the two countries, 15 km (9.3 mi) north of the Friendship Bridge. The project ranges from Foz do Iguaçu, in Brazil, and Ciudad del Este in Paraguay, in the south to Guaíra and Salto del Guairá in the north. The installed generation capacity of the plant is 14 GW, with 20 generating units providing 700 MW each with a hydraulic design head of 118 metres (387 ft). In 2016, the plant employed 3038 workers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Of the twenty generator units currently installed, ten generate at 50 Hz for Paraguay and ten generate at 60 Hz for Brazil. Since the output capacity of the Paraguayan generators far exceeds the load in Paraguay, most of their production is exported directly to the Brazilian side, from where two 600 kV HVDC lines, each approximately 800 kilometres (500 mi) long, carry the majority of the energy to the São Paulo/Rio de Janeiro region where the terminal equipment converts the power to 60 Hz.
TEXT.Chinese: 三峡大坝是一项利用长江丰富的水利资源的大型工程，长江是世界第三长河。工程建设开始于1994年，在中国的湖北省，设计竣工时间为2009年。预计在完工后，大坝将有600英尺高，1.3英里长，是世界上最大的水电大坝。中国政府估计最终投资达到300亿美元，中立方则估计投资将达到750亿美元之巨。[PARAGRAPH:2]在长江上建水坝的构想可追溯到1919年的孙中山，但这一设想被中国面临的一系列的战争，革命以及各种自然灾害耽搁了40年。这一计划于1954年曾经被提起又放弃，1963年又再度被提起又再度被放弃，直到这一计划最终于1992年被确定。[PARAGRAPH:2]对这一计划存在着很多争议，首先是这将要迁移大约两百万人，而后是将淹没1300处该地区的重要古迹。尽管存在诸多争议，中国政府还是决定实施这一计划，三峡工程项目在全国人民代表大会表决时竟出现超过30%%的反对意见，对这个向来被视为政府决策“橡皮图章”的机构来说可谓空前。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The junzi is a Chinese philosophical term often translated as "gentleman" or "superior person" and employed by both the Duke of Wen in the I-ching and Confucius in his works to describe the ideal man.[PARAGRAPH:1]In Confucianism, Sage is the ideal personality, however, it is very hard to become and so Confucius created the junzi, gentleman, which can be achieved by an individual. Later, Zhu Xi defined junzi as second only to the sage. There are many characteristics of junzi. Junzi' can live with poverty. Junzi does more and speaks less. A junzi is loyal, obedient and knowledgeable. Junzi disciplines himself. Among these, Ren is the core of becoming the junzi.[PARAGRAPH:1]As the potential leader of a nation, a son of the ruler is raised to have a superior ethical and moral position while gaining inner peace through his virtue. To Confucius, the junzi sustained the functions of government and social stratification through his ethical values. Despite its literal meaning, any righteous man willing to improve himself can become a junzi.[PARAGRAPH:1]On the contrary, the xiaoren (small or petty person") does not grasp the value of virtues and seeks only immediate gains. The petty person is egotistic and does not consider the consequences of his action in the overall scheme of things. Should the ruler be surrounded by xiaoren as opposed to junzi, his governance and his people will suffer due to their small-mindness. Examples of such xiaoren individuals can range from those who continually indulge in sensual and emotional pleasures all day to the career politician who is interested merely in power and fame; neither sincerely aims for the long-term benefit of others.[PARAGRAPH:1]The junzi enforces his rule over his subjects by acting virtuously himself. It is thought that his pure virtue would lead others to follow his example. The ultimate goal is that government behaves much like family. Thus at all levels filial piety promotes harmony and the junzi acts as a beacon for this piety.
TEXT.Chinese: 《君子》是一个常被翻译为“君子”或“上等人”的中国哲学术语，在《易经》和《孔子》中都用其来描述理想的人。[段落：1 ]儒家思想中，贤人是理想的人格，然而，很难成为Confucius的君子、君子，这是个人可以做到的。后来，朱熹把君子定义为仅次于圣人。《君子》有许多特点。君子可以过上贫穷的生活。君子做事多说话少。君子忠心、听话、博学。君子自律。其中，仁是成为君子的核心。[段落：1 ]作为一个民族的潜在领袖，统治者的儿子被提升为具有优越的道德和道德地位，同时通过他的美德获得内在的和平。在孔子看来，君子通过其伦理价值观维系着政府和社会分层的功能。尽管有字面意思，任何愿意提高自己的义人都可以成为君子。[段落：1 ]相反，小人（小或小人）不掌握美德的价值，只寻求眼前的收获。小人物是自私自利的，不把自己行为的后果考虑在整体的计划中。如果统治者被小人包围，而不是被君子包围，他的统治和人民将会因为他们的小心胸而受苦。这种小人的例子可以从那些整天沉湎于感官和情感享乐的人身上发现，他们只对权力和名誉感兴趣，而不是真诚地追求他人的长远利益。〔1〕君子以行为得体的方式强行统治自己的臣民。人们认为，他的纯粹美德会使其他人效仿他的榜样。最终的目标是政府的行为很像家庭。因此，在各级孝道促进和谐，君子充当了这种孝道的灯塔。

TEXT.English: [TAB]An interstellar probe is a space probe that has left-or is expected to leave-the Solar System and enter interstellar space, which is typically defined as the region beyond the heliopause. It also refers to probes capable of reaching other star systems.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are five interstellar probes: Voyager 1, Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, Pioneer 11 and New Horizons. As of 2019, Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 are only probes to have actually reached interstellar space. The other three are on interstellar trajectories.[PARAGRAPH:2]The termination shock is the point in the heliosphere where the solar wind slows down to subsonic speed. Even though the termination shock happens as close as 80-100 AU, the maximum extent of the region in which the Sun's gravitational field is dominant (the Hill sphere) is thought to be at around 230,000 astronomical units (3.6 light-years). This point is close to the nearest known star system, Alpha Centauri, located 4.36 light years away. Although the probes will be under the influence of the Sun for a long time, their velocities far exceed the Sun's escape velocity, so they will eventually leave forever.[PARAGRAPH:2]Interstellar space is defined as that which lies beyond a magnetic region that extends about 122 AU from the sun, as detected by Voyager 1, and the equivalent region of influence surrounding other stars. Voyager 1 entered interstellar space in 2012.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]星际探测器是一种已经离开或预期离开太阳系进入星际空间的空间探测器，通常被定义为太阳顶以外的区域。它也指能够到达其他恒星系统的探测器。[段：2 ]有五个星际探测器：旅行者1号，旅行者2号，先锋10号，先驱11号和新地平线。截至2019年，“旅行者1号”和“旅行者2号”是唯一真正到达星际空间的探测器。另外三个在星际轨道上。[段落：2 ]终止震是太阳风减速到亚音速的日光层中的点。即使终止冲击发生在接近80-100金的地方，太阳引力场占主导地位的区域（山丘球体）的最大范围被认为在23万天文单位（3.6光年）左右。这一点距离最近的已知恒星系统半人马座α星（Alpha Centauri）很近，距离我们4.36光年。虽然探测器将长期受太阳的影响，但是它们的速度远远超过太阳的逃逸速度，所以它们最终将永远地离开。【段落：2】星际空间被定义为位于旅行者1号探测到的从太阳延伸约122 Au的磁性区域之外。以及其他恒星周围的等效影响区。旅行者1号于2012年进入星际空间。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A coffeehouse or coffee shop is an establishment which primarily serves prepared coffee or other hot beverages. It shares some of the characteristics of a bar, and some of the characteristics of a restaurant, but it is different from a cafeteria. As the name suggests, coffeehouses focus on providing coffee and tea as well as light snacks. Many coffee houses in the Middle East, and in West Asian immigrant districts in the Western world, offer shisha (nargile in Turkish and Greek), flavored tobacco smoked through a hookah.[PARAGRAPH:2]From a cultural standpoint, coffeehouses largely serve as centers of social interaction: the coffeehouse provides social members with a place to congregate, talk, write, read, entertain one another, or pass the time, whether individually or in small groups of 2 or 3.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]咖啡厅或咖啡厅是主要提供咖啡或其他热饮料的场所。它有酒吧的一些特点，也有餐馆的一些特点，但它不同于自助餐厅。顾名思义，咖啡馆专注于提供咖啡、茶和小吃。中东的许多咖啡馆和西方的西亚移民区，都提供了什叶派（土耳其和希腊的纳吉尔），从烟壶中熏出的香料烟。[段落：2 ]，从文化的角度来看，咖啡馆在很大程度上是社会互动的中心：咖啡馆为社会成员提供了一个聚会、交谈、写作、阅读、娱乐或消磨时间的场所，无论是单独的还是2或3人组成的小组。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ancestor worship plays a large role in Chinese folk religion, also sometimes called "Shendao" or "Way of the Gods". Temples dedicated to deified ancestors are common, and are closely linked to the emphasis that Chinese culture puts on filial piety. Since Chinese folk religion is complex and diverse, many other types of temples exist in China, including some dedicated to Chinese gods and past emperors. These exist alongside Confucian, Taoist, and Buddhist places of worship.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]祖先崇拜在中国民间宗教中占有重要地位，有时也被称为“神道”或“神道”。供奉神化祖先的寺庙很常见，与中国文化强调孝道有着密切的联系。由于中国民间宗教的复杂性和多样性，中国还存在许多其他类型的寺庙，包括一些供奉中国神明和历代帝王的寺庙。它们与儒家、道教和佛教的礼拜场所共存。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Grasslands are areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants (forbs). However, sedge (Cyperaceae) and rush (Juncaceae) families can also be found. Grasslands occur naturally on all continents except Antarctica. In temperate latitudes, such as northwest Europe and the Great Plains and California in North America, native grasslands are dominated by perennial bunch grass species, whereas in warmer climates annual species form a greater component of the vegetation.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]草原是指植被以禾本科和其他草本（非木本）植物为主的地区。然而，莎草科（莎草科）和灯心草科（灯心草科）也可以找到。除南极洲外，所有大陆都有天然草地。在温带地区，如欧洲西北部和北美的大平原以及加利福尼亚州，本地草地主要是多年生丛生草本植物，而在温暖的气候中，一年生草本植物是植被的主要组成部分。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A triumphal arch is a structure in the shape of a monumental archway, usually built to celebrate a victory in war. The arch is invariably a free-standing structure, quite separate from city gates or walls. In its simplest form a triumphal arch consists of two pillars connected by an arch, crowned with a superstructure or attic on which a statue or commemorative inscriptions might be mounted. More elaborate triumphal arches have flanking subsidiary archways, typically a pair. Famous arches include the Arch of Titus in Rome and the Arc de Triomphe in Paris.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]凯旋门是一种纪念性拱门形状的结构，通常用于庆祝战争胜利。拱门总是一个独立的结构，与城门或城墙完全分开。凯旋门最简单的形式是由两根柱子组成，柱子之间有一个拱门相连，拱顶上有一个上层建筑或阁楼，可以在上面安装雕像或纪念性碑文。更精致的凯旋门有两侧的副拱门，通常是一对。著名的拱门包括罗马的提图斯拱门和巴黎的凯旋门。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Church of Saint George was carved downwards from a type of volcanic tuff. This is the sole architectural material that was used in the structure. It has been dated to the late 12th or early 13th century AD, and thought to have been constructed during the reign of King Gebre Mesqel Lalibela, of the late Zagwe dynasty. It is among the best known and last built of the eleven churches in the Lalibela area, and has been referred to as the "Eighth Wonder of the World". Lalibela, King of Ethiopia, sought to recreate Jerusalem, and structured the churches' landscape and religious sites in such a way as to achieve such a feat. The churches at Lalibela are clustered in two major groups, one representing the earthly Jerusalem, and the other representing the heavenly Jerusalem. Located directly between them is a trench representing the River Jordan. The dimensions of the trench are 25 meters by 25 meters by 30 meters, and there is a small baptismal pool outside the church, which stands in an artificial trench.[PARAGRAPH:2]According to Ethiopian cultural history, Bete Giyorgis was built after King Gebre Mesqel Lalibela of the Zagwe dynasty had a vision in which he was instructed to construct the church; Saint George and God have both been referred to as the one who gave him the instructions.
TEXT.Chinese: 圣乔治教堂是由一种火山凝灰岩向下雕刻而成的。这是建筑结构中使用的唯一建筑材料。它可以追溯到公元12世纪末或13世纪初，被认为是在扎格威王朝晚期的盖布雷·梅斯凯尔·拉利贝拉国王统治时期建造的。它是拉利贝拉地区十一座教堂中最著名和最后一座，被称为“世界第八大奇迹”。埃塞俄比亚国王拉利贝拉（Lalibela）试图重建耶路撒冷，并将教堂的景观和宗教场所设计成这样，以达到这样的壮举。拉利贝拉的教会主要分为两大类，一类代表地上的耶路撒冷，另一类代表天上的耶路撒冷。它们之间是一条代表约旦河的海沟。海沟的尺寸为25米25米，宽30米，教堂外有一个小洗礼池，位于人工壕沟中。[埃塞俄比亚文化史]第2段。贝特·吉约吉斯是在扎格威王朝的国王盖布雷·梅斯凯尔·拉利贝拉（Gebre Mesqel Lalibela）接受指示建造教堂后建造的；圣乔治（Saint George）和上帝都被认为是给他指示的人。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Harmandir Sahib, also referred to as the Golden Temple, is a prominent Sikh Gurdwara located in the city of Amritsar, Punjab, India. Construction of the Gurdwara was begun by Guru Ram Das ji, the fourth Sikh Guru, and completed by his successor, Guru Arjan Dev ji. In 1604, Guru Arjan Dev ji completed the Adi Granth, the holy scripture of Sikhism, and installed it in the Gurdwara. In 1634, Guru Hargobind left Amritsar for the Shivalik Hills and for the remainder of the seventeenth century the city and Gurdwara was in the hands of forces hostile to the Sikh Gurus. During the eighteenth century, Sri Harmandir Sahib was the site of frequent fighting between the Sikhs on one side and either Mughal or Afghan forces on the other side and the Gurdwara occasionally suffered damage. In the early nineteenth century, Maharaja Ranjit Singh secured the Punjab region from outside attack and covered the upper floors of the Gurdwara with gold, which gives it its distinctive appearance and English name of "Golden Temple".[PARAGRAPH:1]The present day Golden Temple was rebuilt in 1764 by Maharaja Jassa Singh Ahluwalia (1718-1783) with the help of other Misl Sikh chieftains. The gold plating of all the domes of Sri Darbar Sahib was done by Maharaja Jassa Singh Ahluwalia's descendents. Between 1802-1830 Ranjit Singh did the sewa of adding gold plating and marble to the Gurdwara, while the interior was decorated with fresco work and gemstones.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]哈曼迪尔萨希布，也被称为金殿，是一个著名的锡克教古尔德瓦人，位于印度旁遮普省阿姆利则市。古矮人的建造是由第四位锡克教大师拉姆达斯基（Guru Ram Das ji）开始的，由他的继任者阿扬德夫基（Guru Arjan Dev ji）完成。1604年，上师阿扬德夫吉完成了锡克教的圣典《阿迪格兰特》，并将其安装在上师瓦里。1634年，上师哈戈宾离开阿姆利则前往希瓦利克山，在17世纪的剩余时间里，这座城市和上师瓦拉都在敌对锡克上师的势力手中。十八世纪期间，一方的锡克人和另一方的莫卧儿或阿富汗军队经常在室利哈曼迪尔萨希布（Sri Harmandir Sahib）交战，而古矮人偶尔也会受到损害。十九世纪初，Maharaja Ranjit Singh将旁遮普地区从外部进攻中解放出来，用黄金覆盖了盖尔塔拉的上层建筑，使它具有独特的外观和“金殿”的英文名字。[段：1 ]今天的金殿由马哈拉贾-贾萨-辛格-阿鲁瓦利亚（1718-1783-）在1764重建。其他米苏尔锡克酋长的帮助。斯里达巴萨希布所有穹顶的镀金都是由马哈拉贾·贾萨·辛格·阿卢瓦利亚的后代完成的。1802-1830年间，兰吉特·辛格在古矮人身上加入了镀金和大理石，而内部则用壁画和宝石装饰。

TEXT.English: [TAB]With the number of European civil servants rapidly growing since their arrival in Brussels in 1958, the European Commission required more and more office space across the city. By 1965, the Commission alone had 3,200 staff scattered across 8 different cramped buildings. The situation, which started as soon as they arrived due to the lack of large office blocks, became critical and the Commission tried to concentrate its staff in a number of rented buildings around Schuman roundabout. The Belgian government, becoming aware of the problem and keen to ensure that the Commission stayed, offered to build a prestigious administration complex large enough to house the entire staff. President Walter Hallstein was interested but cautious about making long-term commitments while the issue of where the institutions were based was still being discussed. However, the need for office space was overwhelming.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Belgian government's proposal required sufficient land which would preferably be in the Leopold Quarter (where they were already based) and near the homes of the civil servants to the south and east. The land chosen was then occupied by the Dames de Berlaymont, a 300-year-old convent which managed a venerable girls' school. The convent and school moved to a larger and quieter site out of the city centre in Waterloo. Once the Belgian state finished their new school and built infrastructure to it, the Dames de Berlaymont handed the site, which they had been under pressure to sell to developers for years, to the Belgian government in November 1963.[PARAGRAPH:2]To organise what was needed, the Belgian Foreign Minister Pierre Wigny suggested a "Commission consultative Berlaymont", where the Commission, the Belgian Public Works Ministry, the contractors and the architects could draw up the plans. However, the Belgian state desired a building not just tailored to the Commission, but something that could be used by its own civil servants were the Commission to leave. This was also why they favoured a central office building rather than the project for the construction of a "European city" on the Etterbeek. Due to the plans not meeting their exact desires, the Commission gained a lower rent.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]自1958年欧盟公务员抵达布鲁塞尔以来，随着他们人数的迅速增长，欧盟委员会要求在全市范围内拥有越来越多的办公场所。到1965年，仅委员会就有3200名工作人员分散在8个不同的狭窄建筑中。由于没有大型办公大楼，他们一到这里就开始出现这种情况，情况变得非常危急，委员会试图将工作人员集中在舒曼环岛周围的一些出租大楼。比利时政府意识到这一问题，并热切希望委员会能够留下来，提出要建立一个有声望的行政大楼，其规模足以容纳全体工作人员。沃尔特·霍尔斯坦总统对做出长期承诺很感兴趣，但也很谨慎，而有关这些机构所在地的问题仍在讨论之中。然而，对办公空间的需求是巨大的。[段落：2 ]比利时政府的提议需要足够的土地，最好是在利奥波德地区（他们已经在那里）和靠近南方和东部的公务员家庭。选定的土地随后被贝莱蒙夫人（Dames de Berlaymont）占领，这是一座有300年历史的修道院，管理着一所受人尊敬的女子学校。修道院和学校搬到了滑铁卢市中心一个更大更安静的地方。一旦比利时政府完成了他们的新学校，并为其建造基础设施，贝雷蒙特就把这个网站，他们曾在压力下卖给开发商多年，在1963年11月比利时政府。[第2段]组织了所需要的东西，比利时外交部长皮埃尔·维尼建议成立一个“柏林蒙特咨询委员会”，由该委员会、比利时公共工程部、承包商和建筑师起草计划。然而，比利时政府希望不仅为委员会量身定制一栋大楼，而且委员会可以离开，这是它自己的公务员可以使用的东西。这也是为什么他们倾向于在埃特贝克修建一座中央办公楼，而不是建设一座“欧洲城市”的项目。由于计划达不到他们的要求，委员会获得了较低的租金。

TEXT.English: [TAB]All Saints' Church is a Lutheran church in the town of Wittenberg in Germany. It is best known as the location where Martin Luther started the Reformation, by nailing his Ninety-Five Theses to the doors of the church. The Ninety-Five Theses were an attack on the sale of indulgences by the Catholic Church. "Indulgences" were purchased by those Catholics who, having already obtained forgiveness for their sins, wished to reduce the time they would spend in punishment in the afterlife for their sins, before eventually going to heaven. In practice, these were sold to fund the expenses of the Catholic Church on salaries and construction projects. It was Luther's contention that this turned penitence into a commercial transaction.[PARAGRAPH:1]Past heresies in Christianity were quickly quashed by the Church, which excommunicated and even declared crusades against dissenters. However, the development of the printing press ensured the rapid spread of Luther's message throughout Europe. Luther's refusal to recant his condemnations of Rome is seen as the beginning of the process of the Protestant Reformation.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]万圣教堂是德国维滕贝格镇的路德教会。最著名的地方是马丁路德开始宗教改革的地方，他把95篇论文钉在教堂的门上。这九十五条是对天主教会出售放纵的攻击。”“放纵”是那些天主教徒购买的，他们已经获得了对自己的罪的宽恕，希望减少他们在来世为自己的罪接受惩罚的时间，然后最终上天堂。实际上，这些钱是用来支付天主教会的工资和建筑工程费用的。卢瑟的论点是，这使悔罪变成了商业交易。[段落：1 ]基督教过去的邪教很快被教会推翻，教会逐出教会，甚至宣布反对异议者的十字军东征。然而，印刷机的发展确保了路德的信息在欧洲的迅速传播。路德拒绝放弃对罗马的谴责被视为新教改革进程的开始。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Pistols were the first gunpowder weapons developed for cavalry, and the pistoliers was one of the new cavalry types to develop which signaled the end of the lance-charging heavy cavalry. Pistoliers were expected to be able to engage their opponents both with firearms and sword; they formed up in deep blocks and used their firearms in a caracole attack to disrupt enemy infantry formations before charging home and engaging in hand-to-hand combat. German mercenary cavalry called Reiters or "Black Riders" were some of the most prominent pistoliers.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]手枪是最早为骑兵研制的火药武器，手枪兵是新发展的骑兵类型之一，标志着长矛冲锋重骑兵的终结。手枪手被期望能够用枪械和剑与对手交战；他们在很深的街区内集结，用枪械进行一次卡拉科尔攻击，扰乱敌人的步兵编队，然后冲向家乡，进行肉搏战。德国雇佣兵骑兵雷特或“黑骑士”是一些最著名的手枪手。

TEXT.English: [TAB]In Shinto, shrines are places of worship that house one or more kami, a concept that can be translated as "spirit" or "essence". Many Shinto shrines have a torii, a traditional gate that marks the transition between the mundane and the sacred. Estimates put the number of Shinto shrines in Japan around 100,000. With its "floating" torii, Itsukushima Shrine is perhaps the most well-known.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]在神道教中，神社是供奉一个或多个神的地方，这个概念可以翻译为“灵”或“精”。许多神道神社都有一个传统的都灵门，标志着世俗和神圣之间的过渡。据估计，日本的神社数量约为10万座。由于其“漂浮”的都灵，它的三岛神社可能是最著名的。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Buddhas of Bamyan were two 6th century monumental statues of standing buddhas carved into the side of a cliff in the Bamyan valley in the Hazarajat region of central Afghanistan, situated 230 km (143 miles) northwest of Kabul at an altitude of 2500 meters (8,202 ft). Built in 507, the larger in 554, the statues represented the classic blended style of Gandhara art.[PARAGRAPH:2]The main bodies were hewn directly from the sandstone cliffs, but details were modeled in mud mixed with straw, coated with stucco. This coating, practically all of which was worn away long ago, was painted to enhance the expressions of the faces, hands and folds of the robes; the larger one was painted carmine red and the smaller one was painted multiple colors.[PARAGRAPH:2]The lower parts of the statues' arms were constructed from the same mud-straw mix while supported on wooden armatures. It is believed that the upper parts of their faces were made from great wooden masks or casts. The rows of holes that can be seen in photographs were spaces that held wooden pegs which served to stabilize the outer stucco.[PARAGRAPH:2]They were intentionally dynamited and destroyed in 2001 by the Taliban, on orders from leader Mullah Mohammed Omar, after the Taliban government declared that they were "idols" (which are forbidden under Sharia law). International opinion strongly condemned the destruction of the Buddhas, which was viewed as an example of the intolerance of the Taliban and of Islamism. Japan and Switzerland, among others, have pledged support for the rebuilding of the statues.
TEXT.Chinese: 巴米扬的佛像是两尊6世纪的立佛纪念雕像，刻在阿富汗中部哈扎拉贾特地区巴米扬山谷的悬崖边上，位于喀布尔西北230公里（143英里），海拔2500米（8202英尺）。建于507，554大，雕像代表经典混合风格的甘达拉艺术。[段落：2 ]主体直接从砂岩悬崖劈开，但细节是仿照泥浆混合稻草，涂上灰泥。这层衣服，几乎都是很久以前磨损掉的，涂上油漆是为了增强长袍的脸、手和褶皱的表情；较大的一个被漆成胭脂红，较小的一个被漆成多种颜色。[段落：2 ]雕像的手臂的下部是由同一个泥秆混合而成的，同时支撑在木制的电枢上。据信，他们的脸上部是由巨大的木制面具或铸模制成的。照片中可以看到的一排空洞是用来固定外部灰泥的木桩。（第2段），根据塔利班领导人Mullah Mohammed Omar的命令，他们在2001年被故意炸毁。在塔利班政府宣布他们是“偶像”（伊斯兰教法禁止）。国际舆论强烈谴责摧毁佛像，认为这是塔利班和伊斯兰主义不容忍的一个例子。日本和瑞士等国承诺支持这些雕像的重建。

TEXT.English: [H1]Sitting Bull[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]War Chief of the Hunkpapa Sioux[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c.1830 - 1890 AD[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sitting Bull, whose name in Lakota, Tatanka Yotanka, roughly translates to "an Obstinate Bull Buffalo at Rest," was born into the Hunkpapa Sioux branch of the Lakota tribe around 1830 AD. Rising to the position of Chief in 1856, Sitting Bull was a key member of the native resistance against American encroachment into the Black Hills of the Dakota Territory.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sitting Bull was a precocious youth, taking to warfare and hunting like a fish to water. At ten, he slew his first buffalo. By the time he had reached middle adolescence, Sitting Bull had been inducted into the prestigious societies of the Strong Heart Warrior and the Silent Eater. A most dangerous and powerful warrior - despite walking with a limp from a bullet wound he suffered as a youth - Sitting Bull became a feared name among the Lakota, the young Chief leading his fellow Hunkpapa into numerous victories over other tribes.[PARAGRAPH:1]His expertise in warfare did not keep Sitting Bull from signing the Fort Laramie Treaty of 1868, which called for the halting of American expansion into Sioux territory beyond the Powder River. But with the discovery of gold in the Black Hills in 1874, a new rush of colonists from the East began violating the treaty. Sitting Bull is said to have had a prophetic dream regarding the American expansion - an American military officer and his men, plummeting from the sky into a Sioux village - which was interpreted as a portent of the Americans' imminent doom. Not long after Sitting Bull's vision, General George Custer and his seventh cavalry launched an attack on a native village, only to be decimated by the assembled Sioux and Cheyenne fighters.[PARAGRAPH:1]American wrath quickly fell upon Sitting Bull and his people, and they were forced to flee to Canada where, despite a reception worthy of a foreign dignitary, they were to remain but briefly. A dearth of resources in their new lands threatened the Lakota with starvation, forcing Sitting Bull to guide his people back to the United States in 1881, with the understanding that they would receive land, sustenance and peace in America.[PARAGRAPH:1]Upon his return to the United States, Sitting Bull and a number of his followers joined Buffalo Bill Cody's Wild West show. Cody was able to provide a better standard of living than Sitting Bull and his Sioux brethren could expect to receive on the reservations to which they were now assigned, and a strong friendship formed between Cody and the native leader.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the final decade of the nineteenth century, the "Ghost Dance," a ritual promising to rid the natives of American influence once and for all, began to spread among the Sioux. Tensions again grew between the Lakota and the American military, who had expressly forbade native religious rituals like the "Ghost Dance." Buffalo Bill stepped in to try and negotiate a peaceful truce, but none was to be had. Fearing Sitting Bull's involvement in the growing ritual, the Chief was arrested and assassinated by Indian policemen in 1890, just days before the American opposition to the "Ghost Dance" would bring about the infamous Massacre at Wounded Knee.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]坐牛[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]苏族洪克帕帕部落酋长[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生卒年份:[\BOLD]约1830-1890[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]坐牛的名字在拉科塔语中念作塔坦卡·约塔克，大致的意思是“一头顽固的雄性水牛在休息”。他在公元1830年左右出生在拉科塔部落的洪克帕帕族中（苏族分支）。坐牛在1856成为了酋长，而且是土著抵抗运动的关键人物，土著们在他的领导下抵抗美国对达科他地区的黑山领地的侵犯。[PARAGRAPH:1]坐牛是个很早熟的年轻人，他在战斗和打猎中简直是如鱼得水。年仅十岁的时候，他就猎杀了第一只水牛。而且在他还只是个少年的时候，坐牛就进入了很有威望的社会阶层，强壮之心战士和静食者。作为一个最危险而强大的战士——尽管由于年轻的时候受过枪伤，使得走路的时候有些步履蹒跚——坐牛成为了拉科塔人中令人敬畏的名字。年轻的酋长率领着他的洪克帕帕族追随者们在与其他部落的战斗中获得了众多的胜利。[PARAGRAPH:1]但是坐牛在战争上的经验没能阻止他在1868年的拉勒米堡条约上签字。该条约要求美国停止向粉河另一边的苏族领地扩张。不过随着1874年在黑山发现了黄金，新一轮来自东部的殖民狂潮来临，条约成了一纸空文。据说坐牛曾经做过一个预言关于美国扩张的梦——一个美国军队指挥官和他的士兵们从天而降，掉入一个苏族村庄——这被认为预示着美国人即将面对毁灭的命运。在这个梦之后不久，乔治·库斯特将军和他的第七骑兵团对一个土著村庄发动了进攻，但是他们却被联合起来的苏族和夏安族战士们歼灭。[PARAGRAPH:1]美国的愤怒很快降临到了坐牛和他的人民头上，他们被迫逃到加拿大境内。尽管被当作外来权贵一样接待，他们也只是暂时得以苟延残喘而已。在他们的新领地上，资源的匮乏使这些拉科塔人面临着饿死的威胁。这迫使坐牛带领他的人民在1881年又回到了美国境内。他们希望能够在美国得到土地、食物以及和平。[PARAGRAPH:1]在他回到美国后，坐牛和他的一些追随者加入了“水牛”比尔·科迪的狂野西部演出。比起坐牛和他的苏族同胞们留在他们分到的保留地上所能获得的，科迪给他们生活条件要好得多了。于是科迪和这个土著领袖之间建立了深厚的友谊。[PARAGRAPH:1]在19世纪的最后十年，“鬼舞”，一种旨在彻底消除美国对土著人影响的宗教仪式在苏族人当中流传开来。而美国军队则明令禁止类似“鬼舞”这样的土著宗教仪式。这使得拉科塔人与美国军队之间的局势再次变得紧张起来。水牛比尔介入并努力促使双方达成和平协议，但是最后还是徒劳无功。由于担心坐牛与这个逐渐壮大宗教仪式有牵连，美国政府在1890年派印第安警察逮捕并暗杀了这个可怜的酋长。就在事后数日，由于美国政府对“鬼舞”仪式的反对，导致了臭名昭著的伤膝河谷大屠杀。（塞爱维小提示：伤膝河谷大屠杀是印第安人与美国政府的最后一次大规模武装冲突。1890年12月29日，300多名北美土著人——其中有200多名是手无寸铁的妇孺，在逃亡途中于南达科他州松树岭的伤膝河谷时遭遇美国军队，在实力悬殊的状况下，战斗变成了单方面的屠杀。）

TEXT.English: [TAB]Rockets are projectiles that are propelled by the expulsion of gases generated in a combustion chamber. The first solid-fuel rockets, invented by the Chinese in the 13th century, used a mixture similar to gunpowder for fuel.
