TEXT.Chinese: [H1]杂项：文明的曙光[\H1] - 瘟疫再也无法杀死单位 - 除宗主国城市的核心用地外，附庸国有能力控制其所属城市核心用地（城市周围八格） - 当AI控制的文明存在于不符合其历史的时间时将会变得更不稳定 - 征服美洲事件将会自动触发开战 - 在发现天文学之前无法使遥远的文明附庸 - 在发现天文学之前无法在拥有首都以外的大陆上建造移民 - AI控制的蒙古会得到攻打俄罗斯和中东地区的额外兵力 - 原始神庙只能建造于没有宗教信仰的城市（这条不适用于特色建筑代替原始神庙的文明） - 若城市建有原始神庙，则当宗教传入时，原始神庙自动变更为该宗教的寺庙 - 免费科技项目，比如神谕和首发自由主义，只能选择属于当前或更早时代的科技 - 塞尔柱文明将会在11世纪攻击中东地区 - 佛教在建成一座印度教神庙后自动创立 - 建造宫殿的花费将随着时代而变化 - 在资源上建立城市将获得最大化的产能和贸易输出，就如在此建造一个建筑物一般 - 传教士的传教成功率取决于此文明想要皈依的宗教，就类似于真实的传教情况 - 内政古文中有一项更为详尽的稳定度列表，列出了改变稳定度的各种详细的因素 - 独立城邦不会触发环球任务和征服者任务 - 通过修GlobalDefinesAlt.xml文件可以禁止或者随意修改泰米尔、吐蕃、摩尔、波兰和刚果文明的诞 - 大艺术家入驻城市 +1 [ICON_HAPPY] - 玩家再也不能与刚诞生的文明开战了 - 开局时，部落村庄在地图上随机放置

TEXT.English: [TAB]Two developments in the 19th century made early firearms (such as the musket) obsolete. The first was the invention of a spiral groove, or "rifling," inside the barrel of a gun. Second was the development of the repeating rifle, which could fire multiple shots before it required reloading. The rifle was a better weapon than its ancestors, with much more accuracy over a greater range than the musket and a much higher rate of fire.[PARAGRAPH:1]Riflemen were first employed in large numbers during the American Civil War. The rifle gave a strong defensive advantage, since riflemen could fire several times while the attackers advanced to within hand-to-hand distance. This was normally enough to hold any position. Riflemen dominated the battlefield until the appearance of armored attack vehicles.
TEXT.Chinese: 19世纪的两项军事技术导致了早期火器（例如火枪）的淘汰。第一是枪膛内的螺旋形膛线（“来复线”）的发明，第二就是能重复装弹的来复枪，这种枪装填一次可以多次进行射击。来复枪比他的前辈性能更优越，其远距离的射击精度和射击速度都大大优于旧式火枪。[PARAGRAPH:2]来复枪兵第一次大量投入战场是在美国南北战争期间。来复枪兵在防御上表现出了明显的优势，因为当进攻者前进到能进行肉搏战的距离时，来复枪兵已经能开火好几次了。这足以使他们守住任何阵地。来复枪兵在战场上的主宰地位一直持续到装甲战车的出现才告结束。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Silver is a chemical element in the periodic table that has the symbol "Ag" and the atomic number 47. A soft, white, lustrous transition metal, silver has the highest electrical and thermal conductivity of any metal and is found in mineral deposits and in free form.[PARAGRAPH:1]Slag heaps found in Asia Minor indicate that silver has been known about for a long time, and that it was being separated from lead as early as the fourth millennium BC.
TEXT.Chinese: 白银在元素周期表里的符号是“Ag”，序号47，是一种柔软，白色，有光泽的过渡金属。银是所有金属元素中导电性和导热性最好的。矿床里蕴藏的银多以单质的形态存在。[PARAGRAPH:1]小亚细亚发现的矿渣场表明人们很早以前就已发现白银，并且早在公元前4000年人们就已能够从铅银共生矿中分离白银。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Mole Antonelliana is a major landmark of the Italian city Turin. It is named for the architect who built it, Alessandro Antonelli. Construction began in 1863.[PARAGRAPH:2]Originally, it was intended to be a Jewish synagogue, as religious freedom had just been granted to non-Catholic groups, but the relationship between Antonelli and the Jewish community was not a happy one. He immediately began to propose a series of modifications which raised the final height to 113 meters-over 47 meters higher than the dome in the original design. Such changes, in addition to greater costs and construction time than were originally anticipated, did not please the Jewish community and construction was halted in 1869 with a provisional roof. In 1873 an exchange with the city of Turin for other land for a synagogue took place, and the Mole was dedicated to Victor Emanuel II. Antonelli again began construction, which took the height to 146, 153, and finally 167 meters (548 feet).[PARAGRAPH:2]Since 2000, the building houses Museo Nazionale del Cinema, the National Museum of Film. The Mole appears on the reverse of the two cent Italian euro coins and was the official emblem of the 2006 Winter Olympics. It is also the official emblem of the 2005 World Bocce Championships and the 2006 World Fencing Championships.[PARAGRAPH:2]On one side of the four-faced dome, the first Fibonacci numbers are written with red neon lights: they are part of the artistic work Il volo dei Numeri ("Flight of the numbers") by Mario Merz.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]安东尼利安娜鼹鼠是意大利城市都灵的一个重要地标。它是以建造它的建筑师亚历山德罗安东内利命名的。1863开始建造。〔第2段〕原本是犹太犹太教会堂，因为宗教自由刚刚被授予非天主教团体，但安东内利与犹太社区之间的关系并不幸福。他立即开始提出一系列的修改方案，将最终高度提高到113米，比原来设计的穹顶高出47米。这些变化，除了比原先预计的更大的成本和建设时间外，并没有取悦犹太人社区，1869年，临时屋顶的建设被停止。1873年，与都灵市交换了另一块土地作为犹太教堂，鼹鼠被献给了维克多·伊曼纽尔二世。安东内利再次开始建造，它的高度达到146, 153，最后167米（548英尺）。（段：2）自2000以来，建筑博物馆Noimayel德尔电影院，电影国家博物馆。鼹鼠出现在两美分的意大利欧元硬币的背面，是2006年冬季奥运会的官方标志。它也是2005届世界杯锦标赛和2006届世界击剑锦标赛的官方会徽。[第2段]在四面圆顶的一侧，第一个斐波那契数字是用红色霓虹灯写的：它们是Mario Merz的艺术作品IL Vulo DEI Muffi（“数字飞行”）的一部分。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Masjid al-Haram is an Islamic mosque in the center of the holy city of Mecca, which is located in western Saudi Arabia. The mosque contains the Kaaba, an ancient cube-shaped building which is said to have been built by the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his son, Ishmael, at the orders of Allah, and which is believed to be the holiest place on Earth. The Kaaba in turn houses the "Black Stone," which it is said has fallen from heaven and has the power to cleanse worshippers of their sins.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Kaaba has always been revered as a holy place. Before the rise of Islam, the Kaaba was filled with idols, and Arabs from miles around came to worship there. Upon his return from exile, the Prophet Muhammad smashed the idols and rededicated the mosque to Allah and Islam. It has remained an Islamic holy place ever since and non-Muslims are forbidden to enter Mecca.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Masjid al-Haram is the focal point of the "hajj," a religious pilgrimage to Mecca required of all able-bodied Muslims (at least according to the Sunni sect). Every year during the holy month of Dhu'l-Hijjah, upwards of three million people visit the holy city and the most holy mosque within, thus fulfilling one of the "five pillars of Islam." The mosque has been enlarged and modernized to handle the extraordinary influx of faithful, but both the city and the mosque can barely handle the traffic.[PARAGRAPH:1]The mosque is in the form of a huge sprawling building surrounding a mighty courtyard with the Kaaba in the center. The building is extraordinarily beautiful and constructed of marble and porcelain and gold and bedecked with graceful minarets (towers). The interior is a wonder of columned halls filled with tapestries and other marvelous decorations. The courtyard itself is paved with marble. Truly a magnificent place of worship, Masjid al-Haram is said by some to surpass the Taj Mahal in glory and wonder.
TEXT.Chinese: 克尔白天房位于沙特阿拉伯西部的伊斯兰教圣城麦加市中心的阿尔-哈拉姆大清真寺（“禁寺”）内，是一座古老的方形建筑，传说为先知亚伯拉罕（易卜拉颀）及其子以实玛利依照安拉的命令所建造，是世界上最神圣的场所。天房中安放有一块“黑石”，据说来自天界，能使信徒消除自身的罪孽。[PARAGRAPH:2]自古以来克尔白天房就是一处圣地。在伊斯兰教兴起之前，天房中供奉着许多偶像，各处的阿拉伯人都前往该地祭拜。在先知穆罕默德经历流放生涯返回麦加之后，其中的偶像全被捣毁，成为专门敬奉安拉的伊斯兰清真寺。在此后，麦加一直是伊斯兰教的圣地，完全禁止非穆斯林进入。[PARAGRAPH:2]任何有能力的穆斯林在一生中都必须前往禁寺进行一次朝圣之旅（至少对于逊尼派来说）。在每年的朝圣月期间，总有超过三百万人前往圣城的禁寺，以完成“伊斯兰五功”之一（念、礼、斋、课、朝）。为此近年来禁寺不断进行扩建和现代代改造，但圣城和禁寺仍然是不堪重负。[PARAGRAPH:2]整座禁寺围绕着克尔白天房所在的大广场而建造。建筑风格极其精美，外部以大理石、陶瓷、黄金装饰，并点缀以数座尖塔。禁寺内大厅则密布挂毯等饰物。广场也完全以大理石铺成，是世上最豪华的宗教场所之一。许多人认为这座禁寺比泰姬玛哈陵还要更为宏伟壮观。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Located near Patna, in Bihar state, India, the Mahabodhi is a Buddhist temple in Bodh Gaya, the place where, according to Buddhist tradition, Siddhartha Gautama gained enlightenment and became the Buddha while meditating under a Bodhi (Peepal) tree.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Emperor Asoka constructed the "Golden Throne" sometime around 250 BC, and over time many other buildings and statues were added. In the 12th century the area was overrun by Muslims, and the temple sacked and largely destroyed. In the 16th century a Hindu monastery was established, and the monastery's abbot was given control over the temple grounds.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually the area came under British control. In the 1880s they began a major restoration of the temple, much against the wishes of the Hindu abbot. In the 1940s control over the site was given to the state, which manages the site with the advice of a committee containing Buddhists from the world over.[PARAGRAPH:1]A building of remarkable beauty and grandeur, the Mahabodhi is one of the oldest surviving brick buildings in India. Standing on the ruins of an even older "stupa," the temple consists of a high central tower surrounded by four smaller towers. The central tower rises some 60 feet in height. The edifice is covered by ornate and colorful molding, pilasters (pseudo columns), and arches, many of which contain bas relief sculptures. Inside sits a very large gilded statue of the Buddha. The statue sits where, legend has it, the Buddha was sitting when he achieved enlightenment.[PARAGRAPH:1]Near to the building stands a mighty Bodhi tree, a descendant of the one under which Buddha found enlightenment. The temple stands within an extensive complex of smaller temples, statues, and pathways running through beautiful parklands and alongside peaceful lakes. The temple and its surroundings remain a focus of Buddhist worship, and people from across the world come every year to honor the Buddha and to marvel at the beauty of the Mahabodhi.
TEXT.Chinese: 大菩提寺坐落于印度比哈尔邦的巴特那附近，是一座佛教寺庙。根据佛教的传说，佛教创始人乔达摩・悉达多就是在那里的一棵菩提树下进行冥想时突然大彻大悟，从而成佛。[PARAGRAPH:2]阿育王于公元前250年左右建造了“黄金王座”，随后的时间里，陆续建造了许多其他建筑和雕像。12世纪穆斯林蹂躏了这里，寺庙遭到洗劫，大部分被毁。16世纪这里成了一座印度教的神庙，这一带也被印度教徒所控制。[PARAGRAPH:2]后来该地区又落入英国人之手。19世纪80年代，这座寺庙进行了大规模的修复，虽然这遭到了许多印度教僧侣们抵制。20世纪40年代，这一地区的控制权被移交给了政府。并根据来自全世界佛教徒组成的委员会的意见管理着这座寺庙。[PARAGRAPH:2]大菩提寺非常美丽庄严，是印度现存最古老的砖砌建筑。建立于一座更古老的佛塔的废墟之上，这座寺庙拥有一座中央高塔，四面还有四座小塔。中央塔大约有60英尺高。整座建筑遍布绚丽多彩的壁柱和拱顶。上面还有大量的浮雕。内部有很大的镀金佛像。这是一尊坐像，据说佛祖在得道之后就是坐化的。[PARAGRAPH:2]在建筑附近有一棵很大的菩提树，据说是佛祖得道那棵树的后代。寺庙附近有大量的小寺庙，雕像和道路，穿过那些如茵的绿地，旁边是宁静的湖泊。寺庙和其附近的建筑仍然是佛教徒们膜拜的圣地，每年有无数人从世界各地来到这里膜拜佛祖，并欣赏着大菩提寺的美丽风光。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Atomium was built as the main pavilion and icon of the 1958 World's Fair of Brussels (Expo 58). In the 1950s, faith in scientific progress was great, and a structure depicting atoms was chosen to embody this. The Atomium depicts nine iron atoms in the shape of the body-centred cubic unit cell of an iron crystal, magnified 165 billion times.[PARAGRAPH:2]The construction of the Atomium was a technical feat. Of the nine spheres, six are accessible to the public, each with two main floors and a lower floor reserved for service. The central tube contains the fastest elevator of the time at 5 m/s (20 ft/s), installed by the Belgian branch of the Swiss firm Schlieren (subsequently taken over by Schindler). It allows 22 people to reach the summit in 23 seconds. The escalators installed in the oblique tubes are among the longest in Europe. The biggest is 35 m (100 ft) long.[PARAGRAPH:2]Three of the four top spheres lack vertical support and hence are not open to the public for safety reasons, although the sphere at the pinnacle is open to the public. The original design called for no supports; the structure was simply to rest on the spheres. Wind tunnel tests proved that the structure would have toppled in an 80 km/h (50 mph) wind (140 km/h (90 mph) winds have been recorded in Belgium). Support columns were added to achieve enough resistance against overturning.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Atomium, designed to last six months, was not destined to survive the 1958 World's Fair, but its popularity and success made it a major element of the Brussels landscape. Its destruction was therefore postponed year after year, until the city's authorities decided to keep it. However, for thirty years, little maintenance work was done.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]原子岛是1958年布鲁塞尔世博会（Expo 58）的主展馆和标志性建筑。在20世纪50年代，人们对科学进步的信心很大，人们选择了一种描绘原子的结构来体现这一点。原子描绘了铁晶体体心立方立方晶胞形状的九个铁原子，放大了1650亿倍。[段落：2 ] Atomium的构造是一项技术壮举。在这9个球体中，有6个面向公众，每个球体都有两个主楼层和一个较低的楼层供公众使用。中央管道包含当时最快的电梯，速度为5米/秒（20英尺/秒），由瑞士施利勒公司（Schlieren）比利时分公司安装（随后由迅达公司接管）。它允许22人在23秒内到达山顶。安装在斜管中的自动扶梯是欧洲最长的。最大的是35米（100英尺）长。[段落：2 ]四个顶部球体中的三个缺乏垂直支撑，因此出于安全原因不开放给公众，尽管顶峰的球体对公众开放。最初的设计不需要任何支撑；结构只是简单地放在球体上。风洞试验证明，该结构将在80公里/小时（50英里/小时）的风（140公里/小时（90英里/小时）在比利时的记录）。增加了支撑柱以获得足够的抵抗倾覆的能力。[段落：2 ]六个月设计的原子并不是注定要在1958世界博览会上幸存下来，但它的普及和成功使它成为布鲁塞尔景观的一个主要元素。因此，它的销毁工作被年复一年地推迟，直到市政府决定保留它。然而，30年来，几乎没有做什么维护工作。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Notre Dame is a mighty cathedral standing on the "Ile de la Citie," an island in the Seine River in Paris, France. Built on the site of an older church, which was in turn built on the site of a Roman temple to Jupiter, Notre Dame is a magnificent example of gothic architecture and one of the greatest buildings standing. Construction of Notre Dame began in 1163 and took almost two centuries to complete.[PARAGRAPH:1]Notre Dame is a massive stone building of square towers, flying buttresses, and tall spires. The exterior of the building is decorated with delicate ribbons of arches and statues of saints and kings. The roofline of the building is festooned with gargoyles. The interior of the cathedral is a long, narrow space with columns lining each side, supporting two beautiful raised galleries. Brilliant stained glass windows shine gently down on the main altar, which contains a beautiful statue of the Virgin Mary, the cathedral's patron, holding the body of Jesus.[PARAGRAPH:1]The cathedral has suffered many periods of neglect over the years. During the French Revolution, many of Notre Dame's treasures were stolen and the building was used as a warehouse. In the early 1800s, the cathedral was in such a state of disrepair that the city planners contemplated tearing it down. In fact, Victor Hugo wrote "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" in part to raise awareness of the cathedral's plight. In 1871, during the short-lived Paris Commune, Notre Dame was almost set on fire.[PARAGRAPH:1]Fortunately the cathedral survived it all, and has now been largely restored to its original grandeur.
TEXT.Chinese: 圣母院是座落于法国巴黎塞纳河上的“城市岛”上的一座宏伟的大教堂。它的原址是一座由罗马的朱庇特神庙改建的古老教堂。巴黎圣母院是一座典型的哥特式建筑，也是世界上仍存在的最伟大的建筑之一。圣母院的建造从1163年开始，前后将近用了200年才完成。[PARAGRAPH:2]圣母院是一座石质建筑，由许多的方塔，飞拱和高耸的尖顶组成。其外表装饰有许多拱形带和圣徒们与国王们的雕像，屋顶的轮廓饰有怪兽状的滴水口。大教堂的内部是一个又长又窄的空间，四周的圆柱支撑着两幅漂亮的浮雕。彩色玻璃窗轻轻地照耀在主祭坛上，在这个祭坛上有一座圣母玛丽的雕像，她的怀中则抱着耶稣――这座大教堂由此得名。[PARAGRAPH:2]这座大教堂在历史上遭遇过多次劫难。在法国大革命时代，圣母院中的许多财产被窃，并被征用为仓库。在19世纪初，这座大教堂的荒废景象使得城市的规划者考虑将它拆除。事实上，维克多・雨果撰写《巴黎圣母院》的部分目的就是希望唤起人们对圣母院的困境的关注。在1871年，在短命的巴黎公社执政期间，圣母院几乎被焚毁。[PARAGRAPH:2]幸运的是，圣母院从这一系列的遭难中幸存下来，现在已经基本上恢复了原有的宏伟。

TEXT.English: [TAB]An electrical grid is an interconnected network for delivering electricity from suppliers to consumers. It consists of generating stations that produce electrical power, high voltage transmission lines that carry power from distant sources to demand centers, and distribution lines that connect individual customers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Power stations may be located near a fuel source, at a dam site, or to take advantage of renewable energy sources, and are often located away from heavily populated areas. They are usually quite large to take advantage of the economies of scale. The electric power which is generated is stepped up to a higher voltage at which it connects to the electric power transmission network.[PARAGRAPH:2]The bulk power transmission network will move the power long distances, sometimes across international boundaries, until it reaches its wholesale customer (usually the company that owns the local electric power distribution network).[PARAGRAPH:2]On arrival at a substation, the power will be stepped down from a transmission level voltage to a distribution level voltage. As it exits the substation, it enters the distribution wiring. Finally, upon arrival at the service location, the power is stepped down again from the distribution voltage to the required service voltage(s).[PARAGRAPH:2]Electrical grids vary in size from covering a single building through national grids which cover whole countries, to transnational grids which can cross continents.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]电网是一个互联网络，用于从供应商向消费者输送电力。它由产生电力的发电站、从远方电源向需求中心输送电力的高压输电线路和连接个别客户的配电线路组成。〔2〕发电站可位于燃料源附近、坝址处，或利用可再生能源，而且经常远离人口稠密的地区。它们通常相当大，以利用规模经济。所产生的电力被提升到与电力传输网络连接的更高的电压。[段：2 ]大功率输电网络将移动电力远距离，有时跨越国际边界，直到它的批发客户（通常是拥有本地配电网的公司）。〔段落：2〕到达变电站后，电力将从传输电平电压下降到配电级电压。当它离开变电站时，它进入配电线路。最后，当到达服务位置时，电力再次从配电电压降到所需的服务电压。〔2〕电网的大小因覆盖整个国家的全国电网、跨大陆的跨国电网而不同。

TEXT.English: [TAB]La Mezquita (Spanish for "The Mosque") of Córdoba or Cordova is a Roman Catholic cathedral originally built as a mosque in the Andalusian city of Córdoba, Spain. It is regarded as perhaps the most accomplished monument of the Umayyad dynasty of Córdoba. After the Spanish Reconquista, it was turned into a church, with a Gothic cathedral inserted into the center of the large Moorish building. Today the entire building is used to house the Cathedral of the diocese of Córdoba in Spain.[PARAGRAPH:1]The building was begun in approximately 600 A.D. as the Christian Visigothic church of St. Vincent. The first Muslim Emir Abd ar-Rahman I bought the church and reworked it over two centuries to refashion it as a mosque, starting in 784 A.D. Additionally, Abd ar-Rahman I used the mosque (originally called Aljama Mosque) as an adjunct to his palace and named it to honor his wife. According to some authors the church of St. Vincent was demolished after it was bought from the local Christian community.[PARAGRAPH:1]Several explanations have been proposed to explain the mosque's unorthodox orientation. Some have suggested the mihrab faces south because the foundations of the mosque were taken from the old Roman and Visigoth constructions. Others contend that Abd ar-Rahman oriented the mihrab southward as if he were still in the Ummayyad capital of Damascus and not in exile.[PARAGRAPH:1]The mosque underwent numerous subsequent changes: Abd ar-Rahman III ordered a new minaret; Al-Hakam II, in 961, enlarged the building and enriched the mihrab. The last of the reforms was carried out by Al-Mansur Ibn Abi Aamir in 987.[PARAGRAPH:1]It was the most magnificent of the more than 1,000 mosques in the city and was at one time the second largest mosque in the Muslim world. It was connected to the Caliph's palace by a raised walk-way, mosques within the palaces being the tradition for the Islamic rulers of all times.[PARAGRAPH:1]The city in which it was built was subject to frequent invasion and each conquering wave added their own mark to the architecture. The building is most notable for its giant arches, with over 1,000 columns of jasper, onyx, marble, and granite. These were made from pieces of the Roman temple which had occupied the site previously, as well as other destroyed Roman buildings. The double arches, pictured above, were a new introduction to architecture, and helped support the tremendous weight of the higher ceilings. The double arches consist of a lower horseshoe arch and an upper semi-circular arch. The Mezquita also features richly gilded prayer niches. A centrally located honey-combed dome has beautiful blue tiles decorated with stars. The mihrab is a masterpiece of architectural art, with geometric and flowing designs of plants. La Mezquita reached its current dimensions in 987 A.D. with the completion of the outer naves and orange tree courtyard.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1236, Córdoba was recaptured from the Muslim army by King Ferdinand III of Castile and the mosque was reconsecrated as a Christian church. Alfonso X oversaw the construction of the Villaviciosa Chapel and the Royal Chapel within the mosque. The kings who followed added further Christian features: Enrique II rebuilt the chapel in the 14th century.[PARAGRAPH:1]The most significant alteration was building a Renaissance cathedral nave in the middle of the structure. It was constructed by permission of Charles V, king of united Spain. Its reversion to a Christian church (officially the Cathedral of the Assumption of the Virgin) may have helped to preserve it when the Spanish Inquisition was most active.[PARAGRAPH:1]Artisans and architects continued to add to the existing structure until the late 18th century.
TEXT.Chinese: 【TAB】科尔多瓦（Cordova）的La Mezquita（西班牙语“清真寺”）是一座罗马天主教大教堂，最初在西班牙安达卢西亚城市科尔多瓦（Córdoba）作为清真寺修建。它被认为是科尔多瓦倭玛亚王朝最有成就的纪念碑。西班牙重新征服后，它变成了一座教堂，一座哥特式大教堂插入了摩尔人的大建筑中心。今天，整个建筑被用来安置西班牙C胡多巴教区的大教堂。[段：1 ]该建筑是在公元600年左右开始的，圣文森特基督教基督教席维特教堂。第一个穆斯林埃米尔阿布德·拉赫曼我买下了这座教堂，并在两个多世纪的时间里对其进行了改造，从公元784年开始将其改建为清真寺。此外，阿布德·拉赫曼一世还将这座清真寺（最初称为阿尔贾马清真寺）用作其宫殿的附属建筑，并将其命名为纪念他的妻子。根据一些作者，圣文森特教堂被从当地基督教社区购买后被拆除。[段落：1 ]已经提出了几个解释来解释清真寺的非正统取向。有些人建议米哈拉布朝南，因为清真寺的地基是从古罗马和西哥特建筑中取出来的。其他人争辩说，Abd ar Rahman向南迈克拉布，好像他仍然在大马士革的UMayyad首都，而不是流放。[段落：1 ]清真寺经历了许多后来的变化：阿卜杜勒-拉赫曼三世下令一个新的尖塔；Al Hakam II，在961，扩大了建筑，丰富了米哈拉布。最后一次改革是在987年由曼苏尔·伊本阿米尔进行的。[段落：1 ]它是该市1000多座清真寺中最宏伟的一座，曾一度是穆斯林世界第二大清真寺。它是通过一种高举的步行方式连接到哈里发的宫殿，宫殿内的清真寺是伊斯兰统治者的传统。[段落：1 ]它建造的城市经常遭受入侵，每一次征服的浪潮都给建筑增添了自己的痕迹。这座建筑以其巨大的拱门而闻名，有超过1000根由碧玉、玛瑙、大理石和花岗岩组成的柱子。这些建筑是由先前占领此地的罗马神庙以及其他被摧毁的罗马建筑碎片制成的。上图所示的双拱门是建筑的新入门，有助于支撑更高天花板的巨大重量。双拱由下马蹄形拱和上半圆拱组成。梅兹基塔也有许多镀金的祈祷壁龛。一个中心位置的蜂巢穹顶有美丽的蓝色瓷砖装饰的星星。米哈拉布是一个建筑艺术杰作，几何和流动的植物设计。公元987年，拉梅齐塔到达了目前的规模，完成了外胡和橙树庭院的损坏。1236段，卡多尔巴被穆斯林军队从卡斯提尔国王Ferdinand III手中夺回，清真寺重新被奉为基督教教堂。阿方索十世监督了维拉维西奥萨教堂和清真寺内的皇家教堂的建设。跟随的国王增加了基督教的特征：Enrique II在十四世纪重建了教堂。[段：1 ]最显著的改变是在建筑中间建造一座文艺复兴时期的教堂中殿。它是经西班牙联合国王查理五世许可建造的。它回归基督教教堂（正式称为圣母大教堂）可能有助于保存它当西班牙宗教裁判所最活跃。[段落：1 ]工匠和建筑师继续增加现有结构直到十八世纪下旬。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Elvis Presley, "The King", played a new beat that people called Rock-n-Roll. It quickly became a worldwide sensation. Elvis' home was called "Graceland" and was purchased by Presley in 1957. Presley died in 1977; the 14-acre estate was turned into a museum five years later. Presley, his parents, grandmother, and stillborn twin brother are buried on the grounds.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today Graceland stands as a remarkable testament to a man who achieved almost mythological status in American culture. Therein one can see glimpses of the young Elvis - the brilliant jeans-clad rebel who "sang like a black man," the man who seduced American teens from the clutches of British rockers and frightened parents everywhere.[PARAGRAPH:1]Overlaying these faint images is the picture of what Elvis became: the jaded overweight man, singing in Las Vegas in a white sequined jumpsuit, dodging underwear thrown by middle-aged housewives, shaking hands with Richard Nixon, and finally dying of his excesses.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today, Elvis is still beloved by millions, many of whom refuse to believe that he died. Despite this, they flock to the mansion by the thousands to lay flowers at his gravesite.
TEXT.Chinese: “国王”猫王普雷斯利演奏了一种新的节奏，人们称之为摇滚乐。它很快在全世界引起轰动。埃尔维斯的家被称为“格雷斯兰”，1957年被普雷斯利买下。普雷斯利于1977年去世；5年后，这块14英亩的庄园变成了一座博物馆。普雷斯利、他的父母、祖母和死胎孪生兄弟被埋葬在地上。[段落：1 ]今天，格雷兰对一个在美国文化中几乎获得神话地位的人来说是一个非凡的遗嘱。在那里，人们可以看到年轻的埃尔维斯——一个穿着“黑色的男人唱歌”的英俊的牛仔包的叛逆者，他是从英国摇滚家的魔爪中引诱美国青少年和到处吓唬父母的人。[段落：1 ]把这些模糊的形象叠加在一起的是埃尔维斯的形象：厌倦了的超重男人，在拉斯维加斯演唱的是一件白色的紧身连衣裙，躲避中年家庭主妇扔下的内衣，与理查德·尼克松握手，最后死于他的过度行为。[段落：1 ]今天，埃尔维斯仍然深受数百万人的爱戴，其中许多人拒绝相信他死了。尽管如此，他们还是成群结队地来到这座大厦，在他的墓地献花。

TEXT.English: [H1]Suryavarman II[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Khmer Empire[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c.1095 - 1150 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Suryavarman II was king of the Khmer Empire from 1113 to 1150 AD. Encompassing much of what is today modern Thailand, Laos and Cambodia, the Khmer Empire had been wracked with internal feuding and chaos for fifty years before Suryavarman's reign. Born in the last quarter of the eleventh century, Suryavarman would grow to become a skilled general, statesman and patron of the arts.[PARAGRAPH:2]After overcoming his rivals for the throne, Suryavarman began a series of successful invasions into neighboring states and occupied what is now Thailand and Myanmar, extending the borders of the previously stagnant Khmer kingdom. Through his efforts, the empire re-established contact with China to the north and formed a powerful alliance with Champa to the east. Together with his Champa allies, Suryavarman launched an attack against the neighboring state of Dai Viet. Yet when their continued campaigns against Dai Viet ended in loss, the Champa King broke with the Khmer empire. Not one to lightly accept treachery, Suryavarman invaded neighboring Champa, but the brutal campaign ultimately cost the Khmer leader his life.[PARAGRAPH:2] Yet Suryavarman's impressive legacy would reach far beyond his territorial gains. The massive temple to Vishnu which was constructed under his reign - Angkor Wat - remains the largest religious structure in the world. Considered the epitome of Khmer architecture, Angkor Wat acted as the heart of Suryavarman's expanded kingdom. And while stunning as a work of art, Angkor Wat also served as a masterful propaganda piece for the lord of the Khmer. Numerous bas-reliefs of the ruler cover the temple. Many of the sculptures depict Suryavarman among his court or in combat, but above all, they portray him as a calm and talented ruler. Suryavarman's wondrous temple complex remains one of the a central symbols of Khmer heritage and today appears on the modern Cambodian flag.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]苏耶跋摩二世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]高棉国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生卒年份:[\BOLD]约1095-1150[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]苏耶跋摩二世在公元1113至1150年间统治着高棉帝国。古代高棉帝国的疆域包括今泰国、老挝和柬埔寨大部分地区，但在苏耶跋摩登基前的五十年间，这个国家一直饱受内乱的困扰。苏耶跋摩在12世纪末出生，在新世纪逐渐成长为一个经验丰富的军事家、政治家和文化艺术资助人。[PARAGRAPH:1]在消灭所有内部敌人之后，苏耶跋摩对临国发动了一系列成功的入侵，占据了今属泰国和缅甸的大片土地，显著拓展了高棉帝国的边界。在他的努力下，帝国与北面的中国重建邦交，又同东面的占婆结成强势同盟。苏耶跋摩与盟友占婆并肩作战攻打邻近的大越，但随后遭遇挫败，占婆国王也中止了与高棉的盟约。没人会轻易忍受背叛，苏耶跋摩为此亲自率军进攻占婆，不幸在残酷的战斗中付出了自己的生命。[PARAGRAPH:1]苏耶跋摩留给后世的遗产不仅仅是大片新征服的领土。他下令为保护神毗湿奴所修建的巨大神庙——吴哥窟——至今仍是全世界最大的宗教建筑。吴哥窟被视为高棉建筑艺术的集大成者，也是苏耶跋摩统治之下庞大帝国的中心。吴哥窟不但是一件艺术杰作，也是高棉统治者宣扬国威的强大工具。这座神庙的墙壁上无数的浮雕均表现了国王的形象：苏耶跋摩或是在他的宫廷中，或是在指挥作战，人们将他描绘成一位沉静而富有智慧的统治者。苏耶跋摩所建的伟大神庙至今仍是高棉文化遗产的象征，并出现在柬埔寨的国旗之上。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A priest is a person authorized to perform the sacred rituals of a religion, especially as a mediatory agent between humans and one or more deities. They also have the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities. Their office or position is the priesthood, a term which also may apply to such persons collectively.[PARAGRAPH:1]Priests have existed since the earliest of times and in the simplest societies, most likely as a result of agricultural surplus and consequent social stratification. The necessity to read sacred texts and keep temple or church records helped foster literacy in many early societies. Priests exist in many religions today, such as all or some branches of Judaism, Christianity, Shintoism, Hinduism. They are generally regarded as having positive contact with the deity or deities of the religion to which they subscribe, often interpreting the meaning of events and performing the rituals of the religion. There is no common definition of the duties of priesthood between faiths; but generally it includes mediating the relationship between one's congregation, worshippers, and other members of the religious body, and its deity or deities, and administering religious rituals and rites. These often include blessing worshipers with prayers of joy at marriages, after a birth, and at consecrations, teaching the wisdom and dogma of the faith at any regular worship service, and mediating and easing the experience of grief and death at funerals - maintaining a spiritual connection to the afterlife in faiths where such a concept exists. Administering religious building grounds and office affairs and papers, including any religious library or collection of sacred texts, is also commonly a responsibility - for example, the modern term for clerical duties in a secular office refers originally to the duties of a cleric. The question of which religions have a "priest" depends on how the titles of leaders are used or translated into English. In some cases, leaders are more like those that other believers will often turn for advice on spiritual matters, and less of a "person authorized to perform the sacred rituals" For example, clergy in Roman Catholicism and Orthodox Christianity are priests, but in Protestant Christianity they are typically minister and pastor. The terms priest and priestess are sufficiently generic that they may be used in an anthropological sense to describe the religious mediators of an unknown or otherwise unspecified religion.[PARAGRAPH:1]In many religions, being a priest or priestess is a full-time position, ruling out any other career. Many Christian priests and pastors choose or are mandated to dedicate themselves to their churches and receive their living directly from their churches. In other cases it is a part-time role. For example in the early history of Iceland the chieftains were titled goði, a word meaning "priest". As seen in the saga of Hrafnkell Freysgoði, however, being a priest consisted merely of offering periodic sacrifices to the Norse gods and goddesses; it was not a full-time role, nor did it involve ordination.[PARAGRAPH:1]In some religions, being a priest or priestess is by human election or human choice. In Judaism the priesthood is inherited in familial lines.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]牧师是被授权执行宗教神圣仪式的人，特别是作为人类和一个或多个神之间的调解人。他们也有管理宗教仪式的权力或权力；特别是祭祀或安抚一个或多个神的仪式。他们的职务或职位是祭司，这一术语也可以集体适用于这些人。[段：1 ]祭司从最早的时代起就存在，在最简单的社会中，最有可能是由于农业剩余和随之而来的社会分层。在许多早期社会，阅读神圣的经文和保存寺庙或教堂记录的必要性有助于培养识字能力。今天，牧师存在于许多宗教中，如犹太教、基督教、神道教、印度教的全部或部分分支。他们通常被视为与他们所信奉的一个或多个宗教的神有着积极的联系，经常解释事件的含义并执行宗教的仪式。对不同信仰之间的祭司职责没有共同的定义；但一般来说，它包括调解会众、礼拜者和宗教团体其他成员与其神明之间的关系，以及管理宗教仪式和仪式。这些通常包括在婚姻、出生后和献祭时带着喜悦祈祷的祝福崇拜者，在任何定期的礼拜仪式上传授信仰的智慧和教条，在葬礼上调解和缓解悲伤和死亡的体验——在存在这种观念的信仰中保持与来世的精神联系。管理宗教建筑场地、办公室事务和文件，包括任何宗教图书馆或神圣文献的收藏，也通常是一项责任——例如，现代术语“世俗办公室的文书职责”最初指的是一名牧师的职责。哪个宗教有“牧师”的问题取决于领导人的头衔是如何使用或翻译成英语的。在某些情况下，领袖更像是那些其他信徒经常会就精神问题寻求建议的人，而不是“被授权执行神圣仪式的人”，例如，罗马天主教和东正教的神职人员是牧师，但在新教基督教中，他们通常是牧师和牧师。牧师和女祭司的术语是足够通用的，它们可以用人类学的意义来描述一个未知的或其他未指定的宗教的宗教调解人。[段落：1 ]在许多宗教中，作为牧师或女祭司是一个全职的职位，排除任何其他职业。许多基督教牧师和牧师选择或受命献身于他们的教会，并直接从他们的教会接受他们的生活。在其他情况下，它是一个兼职角色。例如在冰岛早期的历史上，酋长们被命名为goði，一个意思是“牧师”的词。然而，正如Hrafnkell Freysgo胡胡的传说中所说的，作为一名牧师，只不过是为挪威神和女神提供定期的祭祀；它不是一个全职的角色，也不是涉及到教职的。[段：1 ]在某些宗教中，作为牧师或女祭司是由人类选择或人类选择的。在犹太教中，祭司的身份是家族遗传的。

TEXT.English: [H1]Hiram I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Tyre[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c.994 - 936 BC[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hiram I was king of Tyre from 969 BC to 936 BC, succeeding his father, Abibaal. During his reign, Tyre grew from a satellite of Sidon into the most important of Phoenician cities, and the holder of a large trading empire. Hiram allied himself with king Solomon of Israel, the upcoming power of the region; together they would fill the power gap left by the retreat of Egypt when Assyria and Damascus were unable to do so. Through the alliance with Solomon, Hiram ensured himself access to the major trade routes to Egypt, Arabia and Mesopotamia. The two kings also joined forces in starting a trade route over the Red Sea, connecting the Israelite harbor of Ezion-Geber with a land called Ophir. Both kings grew rich through this trade. Hiram sent Solomon architects, workmen and cedar wood to build the First Temple in Jerusalem. He also extended the Tyrean harbor, enlarged the city by joining the two islands on which it was built, and built a royal palace and a temple for Melquart.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] Prime[\H1] [Brut]国王Tyr[\Brut] [NealLe] [Brd]活：[C.Brd] C.94- 936 BC[新行] [NealLe] [Brut]背景：[\Brut]（段落：1）希拉姆，我是TIE国王，从公元前969年到公元前936年，继承了他的父亲Abibaal。在他的统治期间，提尔从西顿的一个卫星成长为腓尼基最重要的城市，并拥有一个庞大的贸易帝国。希兰与以色列王所罗门结盟，这是该地区即将到来的力量；当亚述人和大马士革人不能这样做时，他们将一起填补埃及撤退留下的力量缺口。通过与所罗门结盟，希兰确保了自己进入埃及、阿拉伯和美索不达米亚的主要贸易路线。两位国王还联手在红海上开辟了一条贸易路线，把以色列的以旬迦别港和一块名叫俄斐的土地连接起来。两位国王都是通过这种贸易致富的。希兰差遣所罗门的建筑师，工人，香柏木，在耶路撒冷建造第一座殿。他还扩建了提利安港，通过连接建造提利安港的两个岛屿扩大了城市规模，并为梅尔夸特建造了一座皇宫和一座神庙。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Rurales was the name commonly used to designate the Mexican Guardia Rural (Rural Guard): a force of mounted police or gendarmerie that existed between 1861 and 1914. In modern Mexico the name is applied to members of a part-time rural defense corps.[PARAGRAPH:1]The image of the Rurales as a ruthless and efficient organisation, which seldom took prisoners under the notorious ley fuga and inevitably got its man, was deliberately fostered under the Porfirian regime. However, research during the 1970s involving detailed examination of the records of the corps indicated that the Rurales were neither as effective nor as brutal as regime publicists had suggested. Never numbering more than about 4,000 men located in small detachments, the Rurales were too thinly spread to ever completely eliminate unrest in the Mexican countryside. They did however impose a superficial order, especially in the central regions around Mexico City, which encouraged the foreign investment sought by Díaz and his científico advisers . To a certain extent the regime saw the Rurales as a counterweight to the much larger Federal army and in the later years of the regime they were increasingly used to control industrial unrest, in addition to their traditional task of patrolling country areas.
TEXT.Chinese: 乡村警卫队是墨西哥乡村警卫队的常用名称：1861年至1914年间的一支骑警或宪兵部队。在现代墨西哥，这个名字适用于兼职的农村防务兵。[段落：1 ]作为一个无情和有效率的组织，农奴的形象，很少被俘虏在恶名昭彰的利福加，并不可避免地得到它的人，是在波尔菲尔政权下蓄意培育的。然而，在20世纪70年代的研究中，涉及到对兵团记录的详细检查，表明这些规则既不像政权宣传人员所建议的那样有效，也不像他们所建议的那样残酷。由于没有超过4000人驻扎在小分遣队中，农村地区的人口分布太少，无法完全消除墨西哥农村的动乱。然而，他们确实强加了一种肤浅的秩序，特别是在墨西哥城周边的中部地区，这鼓励了迪亚斯和他的科学家顾问寻求的外国投资。在某种程度上，该政权将农村地区视为与规模更大的联邦军队抗衡的力量，在该政权的晚年，他们除了在农村地区巡逻的传统任务外，越来越多地被用来控制工业动乱。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Facing Roman persecution, the earliest Christians worshiped in secret in private homes, catacombs, and the like. The Emperor Constantine I legalized Christianity in 325 AD. Though not a Christian himself as is often mistakenly claimed, Constantine I built many Christian churches across Roman territory, including the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem, which many Christians believe is on the site where Jesus was born.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]面对罗马的迫害，最早的基督徒在私人住宅、地下墓穴等处进行秘密礼拜。公元325年，君士坦丁一世皇帝将基督教合法化。尽管君士坦丁一世本人并不像人们常说的那样是一个基督徒，但他在罗马领土上建造了许多基督教教堂，包括伯利恒的耶稣降生教堂，许多基督徒相信这座教堂就在耶稣诞生的地方。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The estuaries of the rivers Rhine, Meuse and Scheldt have been subject to flooding over the centuries. After building the Afsluitdijk (1927 - 1932), the Dutch started studying the damming of the Rhine-Meuse Delta. Plans were developed to shorten the coastline and turn the delta into a group of freshwater coastal lakes. By shortening the coastline, fewer dikes would have to be reinforced.[PARAGRAPH:2]Due to indecision and the Second World War, little action was taken. In 1950 two small estuary mouths, the Brielse Gat near Brielle and the Botlek near Vlaardingen were dammed. After the North Sea flood of 1953, a Delta Works Commission was installed to research the causes and develop measures to prevent such disasters in future. They revised some of the old plans and came up with the "Deltaplan".[PARAGRAPH:2]Unlike the Zuiderzee Works, the Delta Plan's purpose is largely defensive and not for land reclamation. The Delta Plan is a national programme and demands collaboration between the national government, provincial authorities, municipal authorities and the water boards. The plan consisted of blocking the estuary mouths of the Oosterschelde, the Haringvliet and the Grevelingen. This reduced the length of the dikes exposed to the sea by 700 kilometres (430 mi). The mouths of the Nieuwe Waterweg and the Westerschelde were to remain open because of the important shipping routes to the ports of Rotterdam and Antwerp. The dikes along these waterways were to be heightened and strengthened. The works would be combined with road and waterway infrastructure to stimulate the economy of the province of Zeeland and improve the connection between the ports of Rotterdam and Antwerp.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]莱茵河、默兹河和谢尔特河的河口几个世纪以来一直遭受洪水侵袭。在建造了阿夫斯鲁伊特迪克（1927-1932）之后，荷兰人开始研究莱茵-默兹三角洲的筑坝。已制定计划缩短海岸线，并将三角洲变成一组淡水沿岸湖泊。通过缩短海岸线，堤坝的数量将减少。[段落：2 ]由于犹豫不决和第二次世界大战，几乎没有采取任何行动。1950年，两个小河口，布里埃勒附近的布里埃尔斯盖特河口和弗拉丁根附近的博特莱克河口被筑坝。1953年北海大洪水后，成立了三角洲工务委员会，研究其成因，并制定预防措施。他们修改了一些旧的计划，提出了“Delta计划”。[段落：2 ]不同于ZudelZee的工程，三角洲计划的目的主要是防御而不是土地复垦。三角洲计划是一项国家计划，要求国家政府、省政府、市政府和水务局进行合作。该计划包括封锁奥斯特谢尔德、哈林夫利特和格雷维林根河口。这使暴露在海洋中的堤坝长度减少了700公里（430英里）。由于通往鹿特丹港和安特卫普港的重要航线，纽韦水城和韦斯特谢尔德港的河口将继续开放。沿着这些水道的堤坝要加高和加固。该工程将与公路和水路基础设施相结合，以刺激泽兰省的经济，改善鹿特丹港和安特卫普港之间的联系。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A mala'e is a communal or sacred place that serves religious and social purposes in Polynesian societies. In all these languages, the word also means "cleared, free of weeds, trees, etc." It generally consists of an area of cleared land roughly rectangular (the mala'e itself), bordered with stones or wooden posts (called au in Tahitian and Cook Islands Maori) perhaps with terraces (paepae) which were traditionally used for ceremonial purposes; and in some cases, a central stone ahu or a'u. In the Rapanui culture of Easter Island "ahu" has become a synonym for the whole mala'e complex).[PARAGRAPH:1]In some modern Polynesian societies, notably that of the Maori of New Zealand, the mala'e is still a vital part of everyday life. However, in tropical Polynesia, most mala'e were destroyed or abandoned with the arrival of Christianity in the 19th century and some of them have become an attraction for tourists or archaeologists. Nevertheless, the place where the mala'e were built are still considered as tapu in most islands. In the Cook Islands, a few mala'e are still maintained, and are quickly tidied up before the investiture of a new ariki.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]玛拉是波利尼西亚社会中为宗教和社会目的服务的公共或神圣场所。在所有这些语言中，这个词也意味着“干净、没有杂草、树木等”。它通常包括一块大致呈长方形的干净土地（马拉河本身），与石头或木柱（在塔希提岛和库克群岛毛利人中称为au）接壤，可能有梯田（paepae），这些梯田传统上用于仪式目的；以及一些情况下，复活岛的拉帕努文化中的一块中心石AHU或AU“AHU”已经成为整个马拉雅情结的同义词。[段落：1 ]在一些现代波利尼西亚社会中，特别是新西兰毛利人，马拉伊仍然是日常生活中的重要部分。然而，在热带玻利尼西亚，随着19世纪基督教的到来，大部分玛拉人被摧毁或遗弃，其中一些玛拉人已成为旅游者或考古学家的一个景点。尽管如此，马拉岛的所在地在大多数岛屿上仍然被认为是塔普岛。在库克群岛，仍有一些马拉岛被保留下来，在新的阿里基被任命之前很快就被清理干净了。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A camp is a place with temporary accommodation of huts, tents, or other structures, typically used by soldiers, refugees, hunters or travelling people.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]营地是一个临时安置棚屋、帐篷或其他建筑的地方，通常供士兵、难民、猎人或旅行人员使用。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Church of the Anastasis, also called the Church of the Resurrection or the Church of the Holy Sepulchre by Latin Christians, is a church within the Christian Quarter of the walled Old City of Jerusalem. It is a few steps away from the Muristan.[PARAGRAPH:1]The site is venerated as Calvary (Golgotha), where Jesus was crucified, and also contains the place where Jesus is said to have been buried. The church has been an important Christian pilgrimage destination since at least the 4th century as the purported site of the resurrection of Jesus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today it also serves as the headquarters of the Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem, while control of the building is shared between several Christian churches and secular entities in complicated arrangements essentially unchanged for centuries. Today, the church is home to branches of Eastern Orthodoxy and Oriental Orthodoxy as well as to Roman Catholicism. Anglicans and Protestants have no permanent presence in the Church and some have regarded the Garden Tomb, elsewhere in Jerusalem, as the true place of Jesus's crucifixion and resurrection.
TEXT.Chinese: 阿纳斯塔西教堂，也被拉丁基督教徒称为复活教堂或圣墓教堂，是耶路撒冷被围墙包围的旧城基督教区内的一座教堂。它离穆里斯坦有几步之遥。[段落：1 ]该遗址被尊为加略山（GoGotha），Jesus被钉在十字架上，也包含了据说Jesus被埋葬的地方。自从四世纪以来，教堂一直是一个重要的基督教朝圣目的地，因为它是Jesus复活的据点。[第1段]今天，它也是耶路撒冷希腊正统教士的总部，而建筑的控制权在几个基督教教堂和世俗实体之间以复杂的布局共享，几个世纪以来基本没有改变。今天，教会是东方正统派和东方正统派以及罗马天主教分支的所在地。圣公会教徒和新教徒在教堂里没有永久性的存在，一些人认为花园坟墓，在耶路撒冷的其他地方，是耶稣受难和复活的真正场所。

TEXT.English: [H1]Catherine II the Great[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Empress and Autocrat of All the Russias[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1729 - 1796 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Catherine was born in Szczecin in 1729, a princess of Pomerania, a small kingdom in Prussia. At 16 she was married to Carl Peter Ulrich, the heir to the Russian throne. Catherine quickly learned Russian and joined the Russian Orthodox Church. Largely self-educated, Catherine immersed herself in the literature of the time. Endowed with both beauty and intelligence, she became strong friends (if not more) with the great thinkers of the day, including the brilliant French philosophers Rousseau and Diderot.[PARAGRAPH:2]Catherine did not lack political ambition, however. At the age of 33, with the support of the Imperial guard, she overthrew her husband, the Emperor Peter III, who was soon killed "in a hunting accident," leaving Catherine the sole ruler of Russia. As Empress, Catherine pursued an expansionist policy, fighting two successful wars against the Ottoman Empire and acquiring vast territory in southern Ukraine and the Crimea. She undertook a wide range of political reforms, attempting to shape up the notoriously corrupt and incompetent Russian bureaucracy. She curried favor with the aristocracy, expanding their already-great power over the Russian peasants.[PARAGRAPH:2]A patron of the arts, Catherine commissioned many statues and paintings. Under her rule St. Petersburg was transformed from a primitive and forbidding city into one of the most beautiful and impressive European capitals.[PARAGRAPH:2]Despite her many public successes, Catherine is best known for her private excesses. Her affairs are legendary; it has been suggested that she slept with a fairly large fraction of the Russian officers corps, not to mention her many well-publicized dalliances with a horde of well-known European politicians and artists.[PARAGRAPH:2]Catherine died at the age of 67, having lived longer than any other Romanov monarch.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]叶卡捷琳娜[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]俄国沙皇[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生卒年份：[\BOLD]1729-1796年[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]叶卡捷琳娜原名苏菲，是日耳曼小诸侯国——波美拉尼亚的公主，1729年出生于什切青。叶卡捷琳娜在16岁时嫁给了俄国皇位继承人卡尔·彼得·尤里奇，很快学会了俄语并皈依东正教。叶卡捷琳娜热爱新知，倾向当时的启蒙主义思潮。她既有美貌，又具智慧，并与当时的许多大思想家保持着良好的（或是更亲密的）友谊，包括著名的法国哲学家卢梭和狄德罗。[PARAGRAPH:1]叶卡捷琳娜也富有政治野心。在她33岁时，凭借近卫军的支持发动政变，废黜了他的丈夫彼得三世，不久这位沙皇即死于“打猎时的意外”，从此叶卡捷琳娜成为俄国的最高统治者。叶卡捷琳娜在位期间执行积极扩张政策，两次赢得对奥斯曼帝国的战争，夺取了乌克兰南部和克里米亚的大片领土。她还在许多领域实施了一系列政治改革，试图消除俄国官僚阶层的腐败无能。她努力维护大贵族的利益，而对俄国的农奴进行极其残酷的压迫。[PARAGRAPH:1]作为艺术资助者，叶卡捷琳娜收集了大量雕塑和绘画。在她统治期间，圣彼得堡由一座原始封闭的城市变为全欧洲最美丽的都市之一。[PARAGRAPH:1]虽然在政治上非常成功，叶卡捷琳娜在私生活方面的放纵却更惹人关注。关于她有许多传奇般的风流韵事。传说她曾与一大批俄国军官有染，她与欧洲一些著名的政治家和艺术家的暧昧关系则更是广为人知。[PARAGRAPH:1]叶卡捷琳娜享年67岁，比任何其他罗曼诺夫王朝的君主都更长寿。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Hoplites were well-trained citizen-soldiers of ancient Greece. Armed with spears and durable armor, they fulfilled the heavy infantry role in most engagements. Hoplites are tightly packed groupings of eight or sixteen rows of soldiers, who move and attack in unison, scattering less densely organized enemy forces. Hoplites worked well against the forces of the day, but broke down when facing more mobile and well-trained professional soldiers. The Roman legions victory over the Macedonian phalanx at Pydna in 168 BC effectively ended the phalanx's battlefield usefulness.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]霍普利特人是受过良好训练的古希腊公民士兵。他们装备长矛和耐用的盔甲，在大多数交战中扮演重步兵的角色。霍普利特人是由八排或十六排士兵组成的密集部队，他们齐心协力地行动和进攻，分散组织不那么密集的敌军。霍普利特人很好地抵抗了当时的军队，但在面对更多机动和训练有素的专业士兵时却崩溃了。公元前168年，罗马军团在皮德纳战胜马其顿方阵，有效地结束了方阵在战场上的作用。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dinh has historically been the community center of Viet village life. It is a traditional and sacred community house which provides a collective venue for all aspects of village life including social gatherings, festival celebrations, civil disputes and spiritual pursuits. Essentially a place where the spiritual and the secular events of life converge, though their administrative role has diminished with time. They were highly carved and decorated, reaching a zenith of style in the 17th century.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The oldest surviving Dinh date back to the Mac dynasty in the 16th century, but Dinh have probably been around since early historical times. This aspect of Viet heritage and culture is becoming less prevalent, due to both modernization and the Vietnamese diaspora. But the Dinh remains significant not only as a historical cultural example but also as a means and venue in which to reinforce a sense of community.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Constructed from prefabricated modules launched individually, the International Space Station is a habitable, low-Earth-orbit satellite. It arose from the 1993 merger into a single multinational program of three national initiatives to establish a permanent orbital platform for research and exploration: the Soviet "Mir-2," the American "Freedom," and the European Union's "Columbus." To date, astronauts from 15 countries have lived and worked on the station. Supplies and crew members have ferried to the platform by American space shuttles and Russian Soyuz rockets; these are scheduled to be replaced by the Russian Progress, European ATV, Japanese H-II Transfer Vehicle, and the American SpaceX corporation's Dragon. The International Space Station is the largest artificial body in orbit, and can be seen with the naked eye from Earth under the appropriate conditions.
TEXT.Chinese: 国际空间站是一颗可居住的低地球轨道卫星，由单独发射的预制模块构成。它产生于1993年合并为一个由三个国家倡议组成的单一多国计划，以建立一个永久性的轨道研究和探索平台：苏联的“和平号-2”、美国的“自由号”和欧盟的“哥伦布号”。迄今为止，来自15个国家的宇航员在空间站生活和工作。补给和机组人员已由美国航天飞机和俄罗斯联盟号火箭运送到该平台；计划由俄罗斯进步号、欧洲亚视、日本H-II运载火箭和美国SpaceX公司的“龙”号运载火箭取代。国际空间站是轨道上最大的人造物体，在适当的条件下可以用肉眼从地球上看到。

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the mid-19th century, Brazil had been undergoing an economic transformation brought about by a new export crop: coffee. Coffee provided a new basis for agricultural expansion in southern Brazil. In the provinces of Rio de Janeiro and then São Paulo, coffee estates, or fazendas, began to spread toward the interior as new lands were opened. By 1850, coffee made up more than 50% of Brazil's exports, and more than half of world coffee production.[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the expansion of coffee growing came an intensification of slavery in Brazil, as the country's primary form of labor. More than 1.4 million Africans were forced to be slaves in Brazil in the last 50 years of the slave trade, and even after the trans-Atlantic slave trade ended, slavery continued until 1888.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because of the increased profit from the trade of coffee, the years after 1850 saw considerable growth and prosperity in Brazil. Dom Pedro II proved to be an enlightened man of middle-class habits who was anxious to reign over a tranquil and progressive nation, even if that tranquility was based on slave labor. Railroads, steamships and the telegraph were introduced to Brazil, all paid for by the money the fazendas supplied from their coffee crop. In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]19世纪中叶，巴西经历了一场由新的出口作物咖啡带来的经济转型。咖啡为巴西南部的农业扩张提供了新的基础。在里约热内卢和圣保罗两省，随着新土地的开垦，咖啡庄园（fazendas）开始向内地扩张。到1850，咖啡占巴西出口的50%以上，世界咖啡产量的一半以上。[段落：1 ]随着咖啡种植量的增加，巴西的奴隶制也日益加剧，成为该国的主要劳动力形式。在奴隶贸易的最后50年里，超过140万名非洲人被迫在巴西成为奴隶，甚至在跨大西洋奴隶贸易结束后，奴隶制一直持续到1888。[段落：1 ]由于咖啡贸易的利润增加，1850年后巴西的经济增长和繁荣相当可观。多姆佩德罗二世被证明是一个有着中产阶级习惯的开明之人，他渴望统治一个安宁和进步的国家，即使这种安宁是建立在奴隶劳动的基础上的。铁路、轮船和电报被引入巴西，所有费用都是由法森达斯从他们的咖啡作物中提供的钱支付的。在里约热内卢和圣保罗等不断增长的城市里，商人、律师、中产阶级和城市工人阶级不断增长，再一次由来自法曾达斯的钱来支付。

TEXT.English: [H1]Juan Domingo Perón[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Argentina[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1895 - 1974 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] He was elected President of Argentina in three occasions. The first time he was elected president was on February 24th of 1946, for the period 1946-1952. He was reelected on November 11th of 1951, for the period 1952-1958, which failed to complete due to a military coup that overthrew him on September 16th of 1955. Finally, after 18 years in exile, he returned to Argentina and was elected president for the third time on September 23th of 1973 for the period 1973-1979, which he could not complete because of his death.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]胡安・多明戈・庇隆[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Argentina[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] Born in Lobos, Argentina, on October 8th of 1895, and died in Olivos, the on July 1st of 1974.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB] He was elected President of Argentina in three occasions. The first time he was elected president was on February 24th of 1946, for the period 1946-1952. He was reelected on November 11th of 1951, for the period 1952-1958, which failed to complete due to a military coup that overthrew him on September 16th of 1955. Finally, after 18 years in exile, he returned to Argentina and was elected president for the third time on September 23th of 1973 for the period 1973-1979, which he could not complete because of his death.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The sword developed from the dagger when the construction of longer blades became possible, from the late 3rd millennium BC in the Middle East, first in arsenic copper, then in tin-bronze. The oldest sword-like weapons are found at Arslantepe, Turkey, and date to around 3300 BC. However, it is generally considered that these are longer daggers, and not the first ancestors of swords. Sword blades longer than 60 cm (24 in) were rare and not practical until the late Bronze Age because the tensile strength of bronze is relatively low, and consequently longer blades would bend easily.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]这把剑是在匕首的基础上发展起来的，当时长刃的建造成为可能，从公元前3世纪晚期开始，在中东，首先是砷铜，然后是锡青铜。最古老的剑状武器发现于土耳其的阿尔兰特佩，可追溯到公元前3300年左右。不过，一般认为这是较长的匕首，而不是剑的祖先。60厘米（24英寸）以上的剑刃很少见，直到青铜时代晚期才实用，因为青铜的抗拉强度相对较低，因此较长的剑刃很容易弯曲。

TEXT.English: [H1]Bumin Qaghan[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Chieftain of the Ashina Clan, Khagan of the Turkic Khaganate[NEWLINE]Reigned:[\BOLD] 551 - 552 A.D.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Bumin Qaghan or Illig Qaghan, (died 552 AD) was the founder of the Turkic Khaganate. He was the eldest son of Ashina Tuwu and chieftain of the Türks under the sovereignty of Rouran Khaganate. He is also mentioned as "Tumen" (commander of ten thousand) of the Rouran Khaganate.[PARAGRAPH:2]Not much is known about Bumin鈥檚 life except what was documented by Chinese chronicles. Accordingly, Bumin鈥檚 ascension began in 545, when his tribe was growing in strength and frequently invaded the western frontier of Wei. In response to that the chancellor of Western Wei, Yuwen Tai, sent a messenger to Tujue (Chinese name for the Türks seat in the Altai Mountains and/or its people) to greet Bumin and try to establish friendly relations. In 546, Bumin answered presenting tribute to Western Wei. In summer 551, the Tiele were launching an attack on Rouran, when Bumin鈥檚 army intercepted them and captured a large number of their people. After his victory, Bumin took advantage of this and requested a marriage with a daughter of Yujiulü Anagui, Khagan of the Rouran. Anagui felt insulted and refused this request, viewing the Türks as inferior, sending to Bumin a messenger with his message: 鈥淵ou are my blacksmith slave. How dare you utter these words?鈥?(The Türks were indeed blacksmith servants for the Rouran elite and that may indicate a kind of vassalage system prevailed in Rouran society) In response, Bumin killed Anagui's messenger and cut off relations, leading a revolt against the Rouran.[PARAGRAPH:2]In addition to being a warrior leader, Bumin also used diplomacy as a tool against his enemies and to strengthen his position. After been denied the marriage with the Rouran princess and insulted, Bumin requested a Western Wei princess in marriage. Yuwen Tai, the chancellor of the state, seeking an alliance against the Rouran permitted it and sent Princess Changle to marry Bumin. Other example is when Emperor Wen of Western Wei died, Bumin sent a messenger with two hundred horses in honor to his death, strengthening the relations with the Western Wei.[PARAGRAPH:2]The beginning of formal diplomatic relations with China propped up Bumin's authority among the Turks. He eventually united the local Turkic tribes and threw off the yoke of the Rouran domination. Allied with the Western Wei, Bumin defeated Anagui and his forces north of Huaihuang (modern Zhangjiakou, Hebei) in 552.[PARAGRAPH:2]Having excelled in both battle and diplomacy, Bumin declared himself Illig Khagan of the new khaganate at Otukan, but died within several months after his coronation. His younger brother and vassal Istemi in the western part and his son Issik Qaghan in the eastern part succeeded him. In less than one century, his khaganate expanded to comprise most of Central Asia.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] Bumin Qaghan [\H1] [Brut]酋长阿什纳家族的酋长，土库曼语KHGAANATATE的Khagan [新行]统治：[\BOLD ] 551到552 A.D[新行] [BurnLe] [Brut]背景[Brd]（段落：1）Bumin Qaghan或Illig Qaghan，（死于公元552年）是土库曼语KHGAANATE的创始者。他是阿什纳·图乌的长子，鲁兰汗国统治下的土尔克酋长。他也被称为“图伦”（指挥官一万）的Rurang-KhangAATE。[段落：2 ]对Bumin的生活知之甚少，除了中国编年史所记载的。因此，布明的提升开始于545年，当时他的部族正在壮大，并经常入侵魏西边疆。针对这一情况，西魏议长泰宇文（Yuwen Tai）派使者到土觉（阿勒泰山脉和/或其人民的土觉）迎接布明，并试图建立友好关系。546年，布明回敬西魏。551年夏天，铁甲军向鲁兰发动进攻，布明的军队截获了他们，并俘虏了他们的大批人。胜利后，布明利用这一点，要求与鲁兰人卡根尤久勒阿纳吉的女儿结婚。阿纳圭觉得受到了侮辱，拒绝了这个请求，认为图尔克是低人一等的，他给布明发了一个信使，说：“你是我的铁匠奴隶。你怎么敢说出这些话？“（Trrk确实是罗兰精英的铁匠仆人，这可能意味着一种在Rouran社会盛行的附庸制度），作为回应，Bumin杀死了阿纳吉的信使并切断了关系，导致了对鲁兰的反抗。布明还利用外交手段对付敌人，巩固自己的地位。在被拒绝与柔兰公主结婚并受到侮辱后，布明要求与一位西魏公主结婚。国务大臣郁文泰为了与鲁然结盟，允许鲁兰结盟，并派长乐公主嫁给了布明。另一个例子是西魏Emperor Wen死后，Bumin派了一位信使二百匹马来纪念他的死亡，加强了与西魏的关系。〔段落：2〕与中国正式外交关系的开始，支持了Bumin在土耳其人中的权威。他最终统一了当地的土库曼部落，摆脱了鲁兰统治的枷锁。与西魏结盟，Bumin于552击败了Huaihuang北部的Anagui和他的部队（现代张家口，河北）。[段落：2 ]在战斗和外交上都表现出色，Bumin宣称自己是奥图坎新哈根人的Illig Khagan，但在加冕后的几个月内就死了。他的弟弟和西边的附庸伊斯特米和东边的儿子伊西克卡甘接替了他。在不到一个世纪的时间里，他的汗国扩张到了中亚的大部分地区。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A madrasah is an Islamic institute of higher learning, usually religious in nature. The earliest madrasahs were formed in Islamic mosques, where scholars gathered to study and debate religious and secular issues of the day. Over time students would come to study with the most learned scholars; the most popular teachers often had to construct separate buildings to hold their growing student population.[PARAGRAPH:1]At the madrasahs the students would learn to read and write and study religious doctrine, history and law. Some madrasahs also taught logic, world history, foreign language, mathematics, art and science. Since state-run colleges and universities did not appear until later in history, the madrasahs were critical centers of learning in many Islamic cities.
TEXT.Chinese: 修道院是那些希望远离尘世，追求圣洁生活的宗教僧侣们的静修场所。通常修道院都规定有严格的行为准则，确保修道者免受外来的骚扰和诱惑。有的修道院要求人人保持静默；有的完全禁止访问者入内。僧侣们每日都须在修道院中举行宗教仪式。[PARAGRAPH:1]在古代，修道院往往也成为学术研究的中心。在边远地区，僧侣可能是当地仅有的有文化者。僧侣们经常担任抄写工作，负责传抄本宗教的经书文献。修道院通常会附有图书馆，用于存放神学、科学、医学和哲学书籍。[PARAGRAPH:1]伊斯兰教非常尊重信仰的学术研究，且不论其属于何种宗教。可兰经上说，“真主眼中的世人并无分别，不论是修道院、教堂、会堂还是清真寺，都是在全力敬奉真主之名。”

TEXT.English: [TAB]Artisanry was important in Teotihuacan culture as well as in successor cultures such as the Toltecs. Indeed, the Aztecs used the word "toltec" to refer both to the Toltec people and to skilled artisans in general. Many Teotihuacano and Toltec artifacts have been found, including as the Teotihuacan Ocelot, a sculpture in the shape of a feline that may have been used to hold temple offerings such as the hearts of sacrificed humans. Other examples of craftsmanship from Teotihuacan include masks, vibrant painted murals, and many obsidian artifacts.
