Historians have regarded the Emperor in an extremely positive light, and he is usually ranked as the greatest Brazilian.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] Dom Pedro II大度[\H1] [NealLe] [Brut]巴西皇帝[粗体] [新行] [BOLD ]：[\BOLD ] 1825到1891 AD [新行] [NealLe] [Brut]背景：[BARD] [段落：1 ] Dom Pedro II是巴西帝国的第二位也是最后一位统治者，统治了超过58年。他出生在里约热内卢，是巴西皇帝多姆佩德罗一世和多娜玛丽亚利奥波蒂娜皇后的第七个孩子，因此是布拉甘扎家族巴西分部的成员。1831年，父亲突然退位并逃亡欧洲，留下了一位五岁的佩德罗二世（Pedro II）为皇帝，并导致了一个严峻而孤独的童年和青春期。他不得不花时间学习准备统治，他只知道短暂的快乐时光，很少遇到像他这样年纪的朋友。他在这一时期的宫廷阴谋和政治纠纷的经历，极大地影响了他后期的性格。佩德罗二世成长为一个对国家和人民有强烈责任感和献身精神的人。另一方面，他越来越憎恨他作为君主的角色。[段：2 ]继承了帝国濒临崩溃的边缘，Pedro II把葡萄牙语巴西变成了国际舞台上新兴的大国。这个国家因其政治稳定、积极捍卫言论自由、尊重公民权利、充满活力的经济增长，特别是其政府形式（一个有职能、有代表性的议会君主制）而与西班牙邻国区别开来。巴西在他的统治下，也在三次国际冲突（普拉廷战争、乌拉圭战争和巴拉圭战争）中获胜，并在其他几次国际争端和国内紧张局势中获胜。佩德罗二世不顾强大的政治和经济利益的反对，坚定地推动废除奴隶制。作为一名学者，皇帝在学术、文化和科学方面都享有盛誉。他赢得了Charles Darwin、维克多·雨果和Friedrich Nietzsche等学者的尊敬和钦佩，是Richard Wagner、路易·巴斯德和朗费罗等的朋友。[段：2 ]尽管大多数巴西人没有改变政府形式的愿望，但皇帝在一次突然政变中被推翻了。在一个军事领导人集团之外几乎没有任何支持，这个集团希望建立一个由独裁者领导的共和国。佩德罗二世已经厌倦了君主制，对君主制的未来前景感到绝望，尽管它获得了压倒性的民众支持。他不允许阻止他的下台，也不支持任何恢复君主制的企图。他在欧洲流亡的最后两年，独自生活在非常少的钱上。（2段）Pedro II的统治因此结束了一个不寻常的结局。他被人们高度赞扬，在他受欢迎的顶峰时期被推翻，他的一些成就很快就在巴西滑落到很长一段时间后化为乌有。软弱的政府，独裁统治，宪法和经济危机。流放他的人很快开始在他身上看到巴西共和国的榜样。在他死后几十年，他的名声恢复了，他的遗体作为一个民族英雄被送回巴西。这种名声一直延续到今天。历史学家对皇帝的评价是非常积极的，他通常被认为是最伟大的巴西人。

TEXT.English: [H1]Muhammd Salman Khan Tughluq[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Turkish Sultan of Delhi[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Reigned:[\BOLD] 1324 - 1351 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Muhammad bin Tughluq (also Prince Fakhr Malik, Jauna Khan and 20, 1351) was the Turkic Sultan of Delhi from 1325 to 1351. He was the eldest son of Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq. He was born in Kotla Tolay Khan in Multan. His wife was the daughter of the raja of Dipalpur. Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq sent the young Muhammad to the Deccan to campaign against king Prataparudra of the Kakatiya dynasty whose capital was at Warangal. Muhammad succeeded to the Delhi throne upon his father's death in 1325. He in turn was succeeded by his cousin Firuz Shah Tughluq.[PARAGRAPH:2]Muhammad Tughlug was a scholar versed in logic, philosophy, mathematics, astronomy and physical sciences. He had knowledge of medicine and was skillful in dialectics. He was also a calligrapher. He was well versed with several languages like Persian, Arabic, Turkish and even Sanskrit. Ibn Battuta, the famous Moroccan traveler, visited him during his reign. He introduced some remarkable administrative measures which although failed but very distinct and exemplary in nature.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]沙尔曼MuHaMd Khan-TuguLuq[[Hald] [Brut]土耳其苏丹的德里[粗体] [新行] [BOLD ]：[\BOLD ] 1324 - 1351 AD [新行] [新版] [Brut]背景：[Brd]（段落：1）Muhammad bin Tughluq（也是Fakhr Malik王子，Jauna Khan和20, 1351）是德令哈市的土库曼语苏丹，从1325到1351。他是Ghiyas ud din Tughlaq的长子。他出生在木尔坦的科特拉托莱汗。他的妻子是迪帕尔普尔国王的女儿。吉亚斯·乌德·丁·图格拉克将年轻的穆罕默德派往德干，与首都在瓦朗加尔的卡卡蒂亚王朝的国王普拉塔帕鲁德拉（Prataparudra）作战。穆罕默德在1325年父亲去世后继承了德里王位。他继而被表弟Firuz Shah Tughluq继承。〔2〕Muhammad Tughlug是一位精通逻辑学、哲学、数学、天文学和物理科学的学者。他有医学知识，擅长辩证法。他也是一位书法家。他精通几种语言，如波斯语、阿拉伯语、土耳其语甚至梵语。摩洛哥著名旅行家伊本·巴图塔（Ibn Battuta）在其统治时期拜访过他。他提出了一些卓有成效的行政措施，这些措施虽然失败了，但具有鲜明的示范性。

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the earliest societies, rulers justified the exercise of their power with nothing put their personal authority. The most important tasks for early rulers were warfare and religious leadership, authority was often derived from military leadership, successful conquest or connection to the gods. Over time, these concepts would be further refined and expanded upon. For example, in the Greek and Roman world, rhetorical skill was regarded as a substantial source of authority. The great advantage of a system based on the skills and background of a single person is that there is less risk of disloyalty and factionalism to the functioning of government. However, one person can only exert their power so far. Once a civilisation grows to a certain size, power needs to be transferred to other people to maintain control, and a more sophisticated system becomes necessary to legitimise their rule.
TEXT.Chinese: 在最早的社会里，统治者在行使他们的权力时没有把他们的个人权威放在眼里。早期统治者最重要的任务是战争和宗教领导，权威往往来自军事领导、成功征服或与神的联系。随着时间的推移，这些概念将进一步完善和扩展。例如，在希腊和罗马世界，修辞技巧被视为权威的重要来源。以一个人的技能和背景为基础的制度的最大优点是，对政府运作不忠诚和派系主义的风险较小。然而，一个人只能发挥他们的权力到目前为止。一旦一个文明发展到一定的规模，权力就需要转移给其他人来维持控制，一个更加复杂的制度就成为使他们的统治合法化的必要条件。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Before the spread of Christianity to Ethiopia in the 4th century, religion in the Aksumite Empire was closely related to the Semitic polytheism of Southern Arabia. It has been suggested that its principal god was Astar, a male deity equivalent to Mesopotamian goddess Ishtar.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]公元4世纪基督教传入埃塞俄比亚之前，阿克苏米特帝国的宗教与阿拉伯南部的闪族多神论有着密切的联系。有人认为它的主要神是阿斯塔，一个相当于美索不达米亚女神伊什塔的男性神。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A llanero (plainsman) is a Venezuelan or Colombian herder. The name is taken from the Llanos grasslands occupying western Venezuela and eastern Colombia. The Llanero were originally part Spanish and Indian and have a strong culture including a distinctive form of music.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the wars of independence, Llaneros served in both armies and provided the bulk of the cavalry during the war. In 1819, an army of Llaneros, led by Simón Bolívar and José Antonio Páez, defeated the Spanish with a surprise attack when they crossed over the Orinoco plains and the Andes mountains.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]利亚内罗（原告）是委内瑞拉或哥伦比亚牧民。这个名字取自委内瑞拉西部和哥伦比亚东部的利亚诺斯草原。兰莱罗原本是西班牙和印度的一部分，拥有强大的文化，包括独特的音乐形式。[段：1 ]在独立战争期间，Llaneros在两军服役，并在战争期间提供了大部分骑兵。1819年，由西蒙博利瓦尔和何塞安东尼奥帕斯率领的一支拉内罗斯军队，在越过奥里诺科平原和安第斯山脉时，突然袭击击败了西班牙人。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Archaeological evidence for the Old Babylonian school system suggests that scribal education was small-scale and usually took place in private homes. School tablets have been found in private residences in many sites across Mesopotamia. Some houses, where particularly large numbers of school tablets were unearthed, have been interpreted by archaeologists as "school houses" or homes in which scribal education almost certainly took place. The best example of this is House F in the city of Nippur. Nearly one and a half thousand fragments of tablets were found at this house. They date to the 17th century BCE (short chronology) (the early part of Samsu-iluna's reign), and the majority of them were students' school exercises. Two other possible "school houses" are located at the site of Ur. The first is a house called No. 7 Quiet Street, where a smaller number of school texts was found in situ and date to the late 18th or early 17th century BCE (short chronology) (reigns of Rim-Sin II or as late as Samsu-iluna year 11). The second is a house called No. 1 Broad Street, where a larger number of school tablets was discovered. Some texts from No. 1 Broad Street may date to as late as Samsu-iluna year 11 (1674 BCE short chronology, 1738 middle chronology). Unfortunately, it is unclear whether this house is the school texts' original place of use. Another Old Babylonian home in which scribal training took place is the house of a man named Ur-Utu, located in the ancient city of Sippar-Amnanum.
TEXT.Chinese: 苏美尔是最早出现的人类文明，苏美尔人也发明了最早的文字系统――“楔形文字”（Cuneiform）。楔形文字是因这种刻写于泥版上的文字的笔划形状而得名的。而存放这种文字泥版的“泥版书屋”（Edubba）也就成为古代美索不达米亚的学术教育中心。孩子们在泥版书屋中学习阅读、写作和数学。当他们完成在泥版书屋的学业之后，将会成为抄写员、作家或是科学家。每座古代美索不达米亚城市都有自己的泥版书屋，它不但起学校的作用，还被当作公共图书馆。泥版书屋作为最早向公众开放的学术机构而获得了不可磨灭的历史地位，同类机构并未在古埃及出现，直到4000年之后，希腊人和罗马人才开始效仿苏美尔人的做法。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The warriors of the Celtic tribes were widely feared by the inhabitants of the more civilized regions on the northern side of the Mediterranean. The Celts were known as tall, wild barbarians who fought with a savage fury. Conspicuous for their bravery, there are numerous accounts of Celts charging naked into battle with total disregard for their own safety. The Celts would often paint their bodies different colors to increase the intimidation factor. When clothed, the Celtic fighters wore brightly colored shirts and trousers, featuring striped or checkered patterns for decoration. They sometimes wore bronze helmets decorated with horns or wings in order to make themselves look even taller. The Celts were also head hunters, cutting off the heads of their defeated foes to serve as trophies. This was a way for a warrior to win great respect in Celtic society, and it may have served some religious purpose as well. The Romans were justifiably terrified of this practice and would often kill themselves rather than be taken captive by the Celts.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Celts are believed to have invented mail armor, which the Romans would adopt from them after the Gaulish sack of Rome in 390 BC. In battle, most Celtic warriors were probably equipped with spears, a simple weapon and easy to produce in large numbers. However, the Celts are much more famous for their use of large, two-handed iron swords. The Celts were the first to create these broadswords, which were used for slashing at the enemy (very different from the Roman short sword, which was entirely limited to stabbing). Celtic chieftains or other high-ranking figures were the ones most likely to carry these swords.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Celtic warriors were individually brave and fearsome fighters; however, they were also famously undisciplined. There was virtually no unit drill, and thus no unit cohesion: Celtic battles were wild melees in which every warrior fought as he thought best. Thus, while unmatched in personal combat, the Celtic warrior fared poorly against the group unity and strict discipline of the Roman legion.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Celtic tribes had almost no political unity either. Regarding each other with fear and suspicion and constantly engaged in petty internecine squabbles over territory, they were unable to pull together to face the approaching Roman threat. Facing this divided foe, General Julius Caesar was able to conquer Gaul in under a decade.
TEXT.Chinese: 地中海北部较文明地区的居民普遍害怕凯尔特部落的战士。凯尔特人被称为高大，野性野蛮人谁与野蛮的愤怒战斗。凯尔特人的勇敢是显而易见的，有很多关于他们赤身裸体冲向战场，完全不顾自身安全的报道。凯尔特人经常把自己的身体涂成不同的颜色，以增加恐吓因素。凯尔特人的战士们穿上色彩鲜艳的衬衫和裤子，以条纹或格子图案作为装饰。他们有时戴着青铜头盔，饰有角或翅膀，以使自己看起来更高。凯尔特人也是猎头，他们砍掉被击败的敌人的头作为战利品。这是一个战士在凯尔特人社会赢得尊敬的方式，它可能也有一些宗教目的。罗马人很有理由害怕这种做法，他们常常自杀，而不是被凯尔特人俘虏。（1段）凯尔特人被认为发明了盔甲，罗马人在公元前390年的罗马高卢大屠杀后就从他们身上收养。在战斗中，大多数凯尔特人战士可能都装备了长矛，一种简单的武器，很容易大量生产。然而，凯尔特人更著名的是他们使用大型，双手铁剑。凯尔特人是最早发明这种大刀的人，这种大刀是用来向敌人砍东西的（与罗马短剑非常不同，罗马短剑完全限于刺杀）。凯尔特酋长或其他高级人物是最有可能携带这些剑的人。[段落：1 ]凯尔特战士是个体勇敢和可怕的战士；然而，他们也是著名的无纪律的。几乎没有单位演习，因此也就没有单位凝聚力：凯尔特人的战斗是狂野的近战，每个战士都在战斗，因为他认为最好的。因此，尽管在个人战斗中是无与伦比的，但凯尔特战士对罗马军团的团结和严格纪律表现不佳。[段落：1 ]凯尔特部落几乎没有政治统一。面对彼此的恐惧和猜疑，不断地在领土问题上进行小规模的内部争吵，他们无法团结起来面对即将到来的罗马威胁。面对这个分裂的敌人，凯撒将军在不到十年的时间里就征服了高卢。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Temples in ancient Egypt were seen as the houses of gods to whom they were dedicated (or pharaoh whom they commemorated). Their architecture varied a lot over the large time span of Egyptian civilization, from small shrines in the Predynastic Period to the large complexes in the New Kingdom. Their most sacred part of an Egyptian temple was an inner sanctuary that housed the god's image. Access to the sanctuary was typically restricted to the priestly caste, but the rest of the temple was an important place in the daily life of Egyptian commoners. Many temples have survived to the current day and are now touristic assets for modern Egypt, as well as important archaeological sources for Egyptologists.
TEXT.Chinese: 古埃及的庙宇被视为供奉神（或法老）的殿宇。他们的建筑在埃及文明的大时间跨度内变化很大，从前王朝时期的小神殿到新王国时期的大型建筑群。他们在埃及庙宇中最神圣的部分是一个内部的圣所，里面有上帝的形象。进入圣所的通道通常仅限于祭司阶层，但圣殿的其余部分是埃及平民日常生活中的重要场所。许多寺庙至今仍保存下来，现在是现代埃及的旅游资产，也是埃及考古学家的重要考古资源。

TEXT.English: [H1]Somdet Phra Naresuan Maharat[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Siam[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1555 - 1605 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Somdet Phra Naresuan Maharat or Somdet Phra Sanphet II (1555, 25 April - 1605) was the King of the Ayutthaya kingdom from 1590 until his death in 1605. Naresuan was one of Siam's most revered monarchs as he was known for his campaigns to free Siam from Burmese rule. During his reign numerous wars were fought against Burma, and Siam reached its greatest territorial extent and influence.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]萨姆德特·弗拉·纳雷苏安·马哈拉特[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]暹罗国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]居住时间：[\BOLD]1555-1605年[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]从1590年到1605年去世，索姆德弗拉·纳雷苏安·马哈拉特（1555年，4月25日至1605年）是大城府王国的国王。纳瑞善是暹罗最受尊敬的君主之一，因为他为将暹罗从缅甸统治中解放出来而闻名。在他统治期间，许多战争都是针对缅甸的，暹罗达到了其最大的领土范围和影响。

TEXT.English: [TAB]There is evidence of surface mining dating back to prehistoric times. The first mining was probably for flint, which was used for knives, scrapers and arrowheads. The oldest known underground mine was in Swaziland over 40,000 years ago, to mine for ochre to use as a body pigment in ceremonies. During the Neolithic Age shafts were dug to extract flint from deeper in the earth. Gold, copper and silver were other minerals mined early in history.
TEXT.Chinese: 有证据表明露天采矿可以追溯到史前时代。第一次开采的可能是燧石，它被用来制造刀具、刮刀和箭头。已知最古老的地下矿藏是40000多年前在斯威士兰，开采赭石作为仪式上的身体色素。在新石器时代，人们挖掘竖井从地下深处提取燧石。金、铜和银是历史上早期开采的其他矿物。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A statesman is usually a politician, diplomat or other notable public figure who has had a long and respected career at the national or international level.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]政治家通常是政治家、外交家或其他著名的公众人物，在国家或国际一级有着长期而受人尊敬的职业生涯。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Himeji Castle is a hilltop Japanese castle complex located in Himeji in Hyogo Prefecture. The castle is regarded as the finest surviving example of prototypical Japanese castle architecture, comprising a network of 83 buildings with advanced defensive systems from the feudal period. The castle is frequently known as Hakurojou or Shirasagijou ("White Heron Castle") because of its brilliant white exterior and supposed resemblance to a bird taking flight.[PARAGRAPH:1]Himeji Castle dates to 1333, when Akamatsu Norimura built a fort on top of Himeyama hill. The fort was dismantled and rebuilt as Himeyama Castle in 1346, and then remodeled into Himeji Castle two centuries later. Himeji Castle was then significantly remodeled in 1581 by Toyotomi Hideyoshi, who added a three-story castle keep. In 1600, Tokugawa Ieyasu awarded the castle to Ikeda Terumasa for his help in the Battle of Sekigahara, and Ikeda completely rebuilt the castle from 1601 to 1609, expanding it into a large castle complex. Several buildings were later added to the castle complex by Honda Tadamasa from 1617 to 1618. For over 400 years, Himeji Castle has remained intact, even throughout the extensive bombing of Himeji in World War II, and natural disasters such as the 1995 Great Hanshin earthquake.[PARAGRAPH:1]Himeji Castle is the largest and most visited castle in Japan, and it was registered in 1993 as one of the first UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the country. The area within the middle moat of the castle complex is a designated Special Historic Site and five structures of the castle are also designated National Treasures. Along with Matsumoto Castle and Kumamoto Castle, Himeji Castle is considered one of Japan's three premier castles. In order to preserve the castle buildings, it is currently undergoing restoration work that is expected to continue for several years.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]姬陵城堡是位于兵库县姬陵的一座山顶日本城堡建筑群。这座城堡被认为是现存最优秀的典型日本城堡建筑，由83座具有封建时期先进防御系统的建筑组成。这座城堡经常被称为“Hakurjouu”或“Shirasagijou”（“白鹭城堡”），因为它有着明亮的白色外观，类似于鸟的飞行。[段：1 ] HeimeJiver城堡的日期为1333，当Akamatsu Norimura在喜马拉雅山山顶建造堡垒时。1346年，这座城堡被拆除并重建为喜马拉雅城堡，两个世纪后又被改建为喜马拉雅城堡。1581年，丰臣秀吉（Toyotomi Hideyoshi）对姬陵城堡进行了重大改造，增加了一座三层的城堡。1600年，德川家佑将这座城堡授予池田泰鲁马萨，以感谢他在石垣之战中的帮助，池田从1601年到1609年完全重建了这座城堡，并将其扩建为一座大型城堡建筑群。1617年至1618年，本田·塔达马萨（Honda Tadamasa）在城堡建筑群中增加了几座建筑。400多年来，在第二次世界大战期间Himeji的大规模轰炸和1995大阪神大地震等自然灾害期间，姬路城堡一直保持完整。[第1段]姬路城堡是日本最大、最受欢迎的城堡。1993年被联合国教科文组织列为全国首批世界遗产。城堡群中护城河区域是一处指定的特殊历史遗迹，城堡的五座建筑也被指定为国宝。与松本城堡和熊本城堡一样，姬陵被认为是日本三大城堡之一。为了保护城堡建筑，目前正在进行修复工作，预计将持续数年。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Palace of Versailles began life as a hunting lodge constructed at the instructions of King Louis XIII, who enjoyed hunting in the nearby woods. In 1660, his son Louis XIV decided to turn the "chateau" into a palace. Louis XIV took up residence in 1682, and construction on the palace was completed in 1688. During Louis' lifetime this huge, ungainly, and ornate building was not only his residence, but it also housed the royal court and central bureaucracy of France. Versailles is a complex of richly appointed buildings centered in one-and-a-half square miles of fine parkland. It is surrounded by beautiful fountains, statues, and magnificent formal gardens.[PARAGRAPH:1]At the very center of the palace was, of course, Louis' bedroom, a massive and ostentatious room. At the center of the bedroom was the Royal Bed, which was surrounded by a railing, suggesting that the king did indeed hold large audiences while reclining in the bed and needed a way to keep the visitors' fingers from messing up the royal linens.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Hall of Mirrors is another impressive room in Versailles. Over 200 feet in length and 30 feet wide, the hall contains 578 mirrors and 17 ornate windows. On the ceiling Louis had painted 30 pictures showing his many triumphs and the benefits of his rule.[PARAGRAPH:1]While appearing to many a massive exercise in royal excess, Louis had good reason for constructing Versailles; with one stroke he removed the nobility and bureaucracy from the intrigues of Paris and made them more immediately responsible to him. In this way he was able to render the once powerful nobility largely impotent; great families which had once battled each other for the throne of France now found themselves instead intriguing for the privilege of attending Louis' bath.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nonetheless, Versailles was, in fact, an extraordinarily expensive building. It has been estimated that maintaining the palace and its noble denizens consumed 6% of the entire French national budget. For a comparison, the United States' President's 2006 budget estimates that the US will take in about 2.2 trillion dollars in revenue in 2006. Six percent of that amount is 132 billion dollars.[PARAGRAPH:2]After the French Revolution and the dissolution of the monarchy, Versailles fell into disrepair and disuse. The German Army made the complex its headquarters after defeating France in the Franco-Prussian war in 1870. The building remained in decay until the 1960s, when Pierre Verlet conceived the bold idea of refurbishing Versailles to its glory days under Louis XIV. Since then the curators have managed to retrieve many of the original furnishings from across Europe.
TEXT.Chinese: 凡尔赛宫原本只是路易十三建造的猎宫，这位国王非常喜欢在附近的森林中狩猎。他的儿子路易十四在1660年决定将这座“城堡”改建为宫殿，并于1682年移驾此地，但整个工程却是在1688年完工。在路易十四有生之年，这一宏伟，庄严，华丽的建筑不仅是他的住处，同时还是法国的中央官僚机构的驻地。凡尔赛宫以一座占地1.5平方公里的，富丽堂皇的宫殿为中心。它的四周则是漂亮的喷泉、雕像以及华丽的花园。[PARAGRAPH:2]在宫殿的最中心是国王的卧室，这是一个庞大而又浮华的房间。在卧室的中央是国王的床，旁边则被栏杆围绕着，这意味着国王在此处接见臣下时，臣子们的手不能触碰到国王的卧具。[PARAGRAPH:2]镜厅是凡尔赛宫内另一个给人深刻印象的房间，它长达200英尺，宽达30英尺，其间有578面镜子和17面装饰华丽的窗户。路易十四让人在天花板上画了30幅壁画，用来夸耀自己的文治武功。[PARAGRAPH:2]尽管凡尔赛宫对于王室来说也太过豪华，但路易十四之所以这么做也有他自己的原因：他可以通过让贵族和官僚机构移居此地，从而一劳永逸地解决内部问题，让他们只对自己负责。他使原本强大的贵族势力变得软弱无力，曾经为争夺法王宝座而互相争斗的贵族现在发现他们只能通过讨好路易十四而获得特权。[PARAGRAPH:2]即使如此，凡尔赛宫也显得太过奢华。据估计，仅仅是维持凡尔赛宫及宫廷的正常运转就需要耗费法国国家预算的百分之六。与之相比，2006年度美国国家预算总额为2.2万亿美圆，百分之六就意味着1320亿美元。[PARAGRAPH:2]法国大革命以后，君主制土崩瓦解，凡尔赛宫则被废弃不用。德国人在1870年普法战争中击败法国后将此处作为陆军司令部。这一建筑直到20世纪60年代一直处于荒废状态，直到皮埃尔・维尔莱提出了翻修凡尔赛宫，让它重新焕发路易十四时代荣光的大胆设想。直到今日，凡尔赛博物馆已经从欧洲各地找回了原本保存于凡尔赛宫的大量馆藏品。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Human Genome Project (HGP) is an international scientific research project with the goal of determining the sequence of chemical base pairs which make up human DNA, and of identifying and mapping all of the genes of the human genome from both a physical and functional standpoint. It remains the world's largest collaborative biological project. The project was proposed and funded starting in 1984, the project got underway in 1990, and was declared complete in 2003.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]人类基因组计划（HGP）是一个国际性的科学研究项目，其目标是确定构成人类DNA的化学碱基对的序列，并从物理和功能的角度识别和定位人类基因组的所有基因。它仍然是世界上最大的生物合作项目。该项目于1984年提出并获得资助，1990年开始实施，2003年宣布竣工。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A mobad is a Zoroastrian cleric of a particular rank. Unlike a herbad (ervad), a mobed is qualified to serve as celebrant priest at the Yasna ceremony. A mobed is also qualified to train other priests.[PARAGRAPH:1]In general (lay) use, the term is also used as an honorific to denote any priest, of any rank. For instance, Hormizd I appointed Kartir moabadan-moabad, which is frequently translated as 'priest of priests', but more precisely indicates 'high priest of high priests'.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zoroastrian priests in India are required to be male, but women have been ordained in Iran and North America as a mobedyar, meaning a women mobed.
TEXT.Chinese: 摩巴德是一个特定等级的琐罗亚斯德教牧师。与赫拉德（ervad）不同，暴民有资格在雅斯纳仪式上担任庆祝牧师。一个牢笼也有资格训练其他祭司。[段落：1 ]一般来说，这个术语也被用来表示任何神职人员的尊称。例如，Hormizd我任命了卡蒂尔莫巴丹·穆巴德，他经常被翻译为“牧师牧师”，但更确切地说是“大祭司的大祭司”。[段落：1 ] Zoroastrian牧师在印度被要求是男性，但女性在伊朗和北美洲被任命为莫比达尔，这意味着一个女人的呻吟。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Madeireiros (Lumberjacks) are workers in the logging industry who perform the initial harvesting and transport of trees for ultimate processing into forest products. The term usually refers to a bygone era (before 1945 in the United States) when hand tools were used in harvesting trees. Because of its historical ties, the term lumberjack has become ingrained in popular culture through folklore, mass media and spectator sports. The actual work was difficult, dangerous, intermittent, low-paying, and primitive in living conditions, but the men built a traditional culture that celebrated strength, masculinity, confrontation with danger, and resistance to modernization.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]伐木工人（Madeireiros）是伐木行业的工人，他们最初收获和运输树木，最终加工成森林产品。这个词通常是指过去（1945年以前在美国）用手工工具收割树木的时代。由于其历史渊源，伐木工人一词已通过民间传说、大众媒体和观众体育活动在流行文化中根深蒂固。实际工作困难、危险、断断续续、报酬低、生活条件原始，但人们建立了一种崇尚力量、阳刚、对抗危险、抵抗现代化的传统文化。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Indonesian archipelago was reached by the Modern Man in 45.000 BC. A migration from Southeast asia around 2000 BC brought many new techniques, and in the 8th century BC, the Indonesian people mastered bronze casting, wet-field rice cultivation, megalithik practises and much more. This allowed villages, towns and small kingdoms to flourish by the 1st century AD. With the introduction of Buddhism and Hinduism came great monuments, and both the Saleindra and Medang kingdoms built large Hindu and Buddhist stupas commonly called Candis, including the large Borobudut and Prambanan. In the 7th century however, this small kingdom society were soon to come to an end with the rise of Sri Vijaya.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sri Vijaya was a Malay kingdom formed on the island of Sumatra that flourished on its trade and naval power. While not a state in modern sense, it was rather a confederacy form of society centered on the royal heartland and trading center of Palembang. Especially the trade trought the Starit of Malacca gained the country financial advantages, and by the end of the 7th century Sri Vijaya controlled numerous trade cities along both sides of the strait. Controlling both the Malacca and Sunda straits, they lived on as a formidable economy and naval power well into the 13th century, and their reign saw the height of the Buddhist influence in Indonesia.[PARAGRAPH:2]The decline of Sri Vijaya in the 13th century left many of the Islands with regional kingdoms, and when the kingdom of Singhasari emerged on Java, Kublai Khan sent emmisaries to demand tribute. The Majapahit kingdom, an original ally of Singhasari and also based on Java, allied with the mongols and defeated the Singhasari, but then turned against them and forced the mongol forces to withdraw in confusion. This marked the beginning of the second large Indonesian empire, the Majapahit. Majapahit reached its peak under Hayam Wuruk and his prime minister and commander Gajah Mada, and just a few years after Gajah Madas death, Hayam Wuruk conquered Palembang and ended Sri Vijaya rule in Indonesia. Although the Majapahit rulers extended their power over other islands and destroyed neighbouring kingdoms, their focus seems to have been on controlling and gaining a larger share of the commercial trade that passed through the archipelago. About the time Majapahit was founded, Muslim traders and proselytisers began entering the area.[PARAGRAPH:2]After Majahapits peak in the 14th century, Majapahit power began to decline and was unable to control the rising power of the Sultanate of Malacca. With an increased percantage of the population converting to Islam, the islands saw mostly muslim rule for the next centuries, with numerous different sultanates controlling the Islands.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the 16th century, sucsessful european invasions put the Sultanates to an end, with the Portuguese, Spanish, Dutch and British seeking to dominate the Spice trade from India and the 'Spice Islands' of Indonesia. In the early 16 century, the Portuguese manged to control the trade, but in 1602 the Dutch parliament awarded the Dutch East-India Company with a monoploy on all trade and colonial activities in Indonesia at a time before the company controlled any territory in there. In the early 20th century, the monopoly was compleated and the boundaries of modern Indonesia was created. It was also in this period that the first Indoneasian national movement started, basing their idea of one Indonesian nation on Sri Vijaya and Majapahit.[PARAGRAPH:2]During World War II, Japan extended their Pacific empire to far away lands, including Indonesia. With the Dutch losing control of the archipelago, Indonesia decleared independance 2 days after Japans defeat and the and of the war. This marked the beginning if modern day Indonesia, and the first president, Sukarno, was elected. He introduced a form of democracy he called the 'Old Order', claiming that western democracy would not work in Indonesia. Although his methods worked in the beginning, he relied more and more on support from the Indonesian communist party, the PKI, which was the largest communist party outside of China and Soviet. With the party gaining more and more power, the militarya and the islamic groups, the other two major powers in Indonesia, got worried, and with the army did everything they could to weaken Sukarno. In March 1967, Sukarno were forced to abdicate and the Provisional People's Consultative Assembly named the army general Suharto as Acting President.[PARAGRAPH:2]Suharto brought many changes with him during his "New Order", which he named his goverment to differ it from Sukartos "Old Order", and early in his reign he invaded Papua after negotiations with the Dutch about the territory faied. The invasion was however easily repelled, and Suharto then gave them the "Act of Free Choice". After learning the Papuan representaions Indonesia, they were threatened and bribed to vote in Indonesias favor, and the transfer were confirmed by a UN General Assembly meeting. During his period he also transmigrated peole from the overpopluated areas to the more underpopulated islands, stating that this was for the good of the economy and industry and to give the poor a chance and he annexed the earlier Portuguese region East-Timor. During his reign Indonesia also became of OPEC, short for Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, due to large amounts of oil found in the area, something that helped Indonesias wealth, even when corruption was pretty usual during his reign.[PARAGRAPH:2]Within a few years, however, many of its original allies had become indifferent or averse to the New Order, which comprised a military faction supported by a narrow civilian group. Among much of the pro-democracy movement which forced Suharto to resign in the Indonesian 1998 Revolution and then gained power, the term "New Order" has come to be used pejoratively.[PARAGRAPH:2]Indonesia today is a country with much history. It granted independence to East-Timor in 2002, and its economy is growing. In 2004 a massive earthquake and tsunami devasted parts of Northern Sumatra, particulary the Aceh region. The same year Susilo Bambang won the first direct presidental election, and he was re-elected in 2009 to a second term. This shows that Indoneasia is on its way into a stable and democratic country, and the possiblity for them raising again as a power in Southeast Asia is still there.
TEXT.Chinese: [TAB]现代人于公元前45.000年到达印度尼西亚群岛。公元前2000年左右从东南亚移徙带来了许多新技术，在公元前8世纪，印度尼西亚人民掌握了青铜铸造，湿地水稻种植，巨石技术等等。这使乡村，城镇和小王国在公元1世纪之前蓬勃发展。随着佛教和印度教的传入，伟大的纪念碑出现了，萨林德拉王国和棉兰王国都建造了大型的印度教和佛塔，通常称为坎迪斯，包括大型的婆罗浮屠和巴兰班南。然而，到了7世纪，这个小型王国社会很快就随着Sri Vijaya的兴起而终结。[PARAGRAPH：2：1] Sri Vijaya是苏门答腊岛上建立的一个马来王国，其贸易和海军事业蓬勃发展功率。虽然不是现代意义上的国家，但它是以皇家心脏地带和巨港贸易中心为中心的一种邦联社会形式。尤其是贸易战使马六甲的Starit获得了该国的金融优势，到了7世纪末，Sri Vijaya控制了海峡两岸的许多贸易城市。他们控制着马六甲海峡和Sun达海峡，到13世纪一直以强大的经济和海军实力为生，他们的统治时期见证了印度尼西亚佛教徒的影响力的增强。[PARAGRAPH：2：1] 13世纪，许多岛屿都留下了区域王国，而当辛哈萨里王国在爪哇岛出现时，忽必烈汗便派出了使馆供奉。 Majapahit王国是Singhasari的原始盟友，也是基于Java的，它与蒙古结盟并击败了Singhasari，但随后与他们抗衡并迫使蒙古部队混乱地撤退。这标志着印度尼西亚第二大帝国玛雅帕希特（Majapahit）的开始。玛雅帕希（Majapahit）在哈亚姆·武鲁克（Hayam Wuruk）和他的总理兼指挥官加亚·马达（Gajah Mada）领导下达到顶峰，仅在盖亚·马达斯（Gajah Madas）死后几年，哈亚姆·武鲁克（Hayam Wuruk）征服了巨港（Palembang），并结束了斯里维贾亚（Sri Vijaya）在印度尼西亚的统治。尽管玛雅帕希特统治者将权力扩大到其他岛屿并摧毁了邻近的王国，但他们的重点似乎一直是控制和获得通过该群岛的商业贸易中的更大份额。大约在建立马贾帕希特（Majapahit）时，穆斯林商人和传教士就开始进入该地区。[PARAGRAPH：2：1]在14世纪Majahapits高峰之后，Majapahit的权力开始下降，无法控制马六甲苏丹国的崛起。随着越来越多的人口lam依伊斯兰教，这些岛在接下来的几个世纪中几乎都是穆斯林统治，许多不同的苏丹国控制着这些岛屿。[PARAGRAPH：2：1]在16世纪，成功的欧洲入侵使苏丹国沦为最后，葡萄牙，西班牙，荷兰和英国试图占领印度和印度尼西亚“香料群岛”的香料贸易。在16世纪初期，葡萄牙人控制了贸易，但在1602年，荷兰议会授予荷兰东印度公司对印度尼西亚所有贸易和殖民活动的专营权，当时该公司控制了印尼的任何领土。在20世纪初期，垄断得以完成，现代印度尼西亚的边界得以建立。也是在此期间，第一次印尼民族运动开始了，他们将印尼民族的思想建立在斯里维贾亚和马贾帕希特上。[PARAGRAPH：2：1]在第二次世界大战期间，日本将太平洋帝国扩展到了遥远的土地，包括印度尼西亚。随着荷兰人失去对群岛的控制，印度尼西亚在日本战败和战争结束后2天取消了独立。这标志着今天印度尼西亚和第一任总统苏加诺（Sukarno）当选的开始。他介绍了一种民主形式，他称之为“旧秩序”，声称西方民主在印度尼西亚将行不通。尽管他的方法从一开始就行之有效，但他越来越依赖印尼共产党PKI的支持，该党是中国和苏维埃以外最大的共产党。随着该党获得越来越多的权力，印度尼西亚的另外两个主要大国军政府和伊斯兰团体感到担忧，并且随着军队竭尽所能削弱苏加诺。 1967年3月，苏加诺被迫退位，临时人民协商会议任命苏哈托陆军将军为代理总统。[段]：2：1]苏哈托在他的“新秩序”期间给他带来了许多变化，他将政府命名为与苏加托斯的《旧秩序》有所不同，在他统治初期，他与荷兰人就领土问题谈判之后入侵了巴布亚。但是入侵很容易被击退，苏哈托随后给了他们“自由选择行为”。在了解了印度尼西亚的巴布亚代表之后，他们受到威胁并受贿以赢得印度尼西亚的赞成，联合国大会一次会议确认了这一移交。在他任职期间，他还从人满为患的地区迁移了皮欧列岛，说这是为了经济和工业的利益，并为穷人提供了机会，他吞并了葡萄牙早期的东帝汶地区。在位期间，印度尼西亚还成为石油输出国组织（OPEC）的简称，这是该地区发现的大量石油的原因，尽管该国在位期间腐败很普遍，但由于该地区发现了大量石油，这也有助于印尼的财富。[PARAGRAPH：2：1然而，在短短的几年内，它的许多原始盟友变得对新秩序漠不关心或厌恶，该新秩序包括一个由狭窄的平民团体支持的军事派别。在迫使苏哈托于1998年印度尼西亚革命中辞职并获得政权的多数民主运动中，“新秩序”一词已被贬义使用。[PARAGRAPH：2：1]今天的印度尼西亚是一个国家历史。它于2002年授予东帝汶独立，其经济正在增长。 2004年，一场大地震和海啸摧毁了苏门答腊北部地区，尤其是亚齐地区。同年，苏西洛·班邦（Susilo Bambang）赢得了第一次直接总统选举，他于2009年再次当选连任。这表明印度尼西亚正在进入一个稳定和民主的国家，他们在东南亚再次成为大国的可能性仍然存在。[PARAGRAPH：1]

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Apollo Program was an ambitious project to put a man on the moon. The program was conceived of in the late 1950s by United State officials who were appalled at the Soviet Union's lead in the space race. In 1961, President John F. Kennedy stated before a joint session of Congress, "I believe that this nation should commit itself to achieving the goal, before this decade is out, of landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to the Earth."[PARAGRAPH:1]There is some speculation about whether President Kennedy himself actually believed in the project; some say that he had serious questions about the cost and scientific feasibility, and that his proposal was mostly a public relations gimmick to raise America's spirits in the face of the perceived Soviet space threat. But America's imagination was fired by the project, and work proceeded with speed.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Apollo Program's managers had to overcome an incredible number of daunting scientific and engineering challenges to succeed. The journey involved many separate phases: ascent from Earth, travel from the Earth to the Moon, descent to the Moon and return to Lunar orbit, followed by the journey back to Earth, and then down to Earth's surface. This required a vehicle with many different capabilities that remained light enough to be put into orbit by the rockets available at the time. (The problem was akin to trying to create a combination submarine, all-terrain vehicle and airplane that could be towed by a Volkswagen Beetle.)[PARAGRAPH:1]That the Apollo Program succeeded and a man walked on the moon in 1969 is an incredible testament to the ingenuity, courage and persistence shown by the dedicated men and women involved.
TEXT.Chinese: 阿波罗计划是一项雄心勃勃的计划，目的是把一个人送上月球。这个计划是由美国官员在20世纪50年代末构思的，他们对苏联在太空竞赛中的领先地位感到震惊。1961，John F. Kennedy总统在国会联席会议上说：“我相信，在这个十年结束之前，这个国家应该致力于实现一个目标：将一个人登上月球并安全地返回地球。”[段落：1 ]有人猜测甘乃迪总统本人是否真的相信这一点。有人说，他对成本和科学可行性提出了严重的问题，他的提议主要是一个公共关系的噱头，目的是在苏联太空威胁面前提升美国的精神。但是美国的想象力被这个项目激发了，工作也在加速。[段落：1 ]阿波罗计划的管理者必须克服令人难以置信的艰巨的科学和工程挑战，才能成功。这次旅行包括许多不同的阶段：从地球上升，从地球到月球，下降到月球并返回月球轨道，然后返回地球，然后再下降到地球表面。这就需要一种具有许多不同能力的飞行器，这种飞行器的重量足够轻，能够被当时可用的火箭送入轨道。（问题是试图制造一个组合潜艇，全地形车和飞机可以被大众甲虫拖走）[段落：1 ]阿波罗计划成功，1969人登上月球，这是一个令人难以置信的遗嘱，证明了敬业的男性和女性所表现出的创造力、勇气和毅力。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The lion (Panthera leo) is one of the five big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae. With some males exceeding 250 kg (550 lb) in weight, it is the second-largest living cat after the tiger. Wild lions currently exist in sub-Saharan Africa and in Asia (where an endangered remnant population resides in Gir Forest National Park in India) while other types of lions have disappeared from North Africa and Southwest Asia in historic times. Until the late Pleistocene, about 10,000 years ago, the lion was the most widespread large land mammal after humans. They were found in most of Africa, across Eurasia from western Europe to India, and in the Americas from the Yukon to Peru. The lion is a vulnerable species, having seen a major population decline in its African range of 30-50% per two decades during the second half of the 20th century. Lion populations are untenable outside designated reserves and national parks. Although the cause of the decline is not fully understood, habitat loss and conflicts with humans are currently the greatest causes of concern. Within Africa, the West African lion population is particularly endangered.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lions live for 10-14 years in the wild, while in captivity they can live longer than 20 years. In the wild, males seldom live longer than 10 years, as injuries sustained from continual fighting with rival males greatly reduce their longevity. They typically inhabit savanna and grassland, although they may take to bush and forest. Lions are unusually social compared to other cats. A pride of lions consists of related females and offspring and a small number of adult males. Groups of female lions typically hunt together, preying mostly on large ungulates. Lions are apex and keystone predators, although they are also expert scavengers obtaining over 50 percent of their food by scavenging as opportunity allows. While lions do not typically hunt humans, some have been known to do so. Sleeping mainly during the day, lions are primarily nocturnal, although bordering on crepuscular in nature.[PARAGRAPH:1]Highly distinctive, the male lion is easily recognised by its mane, and its face is one of the most widely recognised animal symbols in human culture. Depictions have existed from the Upper Paleolithic period, with carvings and paintings from the Lascaux and Chauvet Caves, through virtually all ancient and medieval cultures where they once occurred. It has been extensively depicted in sculptures, in paintings, on national flags, and in contemporary films and literature. Lions have been kept in menageries since the time of the Roman Empire, and have been a key species sought for exhibition in zoos over the world since the late eighteenth century. Zoos are cooperating worldwide in breeding programs for the endangered Asiatic subspecies.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]狮子（Panthera leo）是Panthera属的五种大型猫科动物之一，也是猫科动物。它的雄性体重超过250公斤（550磅），是仅次于老虎的第二大活猫。野生狮子目前存在于撒哈拉以南非洲和亚洲（印度吉尔森林国家公园内有一个濒临灭绝的残存种群），而其他类型的狮子在历史时期已经从北非和南亚消失。直到晚更新世，大约10000年前，狮子是继人类之后分布最广的大型陆地哺乳动物。它们分布在非洲大部分地区，横跨欧亚大陆，从西欧到印度，从育空到秘鲁，分布在美洲。狮子是一种易受伤害的物种，在20世纪下半叶，它的非洲范围内每20年减少30-50%的数量。在指定的保护区和国家公园之外，狮子的数量是无法维持的。虽然下降的原因还不完全清楚，但栖息地的丧失和与人类的冲突是目前最令人担忧的原因。在非洲，西非狮子种群尤其濒危。[段落：1 ]狮子在野外生活10到14年，而在圈养中，狮子可以活到20岁以上。在野外，雄性很少能活到10岁以上，因为与竞争对手不断搏斗而受伤，大大缩短了它们的寿命。它们通常栖息在稀树草原和草原上，尽管它们可能会生长在灌木丛和森林中。与其他猫相比，狮子是不寻常的群居动物。狮子群的骄傲由相关的雌性和后代以及少量成年雄性组成。成群的雌性狮子通常一起捕猎，主要捕食大型有蹄类动物。狮子是顶级和关键的掠食者，尽管它们也是专业的食腐动物，在机会允许的情况下通过食腐获得超过50%的食物。虽然狮子通常不会猎杀人类，但有些狮子已经知道会猎杀人类。主要是白天睡觉，狮子主要是夜间活动的，虽然在自然界中与黄昏接壤。[段落：1 ]非常独特，雄性狮子很容易被它的鬃毛识别，它的脸是人类文化中最被广泛认可的动物符号之一。从旧石器时代晚期开始就有了描绘，从拉斯科和查维特洞穴雕刻和绘画，几乎贯穿了所有古代和中世纪文化，在那里它们曾经出现过。它在雕塑、绘画、国旗、当代电影和文学中都有广泛的描绘。狮子自罗马帝国时期起就被饲养在动物园里，自18世纪末以来，狮子一直是世界各地动物园里寻找的一种重要物种。动物园正在世界范围内合作开展濒危亚洲亚种的繁殖计划。

TEXT.English: [H1]Vatavelli[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Possible Leader in Harappa[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] Unknown[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The script of the Indus Valley Civilization (IVC) has not yet been decrypted, not even do we know what kind of language they have spoken. Indian nationalists claim that the Aryans where a local tribe that was present even before the IVC flourished, while Dravidians claim that aryan invaders, coming either from modern-days Persia or central Asia, destroyed the dravidian IVC and pushing their people to the south.[NEWLINE]The presence of Brahui, a dravidian language in Afghanistan and Pakistan, far away from other dravidian language, is regarded as a proof for the latter hypothesis. Another evidence is Elam language, an extinct language in western Iran, which shows dravidian characteristics and is sometimes regarded as a dravidian language; this would proof that the dravidian languages where spoken in a much more broader area than today, covering India, Pakistan, Afghanistan and even a fair part of Iran.[PARAGRAPH:2]However, finnish indologist and sindhologist Asko Parpola claims to have decriphed the Indus Script based on the assumptions that it is in fact an early dravidian language. If it can be verified, the script reveales names of stars which can also be used to name people, like Meymin, Pakumin and Vatavelli.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although some houses were larger than others, Indus Civilization cities were remarkable for their apparent, if relative, egalitarianism. All the houses had access to water and drainage facilities; this gives the impression of a society with relatively low wealth concentration, though clear social leveling is seen in personal adornments. Some scientist even say that the IVC is the first known Democracy, 2000 years before the Athenians.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1] VATAVELIL[\NURLY] [Brang]在哈拉帕的可能领导者[Brut] [NealLe] [Brd]：[\Brut]未知[NealLe] [NealLe] [Brut]背景：[Burd]（段落：1）印度河流域文明（IVC）的脚本尚未解密，甚至不知道我们所说的是哪种语言。印度民族主义者声称，雅利安人是一个当地部落的所在地，甚至在IVC繁荣之前就已经存在，而德拉威人则声称，雅利安入侵者，来自现代波斯或中亚，摧毁了德拉威人IVC，并把他们的人民推向南方巴基斯坦，远离其他德拉威语，被认为是后一种假设的证明。另一个证据是Elam语言，这是伊朗西部的一种灭绝的语言，它显示了德拉威人的特征，有时被认为是德拉维甸语，这将证明德拉维甸语在比今天更广的范围内说话，覆盖印度、巴基斯坦、阿富汗甚至伊朗的一个公平部分。芬兰印支语言学家和信德语言学家Asko Parpola声称，基于其事实上是早期德拉威语的假设，印度河文字已经被废除。如果它可以被证实，脚本揭示的星星的名字也可以用来命名人，如Meymin，Pakumin和瓦塔维利。[段落：2 ]虽然有些房子比其他房子，印度文明城市是显着的，因为他们明显的，如果相对，平均主义。所有的房子都有供水和排水设施；这给人的印象是一个财富集中度相对较低的社会，尽管在个人装饰上可以看到明显的社会水平。一些科学家甚至说，试管婴儿是第一个已知的民主国家，比雅典人早2000年。

TEXT.English: [H1]Abi al-Arab Yaarub bin Omar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Malik of Oman[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] ?[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Little is known about Nabhani (of Bani Nabhan bedouin tribe) kings of Oman. In general, they are considered tyrants. Abi al-Arab Yaruub bin Omar is one of the few names known today, praised by the poet Al-Satali for his appreciation of knowledge, science, scholars, and scientists.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Abi al-Arab Yaarub bin Omar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Malik of Oman[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] ?[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Little is known about Nabhani (of Bani Nabhan bedouin tribe) kings of Oman. In general, they are considered tyrants. Abi al-Arab Yaruub bin Omar is one of the few names known today, praised by the poet Al-Satali for his appreciation of knowledge, science, scholars, and scientists.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Albion Legion or British Legion were foreign volunteer units that fought under Simón Bolívar against Spain for the independence of Colombia, Venezuela, Ecuador, and Peru. They were composed of over seven thousand volunteers, mainly Napoleonic War veterans from Great Britain and Ireland, as well as some German veterans and some locals recruited after arriving in South America. Volunteers in the British Legion were motivated by a combination of both genuine political and mercenary motives.[PARAGRAPH:1]Their greatest achievements were at Boyacá (1819), Carabobo (1821), and Pichincha (1822), which secured independence for Colombia, Venezuela and Ecuador. They also took part of the last major campaign of the Independence wars, culminating in the Battle of Ayacucho in Peru (1824), which marked the end of the Spanish rule in South America. The British Legions fought until the end of the wars, their number much depleted.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]阿尔比恩军团或英国军团是外国志愿军，在西蒙博利瓦尔统治下为哥伦比亚、委内瑞拉、厄瓜多尔和秘鲁的独立与西班牙作战。他们由七千多名志愿者组成，主要是来自英国和爱尔兰的拿破仑战争老兵，还有一些德国老兵和一些到达南美后招募的当地人。英国军团的志愿者是由真正的政治和雇佣军动机结合而来的。[段落：1 ]他们的最大成就是在博伊卡（1819）、卡拉波波（1821）和皮钦查（1822），这为哥伦比亚、委内瑞拉和厄瓜多尔获得了独立。他们还参加了独立战争的最后一次主要战役，最终在秘鲁的阿亚库乔战役（1824年）结束，这标志着西班牙在南美洲的统治结束。英国军团一直战斗到战争结束，他们的兵力消耗殆尽。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A 'square,' in urban planning, is a large open space in the middle of a city, placed at an intersection of transportation lanes, but considerably larger than is strictly required for the needs of the intersection itself.[PARAGRAPH:2]Virtually all inhabited cities of significant size have recognizable large, 'main streets' that evolved either by deliberate advance planning, or by natural flow of traffic forcing builders to leave wide paths for goods and travelers. The sides of these streets are generally extremely attractive to business owners, advertisers, street vendors, and the like. However, while such operations are an economic necessity to the life of the city, allowing them to operate freely would tend to block the flow of traffic. One solution to this problem is the creation of 'squares,' large flat areas free of major construction. In such a square, merchants can set up shop freely on a temporary basis, vendors can wander, and the general population can mingle.[PARAGRAPH:2]As squares become more established and enshrined in a city's culture, it is common for some of them to be repurposed. Monumental architecture in the square is likely to get much attention, so it becomes a favorite place to construct statues and memorials. In some cities, a particular square may be placed in front of the royal palace, or in another key political location, from which political leadership can address the masses... or in which the masses themselves can directly discuss the issues. This serves to strengthen the ties between the general public and the ruling elite, and creates a stronger sense of collective 'ownership' of the state, even when the state itself is a totalitarian dictatorship.
TEXT.Chinese: 城市规划中的“广场”是一个位于城市中心的大开敞空间，位于交通车道的交叉口，但比交叉路口本身所需的要大得多。[第2段]几乎所有有着显著规模的居住城市都有可识别的大型“主街道”。通过深思熟虑的预先计划，或通过自然的交通流迫使建筑商为货物和旅客留下宽阔的道路。这些街道的两侧通常对企业主、广告商、街头摊贩等极为吸引人。然而，尽管此类运营是城市生活的经济必需品，但允许它们自由运营往往会阻碍交通流量。解决这个问题的一个办法是创建“正方形”，即没有主要建筑的大平面区域。在这样一个广场上，商人可以在临时的基础上自由地开店，摊贩可以漫步，一般的人口可以混合。[段落：2 ]广场在城市的文化中变得更加牢固和庄严，有些人可以重新使用。广场上的纪念性建筑很可能会引起人们的注意，因此它成为建造雕像和纪念物的最受欢迎的地方。在一些城市，一个特别的广场可以放在皇宫前，或者放在另一个重要的政治场所，政治领导可以从这里向群众发表讲话。。。或者群众自己可以直接讨论的问题。这有助于加强普通民众与统治精英之间的联系，并产生更强烈的国家集体“所有权”意识，即使国家本身是一个极权独裁政权。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Historically an estate comprises the houses and outbuildings and supporting farmland and woods that surround the gardens and grounds of a very large property, such as a country house or mansion. It is the modern term for a manor, but lacks the latter's now abolished jurisdictional authority. It is an "estate" because the profits from its produce and rents are sufficient to support the household in the house at its center, formerly known as the manor house. Thus "the estate" may refer to all other cottages and villages in the same ownership as the mansion itself, covering more than one former manor. Examples of such great estates are Woburn Abbey in Bedfordshire, England, and Blenheim Palace, Oxfordshire built to replace the former manor house of Woodstock.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]从历史上看，房地产包括房屋和附属建筑，以及围绕着花园和大型房地产（如乡村住宅或豪宅）地面的配套农田和树林。这是一个庄园的现代术语，但缺少后者现在已经废除的管辖权。这是一个“地产”，因为其生产和租金的利润足以支撑其中心的房子（以前称为庄园）。因此，“庄园”可以指与豪宅同一所有权的所有其他农舍和村庄，包括一个以上的前庄园。英国贝德福德郡的沃本修道院（Woburn Abbey）和牛津郡的布伦海姆宫（Blenheim Palace）就是这样一个伟大的庄园，它们是为了取代伍德斯托克庄园（manor house of Woodstock）而建造的。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Zoroastrianism or Mazdaism is known as one of the world's oldest monotheistic religions. It was once the official religion of Sassanid Persia and played an important role in Achaemenid times. The prophet Zarathushtra, commonly known in the West as Zoroaster, lived in Persia no earlier than 1700 BC and no later than 600 BC, although Plato believed that Zoroaster lived some 6000 years previous to himself. Zoroastrianism is uniquely important in the history of religion because of its formative links to both Western Abrahamic and Eastern Dharmic religious traditions. Zoroaster's writings suggest a metaphysical dualism, but devotional monotheism, requiring adherence to Ahura Mazda. Many modern scholars believe that Zoroastrianism had a large influence on Judaism, Mithraism, Manichaeism, and Christianity because of Persia's connections to the Roman Empire and because of its earlier control over Israel under rulers such as Cyrus II the Great, Darius the Great and Xerxes I.[PARAGRAPH:2]When the Sassanid dynasty came into power in Iran in 228 AD, they aggressively promoted their Zoroastrian religion. During periods when the Sassanids captured provinces held by the Romans, they often built fire temples there. During periods of Sassanid suzernity over Armenia, the Persians made attempts to promote the religion there as well. By the 6th century, Zoroastrianism had spread to northern China via the Silk Road, gaining official status in a number of Chinese states. Zoroastrian temples still remained in Kaifeng and Zhenjiang as late as the 1130s, but by the 13th century the religion had faded from prominence in China.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the 7th century, the Sassanid dynasty was conquered by Muslim Arabs. Zoroastrianism, which was once dominant in a region stretching from Anatolia to Persian Gulf and Central Asia, did not have a powerful foreign champion as Christianity did in the Byzantine Empire, and so steadily lost influence and adherents in Iran under Muslim rule. Iranian Zoroastrians fled to India in large numbers, where they were offered refuge on condition that they abstain from missionary activities and marry only in their community. Although these strictures are centuries old, Parsis of the 21st century still do not accept converts and are endogamous. Zoroastrians in Iran are still persecuted by that nation's theocratic rulers, but even today one can find Zoroastrian communities living and practicing their faith there, such as in the province of Yazd, Kerman and Tehran.
TEXT.Chinese: 琐罗亚斯德教或玛兹岱教被称为世界上最古老的一神教之一。它曾是萨珊王朝波斯的官方宗教，在阿契美尼德时代发挥了重要作用。先知萨拉图斯特拉，在西方俗称琐罗亚斯德，生活在波斯不早于公元前1700年，不迟于公元前600年，尽管柏拉图认为琐罗亚斯德生活在他自己之前约6000年。琐罗亚斯德教在宗教史上具有独特的重要性，因为它与西方亚伯拉罕和东方达摩宗教传统都有着形成性的联系。琐罗亚斯德的著作暗示了一种形而上学的二元论，但虔诚的一神论，要求遵守阿胡拉马自达。许多现代学者认为琐罗亚斯德教对犹太教、密特拉教、摩尼教和基督教有很大的影响，因为波斯与罗马帝国的关系，以及由于赛勒斯、Darius the Great、Xerxes I.等统治者在萨珊王朝掌权时对早期统治的控制[段落：2 ]。公元228年，他们在伊朗大力宣传他们的琐罗亚斯德教。在萨珊王朝攻占罗马人控制的省份期间，他们经常在那里建造火神庙。在萨珊王朝统治亚美尼亚期间，波斯人也曾试图在那里推广宗教。到了6世纪，琐罗亚斯德教通过丝绸之路传播到中国北方，在许多中国国家获得官方地位。琐罗亚斯德教寺庙在11世纪30年代末仍然留在开封和镇江，但到了十三世纪，宗教就从中国的日珥中消失了。[段落：2 ]七世纪，萨满王朝被穆斯林阿拉伯人征服。琐罗亚斯德教曾经在从安纳托利亚到波斯湾和中亚的一个地区占主导地位，但它没有像基督教在拜占庭帝国那样拥有强大的外国拥护者，因此在穆斯林统治下，在伊朗逐渐失去了影响力和追随者。伊朗的琐罗亚斯德教徒大批逃往印度，在那里他们得到庇护，条件是他们不从事传教活动，只在自己的社区结婚。尽管这些限制已经存在了几个世纪，但21世纪的牧师仍然不接受皈依者，而且是内婚制的。伊朗的琐罗亚斯德教仍然受到该国神权统治者的迫害，但即使在今天，人们仍然可以发现琐罗亚斯德教社区在那里生活和实践他们的信仰，例如在亚兹德省、科尔曼省和德黑兰。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Manhattan Project was the code name for a joint project undertaken by the United States, Great Britain and Canada during World War II, the objective being to build an atomic weapon before Germany. While various laboratories had been independently studying nuclear physics for a number of years, the Manhattan Project would be on an entirely different scale; hundreds of the allies' top scientists and engineers were, along with their families, taken to various secret locations around the country where they would stay until the project succeeded.[PARAGRAPH:1]Working conditions were extremely primitive and security was incredibly tight. The United States Army was in overall charge of the Manhattan Project, while the scientists remained in control over the actual research. The scope of the Manhattan Project was immense, and it involved solving some of the most difficult scientific and engineering projects of the day. The men and women, a collection of soldiers and scientists, endured harsh conditions and physical and mental exhaustion, which were compounded by security so tight that many never saw the outside of the base on which they were stationed. They were sustained by their patriotism and by fear of what would happen to them, their families, and their countries if Germany created the bomb first.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually, of course, the effort paid off. By the middle of 1945 the US had two working atomic bombs. Germany, the original target, had already surrendered, but Japan was still in the fight. The two weapons were dropped on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki early in August, and the Japanese Empire surrendered shortly thereafter.[PARAGRAPH:1]From our perspective some decades later, it isn't clear whether the Manhattan Project helped to save the world for democracy or brought it closer to fiery destruction. But the men and women involved believed they were fighting to stop a terrible dictatorship from gaining a new weapon and destroying everything they loved, and they were willing to sacrifice everything to succeed.
TEXT.Chinese: 曼哈顿工程是二次世界大战期间由美国，英国和加拿大共同进行的一项研发计划的代号，其目标是抢在德国之前制造出核武器。虽然在此之前已经有许多实验室独立开展原子物理学研究，但是其规模完全无法与曼哈顿工程相比；数百名同盟国中顶尖的科学家，工程师以及他们的家人都必须集中到与世隔绝的秘密地点，直到计划完成才得以重见天日。[PARAGRAPH:1]当时的工作条件极其艰苦，安全管制也极其严格。曼哈顿工程的管理由美国军方全权负责，科学家们则负责具体的研究工作。曼哈顿工程所涉及的领域非常广阔，需要解决数量极大且难度极高的科学和工程学问题。无数军队士兵和科学家们忍受着艰苦的环境，生理和心理上的疲惫。安全管制是如此的严格，许多人自参加该项目后甚至从未走出秘密基地一步。支持他们继续工作的动力在于他们的爱国热情，以及对于德国人首先造出核武器并危及他们的家人和国家的忧心。[PARAGRAPH:1]当然最终，所有的努力都获得了回报。到1945年中，美国已经拥有了两枚实用的原子弹。而其原定的打击目标德国则已经投降，但是日本仍然在负隅顽抗。于是在八月初，两枚原子弹分别投掷到了广岛和长崎，此后不久日本帝国即宣布投降。[PARAGRAPH:1]在数十年后的今天我们仍然无法确定，曼哈顿工程究竟是拯救了民主世界，还是会最终将其毁灭。但是对于当年的无数工程参与者来说，为了能够制止恐怖独裁者获得新式武器毁灭一切的野心，他们不惜付出任何的代价。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A village is a clustered human settlement or community, larger than a hamlet with the population ranging from a few hundred to a few thousands (sometimes tens of thousands), Though often located in rural areas, the term urban village is also applied to certain urban neighbourhoods, such as the West Village in Manhattan, New York City and the Saifi Village in Beirut, Lebanon, as well as Hampstead Village in the London conurbation. Villages are normally permanent, with fixed dwellings; however, transient villages can occur. Further, the dwellings of a village are fairly close to one another, not scattered broadly over the landscape, as a dispersed settlement.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]村庄是一个人类聚居区或社区，比人口从几百人到几千人（有时数万人）的小村庄还要大，虽然通常位于农村地区，但“城市村庄”一词也适用于某些城市社区，如曼哈顿的西村、纽约市和位于黎巴嫩贝鲁特的赛菲村，以及位于伦敦的汉普斯特德村。村庄通常是永久性的，有固定的住所；但是，也可能出现临时村庄。此外，村庄的住宅彼此相当接近，不像分散的居民点那样分散在整个景观上。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Australia, officially the Commonwealth of Australia, is a country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands. It is the world's sixth-largest country by total area. Neighbouring countries include Indonesia, East Timor and Papua New Guinea to the north; the Solomon Islands and Vanuatu to the north-east; and New Zealand to the south-east.[NEWLINE][TAB]For at least 40,000 years before the first British settlement in the late 18th century, Australia was inhabited by indigenous Australians, who spoke languages grouped into roughly 250 language groups. After the European discovery of the continent by Dutch explorers in 1606, Australia's eastern half was claimed by Great Britain in 1770 and initially settled through penal transportation to the colony of New South Wales from 26 January 1788. The population grew steadily in subsequent decades; the continent was explored and an additional five self-governing Crown Colonies were established.[NEWLINE][TAB]On 1 January 1901, the six colonies federated, forming the Commonwealth of Australia. Since Federation, Australia has maintained a stable liberal democratic political system that functions as a federal parliamentary democracy and constitutional monarchy. The federation comprises six states and several territories. The population of 23.1 million is highly urbanised and heavily concentrated in the eastern states.[NEWLINE][TAB]Australia is a developed country and one of the wealthiest in the world, with the world's 12th-largest economy. In 2012 Australia had the world's fifth-highest per capita income, Australia's military expenditure is the world's 13th-largest. With the second-highest human development index globally, Australia ranks highly in many international comparisons of national performance, such as quality of life, health, education, economic freedom, and the protection of civil liberties and political rights. Australia is a member of the United Nations, G20, Commonwealth of Nations, ANZUS, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), World Trade Organization, Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation, and the Pacific Islands Forum.
TEXT.Chinese: 澳大利亚，正式称为澳大利亚联邦，是一个由澳大利亚大陆、塔斯马尼亚岛和许多较小岛屿组成的国家。它是世界上总面积第六大的国家。其邻国包括印度尼西亚、东帝汶和巴布亚新几内亚北部；东北部的所罗门群岛和瓦努阿图；东南部的新西兰，他们说的语言分为大约250个语言组。1606年，荷兰探险家在欧洲发现了澳大利亚大陆，1770年英国宣布了澳大利亚东半部的主权，并于1788年1月26日通过刑事运输到新南威尔士殖民地定居下来。在随后的几十年里，人口稳步增长；对该大陆进行了勘探，并建立了另外五个自治的皇家殖民地。[NEWLINE][TAB]1901年1月1日，六个殖民地联合起来，组成了澳大利亚联邦。自联邦成立以来，澳大利亚一直保持着稳定的自由民主政治体制，其功能是联邦议会民主和君主立宪制。联邦由六个州和几个地区组成。2310万人口高度城市化，高度集中在东部各州。2012年澳大利亚人均收入居世界第五，澳大利亚军费开支居世界第13位。作为全球第二高的人类发展指数，澳大利亚在许多国家表现的国际比较中名列前茅，例如生活质量、健康、教育、经济自由以及公民自由和政治权利的保护。澳大利亚是联合国、20国集团、英联邦、澳新银行、经济合作与发展组织（经合组织）、世界贸易组织、亚太经济合作组织和太平洋岛屿论坛的成员国。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A supercomputer is a computer with a high level of performance compared to a general-purpose computer. The performance of a supercomputer is commonly measured in floating-point operations per second (FLOPS) instead of million instructions per second (MIPS). Since 2017, there are supercomputers which can perform over a hundred quadrillion FLOPS. Since November 2017, all of the world's fastest 500 supercomputers run Linux-based operating systems. Additional research is being conducted in China, the United States, the European Union, Taiwan and Japan to build even faster, more powerful and more technologically superior exascale supercomputers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Supercomputers play an important role in the field of computational science, and are used for a wide range of computationally intensive tasks in various fields, including quantum mechanics, weather forecasting, climate research, oil and gas exploration, molecular modeling (computing the structures and properties of chemical compounds, biological macromolecules, polymers, and crystals), and physical simulations (such as simulations of the early moments of the universe, airplane and spacecraft aerodynamics, the detonation of nuclear weapons, and nuclear fusion). Throughout their history, they have been essential in the field of cryptanalysis.[PARAGRAPH:2]Supercomputers were introduced in the 1960s, and for several decades the fastest were made by Seymour Cray at Control Data Corporation (CDC), Cray Research and subsequent companies bearing his name or monogram. The first such machines were highly tuned conventional designs that ran faster than their more general-purpose contemporaries. Through the 1960s, they began to add increasing amounts of parallelism with one to four processors being typical. From the 1970s, vector processors operating on large arrays of data came to dominate. A notable example is the highly successful Cray-1 of 1976. Vector computers remained the dominant design into the 1990s. From then until today, massively parallel supercomputers with tens of thousands of off-the-shelf processors became the norm.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]与通用计算机相比，超级计算机是一种高性能的计算机。超级计算机的性能通常用每秒浮点运算（FLOPS）来衡量，而不是用每秒一百万条指令（MIPS）来衡量。自2017以来，超级计算机的运算能力超过了100亿次。自2017年11月以来，全球最快的500台超级计算机都运行基于Linux的操作系统。中国、美国、欧盟、台湾和日本正在进行更多的研究，以建设更快速、更强大和更技术上优越的超级计算机。〔2〕超级计算机在计算科学领域起着重要的作用，并被广泛应用于各种领域的计算密集型任务，包括量子力学、天气预报、气候研究、油气勘探、分子模拟（计算化合物、生物大分子、聚合物和晶体的结构和性质），以及物理模拟（例如宇宙早期时刻的模拟、飞机和航天器的空气动力学、核武器的爆炸和核聚变）。在他们的历史中，他们一直是密码分析领域的关键。[段落：2 ]超级计算机在20世纪60年代被引入，几十年来最快的是由Seymour Cray在控制数据公司（CDC）、克雷研究所和后来的公司所持有的名字或字母。第一批这样的机器是经过高度调整的传统设计，比同时代的通用机器运行得更快。到了20世纪60年代，它们开始增加越来越多的并行性，其中一到四个处理器是典型的。从20世纪70年代起，在大数据阵列上运行的矢量处理器开始占据主导地位。一个显著的例子是1976年非常成功的Cray-1。矢量计算机在20世纪90年代一直是主导设计，从那时起到今天，拥有数万个现成处理器的大规模并行超级计算机成为常态。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Customs House is an organization responsible for collecting taxes on imports or exports, as well as for seizing contraband. Customs Houses were common during the Age of Sail, when the level of trade skyrocketed and the necessity for a centralized system of tax collection arose. In Spain, with the huge influx of wealth from the New World, Sevilla was designated the "Customs City" where all transports carrying Incan or Aztec gold were required to land so that the Crown could take its share. Tariffs became a hotly-debated topic in the New World, especially in the English colonies, where tariffs would fan the flames of several of that region's most violent conflicts.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]海关是负责对进出口货物征税和查封违禁品的机构。在航海时代，海关是很普遍的，当时贸易水平猛增，需要建立一个集中的税收系统。在西班牙，随着来自新大陆的大量财富涌入，塞维利亚被指定为“海关城市”，所有载有印加或阿兹特克黄金的运输工具都必须在这里降落，这样国王才能分得一杯羹。关税在新世界成为一个激烈争论的话题，特别是在英国殖民地，关税会煽起该地区几场最激烈冲突的火焰。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Janissaries were an elite fighting force of infantry raised by the Ottoman sultans. They formed the sultan's household troops and bodyguard, eventually rising to a position of enormous influence before being disbanded in the nineteenth century. Murad I founded the Janissary corps around 1330; the troops were made up of non-Muslim boys who were captured in battle or bought as slaves and brought up as warriors. This was very similar to the Mameluk slave soldiers of Egypt, who may have been the inspiration for the Janissaries. Janissaries became the first infantry units in the Ottoman military forces, because at the time no free man would consent to fighting on foot.[PARAGRAPH:1]After 1380 the system for recruiting new soldiers into the Janissaries became standardized through a process called the "devshirmeh:" this was basically a "human tax" where each community had to contribute a certain number of young boys to the state. In practice these were almost always Christian slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]The boys were sequestered in special barracks, where they would be converted to Islam and trained to become elite soldiers (a process very similar to that practiced by the Spartans of ancient Greece). Although slaves, the Janissaries received special privileges, including the right to bear weapons and higher pay than other soldiers. Although the Janissaries began their existence as a small bodyguard for the sultan, in time they came to comprise much of the Ottoman army, topping out at over 200,000 men at some points.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Janissaries originally were trained to be expert archers, but once firearms were invented they quickly adopted the new weapons, becoming fiercely proficient with muskets. They usually used axes or sabres for melee combat. Janissaries were present at all of the major battles in the early history of the Ottoman Empire, including the Siege of Constantinople in 1453.[PARAGRAPH:1]The very success of the Janissaries would eventually destroy them. Realizing their importance, they began demanding higher pay, threatening rebellion if their demands were refused. Their first rebellion took place in 1449, and it was followed by many more. By the eighteenth century, the Janissaries dominated the government. Through frequent palace coups they changed sultans as they wished, and they blocked much-needed modernization reforms in the Ottoman army. Many of the Janissaries became corrupted, no longer training for battle but instead pursuing commercial ventures or political office, and the weakness of the Ottomans in the face of Russian and Austrian expansion soon became obvious to all. Desperate to regain control of their country, the Ottoman rulers made determined efforts to eradicate them.[PARAGRAPH:1]Finally, in 1826 Mahmud II was able to form a non-Janissary army strong enough to challenge the Janissaries. The Janissaries did not go down peacefully, and Mahmud II had to use artillery to shell the Janissaries' barracks and batter them into submission. This event - known as the "Auspicious Incident," ended the Janissaries. Their characteristic marching music is the only trace of them that remains today.
TEXT.Chinese: 苏丹亲兵（Janissary）是奥斯曼帝国苏丹下令组建的精锐步兵部队，最初是作为苏丹的帖身卫士，其势力和影响在日后变得越来越大，最终于19世纪被解散。穆拉德一世于1330年左右首次组建苏丹亲兵部队；其成员均为在战争中俘获、或是被卖作奴隶的非穆斯林男童经过专门训练而成。这种做法与埃及的奴隶战士“马穆鲁克”非常类似，很可能是受到后者的启发。苏丹亲兵是奥斯曼军队的第一支步兵部队，因为当时的奥斯曼自由人均不愿步行作战。[PARAGRAPH:2]1380年以后，苏丹亲兵的训练方式已成为固定的制度，称为“人税”（devshirmeh），每个村社都必须向帝国提供规定数量的男童。实际上“人税”通常都是卖为奴隶的基督徒。[PARAGRAPH:2]这些男童将被送往与世隔绝的特殊兵营，在那里他们必须改奉伊斯兰教，接受成为精锐战士的严格训练（训练方式与古希腊的斯巴达人非常相似）。虽然身为奴隶，苏丹亲兵也拥有许多特殊待遇，他们有权在平时佩带武器，薪金也比普通士兵高得多。这支起初作为苏丹帖身卫士的部队人数很少，但逐渐发展成为奥斯曼军队的主要组成部分，其人数曾经多达200,000人。[PARAGRAPH:2]苏丹亲兵部队起初接受的是成为优秀弓箭手的训练，但随着火器的引入，他们很快接受了这类新式武器，能够熟练地使用火枪。他们通常使用手斧和弯刀进行肉搏战。苏丹亲兵参加了奥斯曼帝国前期的所有重要战役，包括1453年围攻君士坦丁堡。[PARAGRAPH:2]苏丹亲兵的战功也导致了他们日后的毁灭。他们开始倚仗自己的力量要求更高的报酬，一旦得不到满足就威胁发动叛乱。首次苏丹亲兵叛乱发生于1449年，此后类似的叛乱层出不穷。到了18世纪，苏丹亲兵几乎掌控了帝国政府。他们甚至多次发动宫庭政变，拥立符合自己利益的新苏丹，并阻挠奥斯曼军队进行现代化改造的努力。苏丹亲兵部队的许多成员都变得腐化堕落，他们不再专心于军事训练，转而从事商业或政治活动，奥斯曼军队在面对俄国和奥地利军队时逐渐显露出明显的劣势。为了收回对国政的控制权，奥斯曼苏丹终于决定消灭这股力量。[PARAGRAPH:2]到1826年，穆拉德二世已经组建起一支足以同苏丹亲兵相抗衡的新军。苏丹亲兵不愿放弃现有利益，穆拉德二世不得不下令炮轰他们的兵营，迫使其就范。这一事件史称“吉祥事变”，苏丹亲兵部队就此解散。只剩下那一段富于特色的进行曲流传至今。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "bunker" is often used to denote military bomb shelters, often those housing high officials of the military and government. As shown in the second United States-Iraq War, a country with air dominance over a foe can do significant amounts of damage to a city with just a few bombs. Military and political leaders are prime targets for such attacks; often these officials will be protected in bunkers far below city streets. Bunkers are also used to protect communications networks, another important target.[PARAGRAPH:1]Any improvement in defense usually sparks an improvement in offensive weapons. The United States is building special "bunker-buster" bombs, designed to burrow deep into the ground before exploding. While such bombs may not destroy the deepest bunkers, they can cut off their communications, escape routes and air supply.
TEXT.Chinese: 地堡通常表示军用防弹掩体，它们是为军方和政府的高层服务的。就像第二次美国――伊拉克战争中表现出的那样，拥有绝对制空权的一方可以用少量炸弹造成敌人的严重损失。而军方和政府首脑通常是空中打击的首要目标；所以这些官员必须在城市地表下接受地堡的保护。地堡还要用来保护另一个重要目标――通信网络。[PARAGRAPH:1]但任何防御上的提高必然面临攻击武器性能的提升。美国已经开发出了“地堡终结者”，它可以在穿透地层到达目标后才爆炸。但即使是这种炸弹也无法摧毁那些深入地下的掩体，只能通过切断其通信，迂回进路及空气来源而使它们失去作用。

TEXT.English: [TAB]A lighthouse is a tower constructed on the shoreline, usually near a harbor or busy waterway. A powerful light sits atop the tower, making the structure visible to mariners for miles around. Lighthouses are built to mark the location of rocks and shoals or other hazards in the dead of night or midst of storms. Before the invention of radar, electricity, and global positioning systems, any vessel sailing near the shore ran a risk of running into such hazards and sinking. Naturally, sailors preferred to sail to destinations that had a method of marking these perils, so harbors with lighthouses flourished.[PARAGRAPH:1]The original "lighthouse" was probably a bonfire lit by villagers to guide the village's fishing vessels back to harbor at night. Over time people realized that the fires could be seen much farther away if they were built atop platforms or towers. Further improvements were made as technology advanced; mirrors were built to direct the light in the desired directions; oil lamps replaced the more dangerous bonfires, which were in turn replaced by electric lamps.
TEXT.Chinese: 灯塔是建造在海岸线上的一座塔，一般位于毗邻海港或者繁忙的航线上。塔顶发出醒目的光，使数十英里范围内的船员都可以看到。建造灯塔是为了在漆黑的夜里或者暴风雨中标示暗礁，浅滩或其他危险的地方。在雷达，电和全球定位系统发明以前，近海航行的船只都要冒着沉没或搁浅的巨大风险。自然的，海员更倾向于航行在那些标记了危险地段的线路上，因此，建有灯塔的海港变得繁荣起来。[PARAGRAPH:1]最初的灯塔大概就是村民们为了引导晚归渔船安全回港燃起的篝火。时光流逝，人们认识到如果把火放在平台或者塔的顶上，那么很远都可以看得见。随着技术的进步，灯塔逐步升级换代；镜子被用来把光引导到预期的方向；油灯取代了危险的篝火，后来又被电灯取代。

TEXT.English: [TAB]An apothecary is the name of a person who researches and creates herbal medicines (it's also the name of his business establishment). In ancient Persia, the practice of medicine was split between two professions. The "ashpiu" was a sort of sorcerer or witch-doctor, who determined the spiritual cause of the ailment and prescribed the religious and magical rituals necessary for a cure. The ashpiu could also refer the patient to an apothecary or "asu," a combination of pharmacist and physician, who would provide the necessary medicines and treatments to cure the ailment.[PARAGRAPH:1]Persia stood atop one of the great trading crossroads of the world, and their apothecaries had access to medicines and procedures from Africa, Europe, and Asia. And though like anywhere else there was much superstition and misinformation about disease and how best to treat it, Persian medicine was among the most advanced in the ancient world.
TEXT.Chinese: [标签]药剂师是研究和创造草药的人的名字（也是他的企业名称）。在古代波斯，行医分为两种职业。“阿什庇”是一种巫师或巫医，他决定了疾病的精神原因，并规定了宗教和魔法仪式所必需的治疗。阿什庇也可以把病人交给药剂师或“ASU”，这是药剂师和医生的结合，他们将提供必要的药物和治疗来治疗疾病。[第1段]波斯站在世界上最大的贸易十字路口之一，他们的药剂师可以从非洲获得药品和程序。欧洲和亚洲。尽管和其他地方一样，对疾病和如何最好地治疗疾病有很多迷信和错误的信息，波斯医学是古代世界最先进的医学之一。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Espionage or, casually, spying involves a government, company/firm or individual obtaining information considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information. Espionage is inherently clandestine, as it is taken for granted that it is unwelcome and in many cases illegal and punishable by law. It is a subset of "intelligence gathering", which otherwise may be conducted from public sources and using perfectly legal and ethical means. It is crucial to distinguish espionage from "intelligence" gathering, as the latter does not necessarily involve espionage, but often collates open-source information.[PARAGRAPH:1]Espionage is often part of an institutional effort by a government or commercial concern. However, the term is generally associated with state spying on potential or actual enemies primarily for military purposes. Spying involving corporations is known as industrial espionage.[PARAGRAPH:1]One of the most effective ways to gather data and information about the enemy (or potential enemy) is by infiltrating the enemy's ranks. This is the job of the spy (espionage agent). Spies can bring back all sorts of information concerning the size and strength of an enemy army. They can also find dissidents within the enemy's forces and influence them to defect. In times of crisis, spies can also be used to steal technology and to sabotage the enemy in various ways. Counterintelligence operatives can feed false information to enemy spies, protecting important domestic secrets, and preventing attempts at subversion. Nearly every country has very strict laws concerning espionage, and the penalty for being caught is often severe. However, the benefits that can be gained through espionage are generally great enough that most governments and many large corporations make use of it to varying degrees.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]间谍活动或偶然的间谍活动涉及政府、公司/公司或个人未经信息持有人的许可，获取被视为机密或机密的信息。间谍活动本质上是秘密的，因为人们理所当然地认为它是不受欢迎的，而且在许多情况下是非法的，可以依法惩处。它是“情报收集”的一个子集，否则可以从公共来源进行，并使用完美的法律和道德手段。将间谍活动与“情报”收集区分开来是至关重要的，因为后者不一定涉及间谍活动，而是经常整理开源信息。[第1段]间谍活动通常是政府或商业关注的机构努力的一部分。然而，这一术语通常与国家主要出于军事目的对潜在或实际敌人进行间谍活动有关。涉及企业的间谍活动被称为工业间谍活动。[段落：1 ]收集敌人（或潜在敌人）的数据和信息的最有效的方法之一是渗透敌人的队伍。这是间谍（间谍）的工作。间谍可以带回有关敌军规模和兵力的各种情报。他们还可以在敌人的军队中找到持不同政见者，并影响他们叛变。在危机时期，间谍还可以用来窃取技术和以各种方式破坏敌人。反间谍人员可以向敌方间谍提供虚假情报，保护重要的国内机密，防止颠覆企图。几乎每个国家对间谍活动都有非常严格的法律，被抓的惩罚往往很严厉。然而，通过间谍活动所能获得的好处通常是巨大的，以至于大多数政府和许多大公司都不同程度地利用了它。

TEXT.English: [TAB]In physical geography, tundra is a biome where the tree growth is hindered by low temperatures and short growing seasons. The term tundra comes through Russian from the Kildin Sami word tundâr "uplands," "treeless mountain tract." There are three types of tundra: Arctic tundra, alpine tundra, and Antarctic tundra. In tundra, the vegetation is composed of dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens. Scattered trees grow in some tundra. The ecotone (or ecological boundary region) between the tundra and the forest is known as the tree line or timberline.
TEXT.Chinese: [表]在自然地理学中，冻土带是一个生物群落，其树木生长受到低温和短生长季节的阻碍。苔原一词源于俄语Kildin-Sami单词tundar“高地”，“无树山地”，有三种类型的苔原：北极苔原，高山苔原和南极苔原。在冻土带，植被由矮小的灌木、莎草和草、苔藓和地衣组成。一些苔原上长着零散的树。冻土带和森林之间的过渡带（或生态边界区）被称为树木线或森林线。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term Moors has referred to several historic and modern populations of Berber, Black African and Arab descent from Northern Africa, who came to conquer, occupy and rule the Iberian Peninsula for nearly 800 years. At that time they were Muslim, although earlier the people had followed other religions. They called the territory Al Andalus, comprising most of what is now Spain and Portugal.[PARAGRAPH:2]Moors are not a distinct or self-defined people. Medieval and early modern Europeans applied the name primarily to Berbers, but also at various times to Arabs, Muslim Iberians and West Africans from Mali and Niger who had been absorbed into the Almoravid dynasty. Mainstream scholars observed in 1911 that "The term 'Moors' has no real ethnological value."[PARAGRAPH:2]The Andalusian Moors of the late Medieval era inhabited the Iberian Peninsula after the Moorish conquests of the Rashidun and Umayyad Caliphates, and the final Umayyad conquest of Hispania. The Moors' rule stretched at times as far as modern-day Mauritania, West African countries, and the Senegal River. Earlier, the Classical Romans interacted with (and later conquered) parts of Mauretania, a state that covered northern portions of modern Morocco and much of north western and central Algeria during the classical period. The people of the region were noted in Classical literature as the Mauri.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term Mauri, or variations, was later used by European traders and explorers of the 16th to 18th centuries to designate ethnic Berber and Arab groups speaking the Hassaniya Arabic dialect. Today such groups inhabit Mauritania and parts of Algeria, western Sahara, Morocco, Niger and Mali. Speakers of European languages have historically designated a number of associated ethnic groups as "Moors". In modern Iberia, the term is applied to people of Moroccan ethnicity living in Europe. "Moor" is sometimes colloquially applied to any person from North Africa. Some people to whom it is applied consider the term pejorative and racist.
TEXT.Chinese: “摩尔人”一词指的是来自北非的柏柏尔人、非洲黑人和阿拉伯人后裔的几个历史和现代人，他们征服、占领和统治伊比利亚半岛将近800年。当时他们是穆斯林，尽管早些时候人们信奉其他宗教。他们称该领土为“安达卢斯”，包括现在西班牙和葡萄牙的大部分。[段落：2 ]摩尔人不是一个独特的或自我定义的人。中世纪和现代早期的欧洲人主要把这个名字用在柏柏尔人身上，但也在不同时期用在阿拉伯人、穆斯林伊比利亚人和来自马里和尼日尔的西非人身上，他们被阿尔莫拉维德王朝吸收。主流学者在1911中观察到，“摩尔人”一词没有真正的民族学价值。（段落：2）中世纪后期安达卢西亚的摩尔人居住在伊比利亚半岛上，在摩尔人征服Rashidun和Umayyad Caliphates之后，最后的乌马耶德征服了Hispania。摩尔人的统治有时延伸到现代的毛里塔尼亚、西非国家和塞内加尔河。早些时候，古罗马人与莫瑞塔尼亚的部分地区互动（后来被征服），莫瑞塔尼亚是一个国家，在古典时期覆盖了现代摩洛哥北部以及阿尔及利亚西北部和中部的大部分地区。该地区的人在古典文学中被称为Mauri。[段落：2 ] Mauri这个词，或变奏曲，后来被欧洲商人和探险家们用了第十六到第十八个世纪来指定Berber和阿拉伯族群，讲阿拉伯语阿拉伯语。如今，这些群体居住在毛里塔尼亚和阿尔及利亚、西撒哈拉、摩洛哥、尼日尔和马里的部分地区。讲欧洲语言的人历来把一些相关的族群称为“摩尔人”。在现代伊比利亚，这一术语适用于居住在欧洲的摩洛哥人。”“摩尔”一词有时通俗地用于北非的任何人。有些人认为这个词带有贬义和种族主义色彩。

TEXT.English: [TAB]Constructed sometime around 1000 BC, the site of Petra in Jordan is among the most famous examples of rock-cut architecture in the world. Numerous intricately carved structures were cut into the sandstone walls of the desert canyons surrounding the area, as Petra came to serve as the capital city for the once-nomadic Nabataen people. The most famous of these structures, the Al Khazneh or "The Treasury," has been featured in numerous major motion pictures, notably a prominent role in "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade" when the Al Khazneh was used to represent the location of the Holy Grail.
TEXT.Chinese: 【TAB】约旦佩特拉遗址建于公元前1000年左右，是世界上最著名的岩壁建筑之一。当佩特拉成为曾经游牧的纳巴坦人的首都时，无数复杂的雕刻结构被切割成了该地区周围沙漠峡谷的砂岩墙。这些建筑中最著名的是哈兹尼或“财政部”，曾出现在许多大型电影中，尤其是在《印第安纳琼斯与最后的十字军东征》中，哈兹尼被用来代表圣杯的位置。

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Rozwi were a fierce tribe of warriors in Southern Africa. After the Portuguese Imperialist had overthrown the Mutapan Kingship in Zimbabwe, the Rozwi Warriors rose up against the foreign invaders, driving the Portuguese back to the coastline and regaining control of the Zimbabwean Empire. [PARAGRAPH:1]The Rozwi Warriors were powerful even with the use of firearms and with bow and arrow defeated the gun equipped Imperialists. The Rozwi Warriors were expert military strategists whom are believed to have used the cow-horn formation years before the Great Zulu leader Shaka had. Without the use of guns and cannons, but spears and bows and arrows, the aggressive Rozwi drove back the European Imperialists.
